review_body: Sean and the entire team at Wyndham Garden are the utmost hospitality professionals. Attentive, genuine, helpful, charming, and all sincerely kind. I’ve stayed here numerous times but recently just as the quarantine was hitting NYC. The staff were so accommodating and calm. I’m a huge fan and will sing their praises to Wyndham corporate until they cough up some bonuses for this incredible hospitality squad that represents the true meaning of warm hearted generous service. And are an amazingly beautiful representatives for Wyndham.

My boyfriend and I really needed a staycation during this Covid19 crisis and this property did not disappoint. The front desk upgraded us to a room with an amazing skyline view and couldn't be more accomodating. We were so happy, in fact, that we extended our stay for an additional night. Kudos to the front desk staff who were extremely helpful and asking if we needed anything any time we were in the lobby. Much gratitude to the cleaning staff and housekeeping staff who kept the building immaculate and also provided extra towels and pillows. If you find yourself in NYC, this hotel is a real treat. The view from our room (1604) is nothing short of amazing. NYC is going through some trying times and Chinatown has been hit especially hard. If you have a chance to visit the city, this Wyndham property is a gem you won't want to miss...the location is fantastic for getting around the city and the staff makes this place a real standout.

Sean Sy, front desk MOD at the time of my brief visit, was very kind. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels over the years, including this particular one. Anyway, was in the neighborhood and needed a place to sit and charge my phone for 15 minutes this afternoon. Sean was very welcoming and accommodating,and I thank him and Wyndham for the hospitality.Jeff Yeck3476709093
user_name:
Jeffrey Y
New York City, New York

review_body: Lovely view from the 10th floor and the front desk manager Sean helped me out in a time of panic. Very clean, safe and the views are amazing. Floor to ceiling windows make it possible to view the skyline as you fall asleep. Excellent location away from tourist mania of Time Square with all the best restaurants, SoHo and the LES at your doorstep.

Absolutely loving staff service. This is my second time staying in Wyndham, their services never fail to amaze me! Totally would recommend. Lovely view of the New York City, the ramen place downstairs is absolutely delicious.

It was a quick getaway for us which we were happy to experience. We stayed at the Wyndham in the lower east side. The staff was so friendly and personable, not like most hotels we frequent. They were so helpful with local restaurants and our car service to and from the hotel. I guess the one item that stands out is how often they were cleaning all areas when we were in the lobby. Its reassuring in retrospect and most appreciated. We hope to visit again soon.

We love the Wyndham Garden Chinatown and we're planning on staying there again in our upcoming visit, but we had to cancel due to the virus. The Guest Services Manager Sean Sy helped us reschedule our stay and provided kind, excellent service. He's one of the reasons we love staying there, besides the modern rooms and amenities, and coonvenient location. Just wanted to hop on here and thank him personally.

I'm finally getting the opportunity to express my thanks to the entire team which took exceptional care of our group. It was great of everyone to pull in together and accommodate us with the early arrival. The reception desk never said no to any of our needs.
user_name:
zhanggeorge418
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hotel is in a prime location Lower Eastside of Manhattan. Very convenient to dining and shopping. Hotel staff is wonderful and the rooftop bar is amazing! Rooms have great views of the City, and some have balconies. Will definitly stay here again.

I stay here frequently and really enjoy it. The staff, Sean and all the team, are very kind and take great care of me. The rooms are very smartly designed and appointed. The location is very convenient to all downtown spots - financial district, soho, lower east side, etc.

Sean and the team are extremely friendly, helpful and give me good recommendation. I have stayed there for more than 2 months, I enjoyed my stay. I will definetly returning again and recommend to my friends.
user_name:
Elaine L
New York City, New York

review_body: Decent hotel. But had to mention the lovely hotel maid from Guyana, Kumarie. Excellent chats and very kind. Hotel is well located for Chinatown and lower Manhattan. Subway is close by as well. Walkable to downtown business district and wtc.

Sean and Stacey were both super amazing! They made me feel extremely welcome the moment I arrived. Saw to my needs of an upgrade with no problem. They really made my stay worth wild, even in the short time I spent with them.

Hotel is in Chinatown. Safe area, close to Grand Street station, restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Hotel is clean and staff are helpful. Rooms are comfortable, with coffee maker and fridge. Windows can open. Would recommend.

Great location and awesome views from the rooms. If you don't leave the hote..no worries, the food/beverage there are great! Any issues you have, the staff are always eager to help correct. Great service

The location is ideal. I have always loved chinatown. It gave me more time to experience the flow.Everything about the hotel was fine. We stay in various hotels for the hell of it.This is our favorite.

I had a second floor room with access to a terrace outside my roomEfficient check inVery comfortable bedLovely bathroom Decent coffee maker in roomRefrigeratorSuper friendly staff both at check in and doing the rooms. Rooftop bar with reasonable pricesOnly 5 mins walk from manhattan bridgeDid not eat at the hotel but looked pleasantI would stay again without questionFair price

Had a great time at The Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Here to visit family and enjoyed a nice, clean and quiet room. The view of The Empire State building was fantastic. Breakfast was good and the food outlets are good. Rooftop has great drinks and views. The staff was warm and friendly. Housekeepers were very friendly and helpful with whatever I needed. Gilbert at the front desk was extremely helpful with directions and recommendations. Katra the hooka lounge recommendation was spot on. I definitely had a great time and the price was amazing. I have to come again. This place is great!

Nice clean place. Location is good, near Little Italy and Soho. Clean rooms. Staff is very good. Gilbert at the front desk was pleasant and professional every time we saw him. Good recommendation for a nice restaurant in times Square. Thank You!. Overall a good place for a good price. Good Value.

A nice hotel overall, clean and well maintained. Free WiFi, complimentary water and a nice shop by the desk to pick up any additional treats. I particularly liked the restaurant selections as there were several. I would definitely stay here again on business or pleasure. Subway around the corner was a huge plus as was the staff.

This hotel is a pearl! This is our second stay here and we definitly stay here next time too! . Everything suits us perfectly. The staff is very friendly and helpful. And the view from our room is just amazing!

Our small group was on the fence between the Wyndham and another boutique hotel, looks like we made the right choice. The team was very attentive to all our needs and to the best of my knowledge not a single person in our tough group complained. The Beer Garden was great to unwind. I look forward to our next excursion.

We have stayed in this hotel a few times and last time, the supervisor Jose was really kind with us, and he make shure our staying there was good, also helps us with recomendacions for food close to the place and helped us any time ...

Loved the area and the hotel staff was amazing. Really helped me with anything I needed and made my experience amazing with the one I love. They accommodated me with all my needs and the food here was very good. The bar downstairs is a great place to hang.

The staff at the WGC are so accommodating and so welcoming. They make sure I feel welcome every time I am in town as well as any of our new employees who stay with them during our new employee onboarding sessions.

This marks my third visit to the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. I had great but short stay. Can't say enough about the front desk team, Stacey, Ray and Gilbert, always helpful and personable. The team at Shinka, such great comfort food.

Jose was the receptionist at the time. He was amazing. Listened to everything my girlfriend and I had to say and helped us with our concerns. My experience was great because of him and I will definitely be returning! Thank you

Jose was wonderful! I came in with my boyfriend and Jose made sure we got a beautiful room with a wonderful balcony. He was extremely pleasant and has made our experience ten times better. Most definitely will return. Thank you!

An excellent place to stay in downtown New York City. Kind and friendly staff. The windows are big which is great. Very clean and an excellent location between Chinatown and the lower East Side. I highly recommend it.

From the moment we arrived at JFK all the way through our entire stay, things were just on point. Got a super nice yellow taxi driver who gave us advice on sites to see outside of what we already had planned during our visit. When we arrived at the hotel, things got even better as we were allowed to check in early at no extra charge and we were upgraded by Stacie. She was so personable and friendly. Our room had probably the best view I've ever had in NYC, room was clean and sizeable. The rooftop bar was excellent, everyone we encountered was just friendly. We were really happy with our little get this weekend and hope to be back soon. We left during the parade and it was just a happy kind of vipe everywhere.

Great location, lots of restaurants plus the atmosphere of Naples and Hong Kong. People, restaurants, streets vegetable stalls, not stuffy like mid town. Great views of manhattan and convenient subway stops.

Nice hotel with very attentive staff, clean rooms with the best views of NYC. The sports bar was not my scene but the food was decent. My only gripe was my shower with a glass partition in place of a curtain which didn't really work. Service was great and that's always more important in the end.

If you like variety at your choice of hotel, look no further. These chaps have no less than 3 outlets to enjoy a good cocktail or brew. The hotel is in the lower east side close to Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown. I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked this deal but I was pleasantly surprised. The service was superb. I would definitely come back. Cheers.

A smooth business trip at the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown. People were most helpful and well informed on best local eats. My only gripe was the restaurant wasn't open for lunch, not convenient when it's raining, still I would recommend a visit.
user_name:
lidavid094
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: No room service available, the listed parking is actually a block away. Also had an upgraded room, but if that was an upgrade I would have hated the actual room. On a positive note, the person at the front desk when we checked in was very helpful.

Sean and Nadine were very hospitable. Clean room and bathroom. Easy to walk to everything in Chinatown and little Italy. Beautiful view from rooftop bar. I’ll definitely stay here again when coming to Manhattan

My girlfriend and I stayed here for her Bday weekend. Upon arrival Sean and Nadine was super cool greeted us with a smile and handshakes....we got there at 1 but check in was at 3 but he got us in early and got us an upgrade with a room with balcony! We left to get a bottle of champagne when we got back there were two drink tickets for us thanks guys! Overall staff was super nice even the maintenance guy took my ice bucket from my hand and got me ice when I was walking around looking for the machine.The hotel itself is in a great location in the heart of Chinatown and walking distance to little Italy. We caught a show at Duane Park which is right up the street and came back to chill at the Wyndham rooftop bar with sweeping views of the NYC skyline. Amazing stay will go back (P.S I worked for Marriott for 6 years in the past)

I can't believe how time flies. My family and I had the nicest experience at the Wyndham several months ago. The staff couldn't have been more firendly and accommodating to us and our kids. I'm sorry to say I cannot recal the Asian gentlemans name that assisted us when we arrived but they we super nice and well informed. We hope to be back in the spring. Thank you.

Very, very, very great stay. Sean, Stacey, and all the other staff at the hotel were super friendly and found us a room with an incredible view. Room was very neat and clean, housekeeping did an awesome job. Great location too. Definitely booking a room here the next time I come to NYC.

I stayed here for a friends wedding and had an excellent stay. It is a very beautiful and clean hotel. From calling ahead to ask question, to checking in and asked for extra towels, the staff was amazing. Thank you!

Upper story rooms have great views up the Bowery toward 3rd Avenue and beyond. If you want to be near Chinatown, this is definitely the best-looking hotel in the immediate area. Would stay again, for the views.

overall experience has been good. However if you can improve the lighting on the working table. The current light is very dim and not supportive to work. 2) water bottles are provided only on day 1. However if you can provide everyday one is good. for morning coffee.

Beautiful views out of the hotel, with a very convenient bar on the 18th floor with even better views and good drinks! Had a great stay. Close enough to walk to lower Manhattan and the 9/11 Memorial, and with lots of great places in Chinatown to eat.

Sean & Ray greeted me so graciously! They were so accommodating and gave me a free room upgrade with a balcony to see the evening's fireworks. The room was very clean and had a great view! We had a party at rooftop 93 and the space is amazing with great views! I also slept very well!

This hotel is in a convenient location for both Brooklyn and Manhattan. Room was comfortable. A few niggles - faucet came away from the wall - but this was quickly resolved by the staff. The staff were in fact all very friendly and helpful, including checking me in early after an overnight flight/early arrival. The room was very clean and the cleaning staff - especially Yumarie - were really friendly and helpful. I would stay again.

Excellent location in the heart of bustling Chinatown. Close to Little Italy (or what's left of it) and the Lower East Side with old New York land marks. Our room was simple but clean and comfortable. Service friendly, accommodating, and really helpful.

I'm reminded why I brands almost always out perform one offs. The Wyndham was spot on with service and everything else I needed for my short business trip to NYC. Great location, fitness room, staff and view. Keeping it on my radar. Almost forgot, they had like three or four places to eat, I only managed to visit two.

I had thr pleasure of staying here forn2 weeks. The hotel itself is beautiful. The staff are amazing. I wish the Wifi was stronger and faster. The location is just about perfect. Being in Chinatown and a few blocks from Little Italy the food selection was out of this world. Pictures are views from my 16th floor room.

What a nice change. My partner and I decided to treat ourselves to a night in the city away from home and decided on staying downtown at the Windham. Definitely the right choice, people were friendly and knowledgeable about where to eat and what to see. It was a great vibe, my only complaint was getting lunch, restaurant opened a little later than we are used to but with so many options in Little Italy and Chinatown, it really wasn't bad.

The beds are comfortables and the employees are awesome, Jose the employee has been very responsible and humble with me and my friend. We arrived Tuesday and since we enter to the hotel both of us were feeling secure and in good hands. 5 or more stars for the hotel.

I was lucky enough to remember this place this time. I stayed here last year and had the best time. There are so many great deals in the city this time of year but sometimes you get what you pay for. This place was a great bargain with the coolest views. The folks here just as great, always helpful and very friendly. Will not forget to come back.

We stayed here for 3 nights just after new years before flying back home. Great central location as long as you don;'t mind the normal "chaos" of China town. We found the service from the staff amazing and the rooms were great, with a few exceptions.1 - Only a coffee pod machine and paper cups in rooms - don't expect glasses, cutlery and a kettle. 2 - The fold out bed in the lounge was horrible! Staff arranged a roll-away free of charge immediately, but don't expect even a 7 year old to be able to sleep on the fold out lounge-bed!3 - DO ( repeat ) DO NOT expect tohave breakfast in this hotel. It is "served" in the adjoining Ramen bar... at bar-stools ( so really bad for small kids ) and the food is literally microwaved. Do yourself a favour and find a local diner!

Seriously, if you're in NYC and need a place to stay and you also wanna be near Chinatown then I highly advise this place. My room was small but comfier than a mothaf***a. It was really clean and the view from the 16th floor was beautiful. I visited NYC for 2020 presidential candidate Andrew Yang's fundraiser event happening next door at the Bowery Beer Garden. Real talk, if Yang becomes our 46th president and everyone gets $1,000 a month then I'm definitely coming back to this hotel several times. That's how great my stay was. I mean, I wanna come back anyway but it'll probably be a long time from now because of finances and stuff. But yeah, great hotel. They've got a bar and restaurant right next door and an Asian restaurant inside the lobby area. Rooms are clean and the staff are friendly. The pricing was good even for a last minute reservation like mine. I highly recommend this place.

Ryan was fantastic. The room was great and the view was amazing. A quick walk to Little Italy to one of our favorite restaurants and best cannolis! We will defiantly stay here the next time we are in the city.

Wonderful stay! Nice location where you can walk to the Bowery, Little Italy and Chinatown and explore some really cool places. The room was nice but the staff - Ray (check-in), Kumare and Connie (housekeeping) to everyone that quickly answered all requests was just amazing and awesome. Some nice restaurants in the hotel as well and parking (offsite) was very reasonable. Only thing missing was a pool!

Wyndham in Chinatown ia at a grate location, with all the conveniences need for a great stay. plus plus plus however two things gave me mixed feelings:the cleanliness of the room they do not dust there was dust build up on the mantles. so for someone like me with dust allergies not good , i am always prepared so i dealt with it...2. it depends on who u get at the front desk determines how helpful they are .... i would like to take the opportunity to thank STACY at the front desk for going beyond to assist with information and directions and overall willingness to make my stay comfortable.... Thank you Stacy.

Gilbert and Rifang were excellent guides to our first time in New York . Would definitely stay here again . Thanks guys for your warm hospitality will for sure recommend to friends and family. Best New Years trip

Stacey at the front desk took care of my brother and I during our stay. It was a very pleasant experience @ Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Thank you for an awesome and comfortable experience. Keep up the good work.

Had a great time during my stay in the city. . Gilbert at the front desk was very friendly and gave us a nice upgrade and we couldn’t have been more pleased. We will definitely return and be sure to recommend the hotel to others. I only wished breakfast stayed open until 11 not 10:30 am

Last Jose at the front desk was amazing. Parking was a nightmare but he helped us out a lot. The room was so nice and the bathroom was very clean. The location of the hotel was also convenient. We were able to walk everywhere. Highly recommend this place!

My time in Chinatown was well spent in large part because of this hotel. Jose at the front desk was so helpful, especially with parking which I thought we would never find. The was clean and comfortable. I would definitely come back to this hotel. Great service

My first impression of this hotel was definitely delightful. José at the front desk offered us excellent customer service. The room was also beyond what we expected. The bathroom was very clean and the beds were very comfortable.

Jose, the guest services representative, was so helpful and informative. He helped us find parking which we all know can be difficult in this city. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a nice view of the city as well.

Two twin beds pushed together to make a king. So awkward and uncomfortable. There is a 200 word minimum so I am adding more reach that and then submit the review. I don’t have much else to say. I am done.

Staff and hotel and accommodations were perfect for my short stay. Absolutely no complaints, although I spent very little time inside I plan to return for my next trip into NYC in the next few months.

The room was nice, exactly what we expected, and the bed was comfortable. The views from the rooftop bar were phenomenal and not to be missed. Working the shower took some finesse and the floor definitely got wet (no curtain/door to the shower stall). The hotel offers pet friendly rooms (we didn't need one, but saw other people using that amenity). Would love to see Wyndham and other hotel brands stop giving out individual soaps, etc. and instead use refillable dispensers.This didn't really impact our trip at all, but not sure why so many hotels are installing opaque bathroom doors, doesn't make sense to me.

I've stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown each of the last years for a couple of nights during the holiday season and enjoyed it immensely. Great location, convenient, comfortable and accommodating.

I stayed here In December 2019 for two nights, and I loved the hotel! The entire staff was so friendly, kind, and helpful - which exceeded my expectations! In particular, Nadine at the front desk went out of her way several times to accommodate my requests, and she was always so nice, patient, and caring. I am a single woman traveling alone, and I felt totally safe at all times in the hotel. Moreover, I was on the 12th floor with magnificent, panoramic views of the city! I especially appreciated that my room was very clean, and the bedding was pristine. Also wonderful was the Chinatown location. Although there was no valet parking, I was relieved to find free parking on the street. Highly Recommend!

Stayed here in December 2019 for a few nights. Very easy to get here from JFK via train. Jose at the front desk and the rest of his team went above and beyond in their service. 10/10 would stay here again!

Great hotel! Great staff! Knowledgeable and friendly! Gilbert and Ray at the front desk were very friendly and helpful! Kumarie in housekeeping was so nice! Clean rooms and comfy beds! Cant wait to come back! Mynew home away from home!

Had a great time at this gem of a hotel. Location is a great jump off point to all of the attractions. It was such a unique experience to be out of "Times Square" and visit the real New York. Beautiful Boutique hotel in a great part of Manhattan. Highly Recommend

They really spoiled us after I mentioned my fiancé’s birthday. Free breakfast one morning and a surprise bottle of champagne. Comfy rooms, excellent views, easy to find. Complaints about the showers are kind of nonsense, don’t listen. Staff was super friendly! Gilbert lived up to his excellent reputation. We’ll 100% stay here again.

Wonderful location! So many wonderful places to eat and shop. We had a great stay at the hotel. We were pleased with our accommodations Gilbert at the front desk was so helpful and so much fun. Definitely coming back

I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for three nights. I come to the city once a month for work and have stayed in various locations around Manhattan and this has to be one of the best locations. Pros: gym, comfortable bed, quiet room, clean room, nice staff Cons: none to really speak of I will likely stay here again. I want to check out their restaurant and beer garden.

I loved the location of the hotel. In Chinatown, but close to Little Italy and the LES. We enjoyed sitting in the park and watching the locals. Neighborhood has a cool vibe that you won’t get at a hotel in midtown. Several different Subway lines were pretty close too. The room was clean and sized about what you’d expect for NYC. My only complaint would be the lack of a proper shower curtain/door. The glass wasn’t large enough and water would get all over the bathroom floor. Overall very happy with our stay and looking forward to staying here again on our next trip.

Gilbert and Ryan are amazing...helped us with room food and taxis...fantastic attention and attitude... great location for lower Manhattan. Really reasonable pricing for this busy time of year! Will recommend to our friends and will use in future often. Parking easy near by and get discounts from hote

Decent hotel. Good area. Gilbert at the front desk was fantastic. Good football conversation. Go Eagles! Only gripe was the price. Little high for the offerings, but it’s the holidays in NYC. Would come back during a less busy time.

We have stayed in the Wyndham Garden Chinatown twice before when visiting New York - so the fact that we keep going back is a recommendation in itself.On this most recent occasion I just want to highlight an excellent piece of Customer Service. Having already checked out of the hotel, we returned to see if we could book a room for an additional day as my wife started to feel unwell. Despite the hotel being fully booked, Gilbert on the front desk was amazing and managed to find us a room that we could use for a few hours until my wife felt a little better. I honestly don't know what we would have done without his help. Absolutely brilliant!

Staff was very helpful in trying to do an early checkin to allow me to get over my car sickness, as well as, finding some ginger ale. Stayed on the 11th floor with an amazing view. Bed super comfortable and refreshing after long day of exploring the city. Hotel is close to all of the must see lower Manhattan sites; Wall Street, Ground ZERO, Freedom Tower, 9/11 museum. Close to delicious, mouth watering meals: Gray Dog for Brunch, Luna for local authentic Italian pizza or pasta, Katz deli for amazing pastrami and corned beef, Dunwells for Peanut butter jelly donut juat to name a few. Two complaints: noodle restaurant within the restaurant advertises closing at 12am but did last call for food and drinks at 11:15pm, would prefer a glass door that completely closes shower off feom bathroom to keep heat in the shower and water off the floor.

The beds were very comfortable and the room spacious. I liked that bc we had 3 people, there was at least a king bed and a double, so if someone wanted to sleep alone they could. The floor to ceiling windows on the corner units were great. Floors 12 and up offer a better skyline View though as the ones below provide a view of the building walls, which is to be expected. The shower was a little unusual as there is no door or shower curtain and water went all over the bathroom floor which could potentially cause a slippery fall. The room and hotel were clean. Gilbert at the front desk was very helpful and offered a local deli for delivery when we had exhausted all options one night. The rooftop bar was very fun as well. The outdoor part is closed during the winter though. Would be nice to have heaters for those who would like to be outdoors. Very close to the subway entrance for B,D trains. About a 10 minute walk for others. Close to little Italy and 9/11 memorial. The nearest Starbucks is about a 10 min walk as well.

This was my 10th time staying at this property. For the Christmas season, the location was perfect, with easy access to Upper Manhattan, but out of the crazy crowds. There are 2 Subways Stations just a few minutes walk from the hotel, and numerous excellent restaurants in the area. The hotel staff, especially Lindsay and Diane in the Sales Department, go out of their way making sure everything goes smoothly, which, being with a large group, was extremely important. The Rooftop Bar, Beer Garden downstairs were both bonuses to my stay. The beds were very comfortable and the view at night, especially laying in bed with the large windows, was stunning.I look forward to another stay there in the near future!

Was nice but the shower did not work. Kinda small room and the comforter was heavy and hot- the food downstairs was great- not sure if we would come back at that location just rather stay up near Times Square and Rockefeller’s center for the things we want to do! But enjoyed it!

Great Hotel with wonderful staff. Any questions or directions they were happy to help us. Beautiful views and the location is perfect. Stayed here the last 4 years and had great service everytime. Shopping and Eating right down the street.

2nd time staying at this hotel. Once again it was an amzing experience. Very clean. Staff is helpful and friendly. Excellent location. Amazing views from the rooftop bar! Close to many restaurants and subway stops. Will be back!

Stayed in the Wyndham garden hotel, very very nice would recommend to anyone looking for a city break. I would like to personally thank our house cleaner kumarie for keeping our room clean and tidy every day to a very high standard, what a lovely lady she is and absolute credit to the hotel team. Thank you very much Wyndham garden

This hotel was a sidestep as we were put in a different hotel that didn’t meet a 1/10 standards. Then we booked room at the Wyndham. Get the 7th floor. Yeah you don’t have the top view but you have a shared balcony with an amazing outside view of the city. The room is clean and very comfortable. The bed is the best hotel bed I’ve ever slept on. The location is near the subway and next to china town/ little Italy so perfect for eating and shops. I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

We’ve stayed here 5 times already & will continue to return. The location for us is great, the staff are all very nice & accommodating. The rooftop bar is nice to have drinks & has a nice view of the city. We always enjoy our stay here.

The hotel location is great, walkable to most restaurants in Chinatown, and close to subway. Although the room is not spacious, but the room is neat and clean. I was completely thrilled with a complimentary early check-in by Ms. Nadine. She was very friendly and helpful. Looking forward for another visit soon.

I booked my tickets on a app that gave hotel the choice to choose our room but they were gracious enough to give me and my girlfriend a really good room to accommodate for her birthday weekend . Great staff, Ryan took care of us with absolute professionalism .

Very nice hotel. Lobby was clean. Stuff was courteous. I would refer my family and friends to stay at this hotel since Christmas and New Year’s Eve is coming up. I visited the Wyndham in Rego Park too and that hotel was nice too. My Aunt’s room was beautiful, clean and modern. Especially the bathroom. The bathroom was modern and well maintained too. Patricia H.

Arrived early and was welcomed by Gilbert who was kind enough to allow me to check in earlier than 3 pm. Thank you Gilbert! Check in was quick and efficient. Once in my room I quickly found out how convenient a location this is. Near little Italy and Soho. I attended an art venue not too far away. Once I returned, I visited the rooftop bar which had amazing views of the city and the crowd was lively. Overall I enjoyed my stay very much. The staff was very friendly and the room was sufficient for my needs. My only complaints were the elevator from the street to the lobby was out of service so I had to bring my luggage up the stairs, I was fortunate that a porter was available to assist me. My second concern was the heat in my room. It was not working properly. I had to call and have an engineer check it for me. Luckily after some effort, it was fixed. Overall, the staff was extremely pleasant and my overall stay was a good one. It is one of the better hotels in an area that does not have too many. Would recommend.

Stacey was very pleasant and accommodating!!!! My bags were held securely until my room was ready. The hotel is well kept and modern. The location is great! No complaints. Thank you for a great stay!!

I was really happy with the staff at this hotel! I lost my license on my flight to JFK and I was worried that I wouldn't be allowed to check in. I was on a red eye flight and didn't get to the hotel until 2AM. Luckily, the friendly person at the front desk was able to check me in and even gave me an upgrade to a corner room on a high floor. The view from my room was amazing. I opened all of the curtains and decided to wake up to the view of New York.I had to have my passport over nighted to the hotel and the staff was so friendly and called me as soon as my passport arrived and kept it in a safe place until I was able to get it.The location of this hotel is great. I did a lot of walking and made it to Central Park, Broadway, and the Met on foot. If you're relatively healthy, you can get to a lot of tourist destinations on foot from this hotel.Overall, I am very happy with my stay here and the fact that the staff went above and beyond to help me.

Thanks to Jose for the help early morning during check in. His greeting was a very comforting smile. He provided an excellent start to our day by explaining our accommadations and providing a travel gudie and other offers.

Great location. Small and close to everything I needed. Check out the rooftop bar. Gilbert and Stacey were great at the desk. Rooms a little small, but it’s New York, so as long as you have a bed...... Will come again.

The corner room was great with super views to the west and south. Guys on reception often worked long shifts but were always helpful - helped with early check-in AND late checkout in a friendly and courteous way. Special thanks though goes to Leonora who was working on floor 10 and kept my room just as I wanted it - as well as helping with late checkout. its staff like Leonora that make a difference to me and will have me coming back.

Excellent hotel. Very friendly staff. Very accommodating. Kumarie was an awesome housekeeper. She did an amazing job. I definitely look forward to going back. The bed was super comfortable and the balcony view was awesome.

We arrived this past weekend and got into Manhattan a little earlier than expected - the staff (Ryan in particular) did a great job in allowing us to check-in early and provided us with everything we needed throughout the trip. The staff helped us with all our requests promptly, and made the trip memorable by helping passing on a gift to one of us sent to our hotel room by a friend for a birthday. The hotel room was a good size for Manhattan, and was clean and modern. Location was excellent, as it is close to tonnes of shops, restaurants, a short walk to the subway (5-10 minutes), and right on bus lines. Our trip was excellent, and we would definitely come back again on our next trip to New York City.

Given the limitations of space in the city, the room was fairly comfortable. The location of the hotel was within walking distance including 9/11 museum/memorial, Little Italy, Greenwich Village and of course, Chinatown. Ryan at the desk was extremely helpful.

This place was so much fun. In the heart of China town and only a couple blocks from little Italy. There is so much culture and good food surrounding you. The hotel it self was very clean and had beautiful floor to ceiling windows. I will stay here again.

Not so familiar with NYC. Luckily the host hotel was the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. Ryan was at the front desk and checked us in. He welcomed us, answered a few questions, and pointed us in the right direction. Thank you Ryan for getting our stay in New York off to such a good start. We loved the hotel’s location and ambiance. Only complaint; the shower was weak.... but I understand that is a problem in NYC.

My husband wanted to go to New York for the San Gennaro Festival. He is disabled so I was looking for a hotel close to Little Italy and Chinatown. I originally booked the "special offer" for the room and parking on the hotel website which reads, "Parking in New York City is no problem with our special travel package. Enjoy a stay in our plush accommodations with an upgrade to Deluxe Queen Empire View room (when available), a $15 credit to Grab and Go, and complimentary valet parking right here at our downtown Manhattan hotel. What could be easier? Package is based on availability, and black out dates may apply. Standard hotel cancellation and deposit policy apply." My husband decided we should take the train instead. When we got to the hotel I asked them to honor the day's prevailing room rate of $284.00 because we did not drive and I was not going to use their parking. They said they did not see the parking on the room and they could not accommodate my request. They DID NOT give me the $15 credit to "Grab and Go." All they gave me the manager's business card so I could try to contact him after the stay. They were not "helpful" at all. The room was not what I would consider a "Deluxe Empire Queen Room;" there was barely enough room to turn around in it. My final charge for just the room was $427.56 for one night; $369.55 was the room fee plus tax. I don't think I will be going to New York City again any time soon. The rooms are ridiculously small and expensive.

Nice room, great windows with nice views. Construction on streets out front ruined things a bit, but never the less this was a nice hotel. Pub on the property let us enjoy some local sports, nevver ate at restaurant . Staff was really friendly and helpfull.

Somehow Priceline called the Wyndham Chinatown hotel in NYC a 4 star hotel. It’s absolutely not. My husband’s taking a shower right now in a stream of water that wouldn’t be viable to wash a small dog. The room is tiny. The duvet cover doesn’t entirely cover the quilt so you actually sleep with and see the polyester comforter which lays over the scratchy sheets. The air has been on all night despite messing with the thermostat. Plus side- one wall of the room is floor to ceiling windows! Location interesting, trafficky, noisy and crowded, but then we never stay in the Chinatown area- and pretty sure not again- at least in this hotel. I think I prefer staying in Tribeca or Midtown, just as convenient. Oh well, it was for one night. Not a tragedy just not what it claimed to be.

Good location short distance to 3 subway stations. Front desk workers were helpful ,the room was clean and had enough space. The negative was the shower set up, it has a half door which allows water to spill into the bathroom and on the floor.

Straight away when we got to the hotel we were excepted by Pedro at the hotel desk.Pedro made sure everything we needed was taken care of and that our stay in the hotel would be as pleasures as possible.

Great location, close to subway & many sites within walking distance. Near little Italy, too.Roomy rooms by NY standards. Ceiling to floor Windows provide amazing view of the city & Empire State bldg is lovely at night.Clean & quiet

Arrived at the Wyndham hotel with my family, parked in front, and asked the hotel concierge if it was ok to be parked there for a moment to unload and check in. Concierge looked at my vehicle and affirmed that it was in a guest loading spot. 10 minutes later, returned to the car to find a pricey parking ticket waiting, despite hotel advisement. Multiple hotel staff, including managers, told me that they'd assist in fighting the ticket in acknowledgment of the error. The hotel did not help me fight the ticket and did not answer any of my emails regarding inquiry into the matter. The Wyndham hotel did not stand by its word to assist in a matter for which the hotel otherwise acknowledged fault.

The staff helped me greatly at check in. There was some confusion with the parking garage and the concierge helped me straighten everything out. It was a very clean and enjoyable stay. I would definately stay here again on my next visit

Room was excellent, great view of the city skyline!! We arrived early, and Jose offered us an early check upgrade to $30. Very accommodating and full of NYC class you don’t normally find. Highly recommend staying here. Will definitely stay again.

Great service!!!! Was help by Jose. Very helpful and attentive to our needs. Hope to come back soon.The rooms were great. The lobby looks clean. Music very chill and relax modern environment. Everything is close making thing very convenient.

Last minute trip to New York, great staff and pleasant, Jose was awesome and patient and was willing to help us find a room. for your help. Will deff come back. The place is beautiful and neat, very convenient.

Overall great hotel and good location to places to see and eat at. Staff was very professional and friendly. The maid assigned to my room did an outstanding job and was very professional and on top of her job. Staff was always able to answer any questions and provide recommendations when needed. Definitely would stay their again. Only down fall was no microwave in the room.

While my stay was for business, I would have no problem staying here again with the family to take in the sights. The proximity to great attractions and fun things to do, plus convenience of the subway a few blocks away allows you to get to more.

The temperature dropped to the mid forty’s with a high in the sixties during the day. My room was 64 degrees. When I told the front desk I didn’t have heat I was told the heat “wasn’t turned on yet”. This is unacceptable. I paid for a comfortable room and didn’t receive one.

Loud outside, because NYC. Shower didnt have a door and opened to the bathroom. Floor gets wet during shower. Not just a little wet. Like soaking a towel wet. I would stay again. Ramen bar was good. Beer garden was adequate.

This hotel was perfectly located in China Town and Little Italy. It is within great walking distance of many areas and landmarks as well as within 2 blocks of the subway. The hotel was very clean. Breakfast is really good. The staff are friendly and helpful. If I’m ever back in New York I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Clean, new, modern. Clean linen, hot powerful shower, central location in the heart of China town and little Italy. Reasonable parking for Manhattan. Great restaurants in the neighborhood. Easy to find

Comfortable rooms with good views and location. Ramen bar was the best ever! The beer and sake selection was super awesome and the ramen was so delicious. The location is right in the middle of everything and close to everything.

EOM above. For a NYC hotel, spacious, comfortable, cost reasonable, etc. It is my new go-to place when I travel to NYC for business. Sean Sy, Guest Sevices Manager was excellent. He even gave me my room a little early so I could get myself comfortable for meetings, etc. Cheers!

I prepaid the reservation with another card; however, for the deposit, I used another one, and the hotel charged me again from the other card just like nothing happened. After I complained, the hotel said they would resend the money to me. Yes, they send the money to me, but after a day, they again took the money from me without any notice.

Very good for the price!!!!!!Had a very welcoming reception at this hotel, staff if very friendly and professional.They have a nice rooftop bar with a view.Room is clean and nice. Best option for the price around NYC.I would definitely stay here again in the future.

I stayed overnight for a business trip nearby and was very happy with this Wyndham. The front desk was efficient and pleasant, explaining everything without overdoing it. The room itself is spacious by New York City standards, was very clean (hat tip to Kumarie, the lady who I ran into who handled my room), and was well-appointed. Second room floors (maybe others) have a shared balcony that overlooks Chinatown. Lots to do nearby. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Nice room with balcony and great rooftop bar! Beer Garden was okay for beer, but not much in the way of wine. Check in and check out was very quick and easy. My only complaint, a worker knocked on my door at 8am Saturday to exchange the fridge, which I supposedly requested. I did not.

I was here for 6 nights. On my third day we came back to the room and my phone charger was missing. After talking to front desk and the manager, they asked me to email them with my version of the story. I told them that I didnt feel safe, that I didnt want enyone else entering the room.In the hallway, I confronted a member of the cleaning staff and after inspecting the cleaning cart, he managed to pull out the charger from a bag. I didnt get any sort of apology and I had to let the cleaning staff again into my room since it was a busy season (fashion week) and couldnt change hotels that easily. However avery day we had a slight worry about our belongings.

Great little hotel in the heart of Chinatown close to subway lines and walking distance to World Trade Centre site and Federal Plaza, museums of Indian and African history, Wall Street etc.....great clean rooms, bar up on the roof and a little eatery plus heaps of Chinese restaurants...just perfect.

The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. The room was clean but a bit dark and cold when entering into it. However, after setting the temperature to the desired degree, it was fine. The shower handle was too tight and difficult to turn on/off. There was no luggage stand to put a suit case which was inconvenient.

The staff from check-in desk were accommodating. The internet was working as it should, and I can not complain about anything. The rooms were some a bit tights, but it was ok... not that you are spending too much time there, right?

The room was clean, the support staff (making up beds, making sure you know when checkout is) were very efficient and the service was good. But the check-in/check-out were "okay." Not a warm reception, seemed pre-occupied upon check in, didn't ask about our stay upon check out and didn't offer a receipt upon check out. The final bill did not reflect the two charges made to the visa account. And the charges were made upon checking in, rather than upon check out.

I have stayed here a few times in the past for the convenience, competitive price, cleanliness and location. Within a few hours of our first night on this trip, our smoke alarm went off. I called the front desk multiple times with no luck. A 'Hotel Engineer' came up, peeked his head in, and said hold on. Another 10 minutes past with the blaring, ear deafening alarm. Another hotel service person came up, and tried to radio it off remotely with someone at a panel on another floor. The panel was "too far" away someone yelled on the walkie talkie. Another 10 minutes of the ear piercing alarm went off, the man returned, pried the alarm off the wall (not a typical battery smoke alarm, but one of the large dome shaped official city alarms), and did something with a screw driver to turn it off. We were told taking a hot shower caused it to go off as the bathroom fan relies on a natural roof exhaust (not a motor fan). We were instructed to shower with low heat showers and to keep our hotel door open when we showered going forward? I can't think of a more vulnerable way and place to shower. The front desk never followed up, apologized or offered any form of a coherent explanation as to why the deafening loud alarm went off for 20 minutes. It may have even been a fire alarm or carbon monoxide detector, but we didn't die so I guess it was neither. The service here is poor. It has been sort of average in the past and I was always willing to overlook that for the price and room cleanliness, but when we are talking about emergency indicators and consistently grumpy personnel, I had to speak up. Additionally, because of the Beer Garden and Ramen Bar on the first floor, there is now an ottoman sized cologne diffuser in the lobby which is bordering on intoxicating in how strongly perfumed and repulsive the scent it fills the lobby with. I imagine this diffuser is to the mask the smells of the two eateries, which it does successfully, but with the price of wanting to pinch your nose in the lobby.We also saw an old lady struggle to pass through the main glass revolving lobby door with her rolling luggage as the side doors instruct you to always use the revolving door. She kept getting stuck, waved for help to the woman at the front desk and who responded by rolling her eyes, remaining at her station and yelling "Thats why I told you to use the door!". The rooms are clean, location is great, the hotel is modern and well-priced, but I am now reluctant to stay again

We had a great stay. The location was great. The room was comfortable . Easy check in and friendly staff. Thank you Gilbert for your assistance. Will definitely return and recommend the hotel to others.

The front desk staff was very rude and unhelpful. We were on the elevator going up to our room one day and the staff smashed on with a bunch of chairs and literally had the chairs falling over on top of us.

Wyndham Garden from central NYC, is very accessible with subway and busses. Chinatown is a little bit right across canal street where China town starts. The hotel has an elevator on the street level for your luggage and for PWD who cannot climb the stairs or on wheelchair. If you are joining a Chinese tour Canal street is just accross where you get your tour buses to the different tours in the east coast.

We arrived by car expecting a portico so we could unload baggage before driving to the nearby garage (the hotel lacks a garage) since that's our experience everywhere else. There is no portico or even room to stop conveniently in the street. We drove on to the garage and toted our bags back to the hotel. Registration was quick and simple and the room was comfortable though smallish reminding us more of hotels we've stayed at in Europe. We were there for one night for a family party and getting to Chinatown was through dense traffic.

hotel is great. Staff is very helpful. Location is great. located near everything I need to be close to. excellent place to stay. We will definitely stay here again. This place is a gem in the lower part of manhattan

We came for preparing our wedding next day. The front desk staff was very nice to give us an update to a higher and much better room. Thank Jose from Wyndham for the complimentary upgrade and we had a good night here.

Josè did an awesome job showing us where to go and where to eat. The location and views are great, close to little Italy and right in Chinatown with a variety of goods to select! Josè has made our stay even better!

JOSE has helped us so much. We came in a love trip and he has helped me on city tips and great hotel room! Amazing service! New york city is certainly better experience when you know exactlywhere to go and have transportations all set. Ask for Jose!!!!
user_name:
Debora M
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent service! This is my second time staying here and he was excellent both times. Wonderful customer service! I will definitely be back! Thank you Pedro! We had a great room with great views. I love it here!!!

The room smelled bad and cigarette smell came through the vents every night. Handle on ice bucket didn't work, no ice bags provided, hotel phone didn't work and staff interrupted our sleep 2 days later to fix it despite 'do not disturb' sign on the door. Customer service was non existent. The bed felt smaller than a queen but can't be for sure.

Jose was awesome, checked us in and was very pleasant! Outstanding service!The check in process was very smooth and quick, room was clean and quiet. Customer service was exceptional. We will definitely stay here again, talk to Jose!

You guys are great! Not only did you deliver on a good and comfortable stay but you also gave us excellent service. This made the already good deal on the rate we got even better. Our only minor issue was breakfast, a little slow but nothing to keep us from ever returning.

Great location, close to little Italy and China town. Rooftop bar has incredible view of night time skyline. Staff always were friendly and helpful. Close to subway and hop on hop off bus stop. Bed very comfortable.

It was a good stay. Staff was efficient and friendly. Facility was clean. Many standard accommodations were provided unlike many properties. Good for business purposes. Also good location but not too crowded.

Under unfortunate circumstances, I had to travel to New York when I booked this Windam. It was convenient to a funeral I was attending. A close school friend passed away far too young. I had to get directions to the funeral home and the young lady at the desk could not have been more sympathetic about the situation. I just had to say thank you although I unfortunately did not get her name.

Great place to stay to enjoy lower Manhattan. We were upgraded to a king size room on the 11th floor. Enjoyed the floor to ceiling window in our room with an amazing view on NY. The rooftop bar is two floors, small, but excellent drinks and views. We also enjoyed the Beer Garden on the first floor. Great body products. Got to enjoy the area and close enough to the Village and SoHo to enjoy those neighborhoods. The shower in my room was a bit of a problem. Soapdish was about to come off the wall and the glass door/wall was not long enough to not get the entire bathroom wet. That's a bit dangerous. FYI - I am from NY and I was just being a tourist.

I cant believe its taken me three trips to Wyndham Chinatown to finally post my review. These guys certainly deserve it, always consistently friendly and helpful. There have been some changes with parking but I was able to work it all out with there help and my bike was nice and safe. I love the rooftop top, even better thena the room view. I still owe you guys more good feedback. kudos..

The hotel was great from start to finish, rooms were very clean with some minor wear and tear. Staff was super helpful and very friendly, you could tell they were genuine about making sure you had a good stay. The beer garden was cool althought the street construction was a turn off with the exposed exterior. I would still recommend it since I'm sure they are not thrilled about the construction either. Great place to stay if lower eastside.

I booked this place on a great deal really just looking for a place to sleep and shower over the weekend. The hotel is a Wyndham which I have not tried but was really happy with after doing so. Check in was fast and professional, I had an issue being on a lower floor and they quickly took care of it. This place had a few restaurants of which I got to visit two, the rooftop bar and some sport bar on the ground level. Everyone was firendly, really down to earth and helpful with sites to visit. I recomment it and look forward to coming back.

Very nice boutique hotel right near Chinatown, Little Italy & Soho. We stayed on the 11th floor and the uptown view was beautiful. The rooms are very clean and well kept. The staff is very professional. Highly recommended

My daughter and I were traveling to New York to consult medical specialists. We stayed in a room with special accommodations for disabled people. The comfort, cleanliness and beautiful view were notable but the reception desk personnel were outstanding. They answered all our questions promptly and patiently.

This hotel is one of the best values in New York. The hotel bordering Little Italy,Chinatown, and Soho is a great location for staying in New York. The hotel is spotless, the service is tops in customer service, the internet is so easy to access and very quick and the beds are really comfortable. I must also say how quiet the rooms were. It really is tops in value for New York City. If you stay there visit the Egg Shop for breakfast and Wayan, French Indonesian fusion, for dinner. Outstanding dinner spot, please make a res.

No frills but clean comfortable stay. Hotel is clean, staff is very friendly, and helpful. Knock is the fact that they charged us $30 for an early check (I guess is common in NYC). Close proximity to the NYC sites we wanted to visit!
Great staff Who were helpful. WasA good stay. We Requested a quiet room and they were able to Accommodate us. We Would recommend. Accommodations were clean and room was basic but that’s all you need.

The staff was incredibly professional and friendly. The room and view were magnificent. What's not to like. I definitely would like staying here again in the future. This four star hotel is a must try location in NYC.

Very clean, polished, and well-decorated. Looks like and feels like a comfortable environment to be in. Has a nice rooftop bar (it is inside) but still very cool. Very great drinks there. I booked this hotel 4 hours before I checked-in. You can use a parking garage right down the street (2 min walk) for $35 per 24 hours in cash or $40 per 24 hours if you pay with credit card.

I pleasantly surprised at the quality of this property given the price I paid. Located in Chinatown, it is a short walk from several fun areas and easy access to subway. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and the bed was comfortable. I really enjoyed the downstairs bar (not run by hotel) where the staff was very friendly! But the best part was the rooftop bar where you can enjoy drinks and an amazing view!

Hotel is in perfect location, however upon arriving AC was not working , room temp was 79 upon arriving. turned AC down and left for few hours and came back to room temp at 77. Fan was provided however it was uncomfortable thru out the night. Getting ready for work next morning room temp was 77 and humid made for getting ready for work miserable. I rated sleep quality and room a 1 because it was miserable trying to sleep and get ready fro work.

We stayed for a couple nights. The room was fresh and clean. Only a couple minor issues. The shower has no sliding door on it. It has a half door. I'm a tall guy so water naturally splashes on me. The toilet paper rolls are right next to the shower so they would get wet. The AC in the room left something to be desired. We were on the 11th floor and naturally we were there during the hottest days of summer. The room really didn't cool down past 78*. We had some spectacular views of Lower Manhattan and Midtown from the 11th floor. There is a parking garage within a 2 min walk of the hotel. No onsite parking.

Free continental breakfast not served That’s not good- please include this coffee situation with hummus crackers fruit- many people are diabetic and need an all convenient items the hotel people are nice - and kind - it is not their fault

Excellent customer services without questioning and understanding my situation. Gabriel was able to providing me the request as well as an upgraded room. Thank you so much Gabriel (Front desk supervisor).

I loved this hotel. Everyone is professional and courteous and the place is also pet friendly. I was upgraded to a high floor with a balcony that looked out to the Empire State building. I had a great overnight trip with my cat I was traveling with and they made me feel more than welcome.

When booking my stay I was unfamiliar with the location and the hotel. I soon found out that both far exceeded my original expectations. Great staff highly knowledgeable and courteous. Easy to walk to Chinatown and Little Italy

We came in for a quick trip to the city and it was just a magnificent stay. The hotel is very clean, in an excellent location (near subway lines too), our room had a beautiful view of the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges, and the front desk staff couldn’t have been nicer (Thanks Jose!). I would definitely recommend it!

Stayed here for one night and really enjoyed it. Comfortable bed, nice view and really great value for the price. There is a rooftop which has great views as well. Thanks to Jose for the service and the great room.

If you are looking for a great location and excellent amenities this is the place! They offer a Rooftop Bar, a Beer Garden and a Ramen Restaurant. Excellent service was given by Jose from check in to check out. Great skyline views from the upper floor rooms, this hotel has it all.
user_name:
Linda Marie P
Los Angeles, California

review_body: Great view, great room, good service, excellent location, great bar on the roof and ground floor. The staff was very attentive and professional.The best thing was the view from our room it was captivating

This hotel seemed pretty awesome at first, rooms looked clean, updated, and customer service appeared to be great. UNTIL it was time to take a shower. There were literally gnats and flies coming from the shower drain. I immediately went down to the lobby and showed an associate at the desk a video of this. She said would I like someone to come clean the room ! This was beyond that to me at this point, I felt out of respect I should be at least offered another room. She then told me no rooms were available until after 6:00 pm !!!! Mind you it was 2:00 o clock at this point ! After waiting several hours I was given a room that reeked of cigarette smoke !!!!!!! At this point, I was fed up with the service, and lack of care that was displayed and just found somewhere to stay, I lost money, but I gained peace of mind just staying somewhere else. PLEASE BEWARE !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Well it’s not a cheap hotel , but it is very clean and the staff is very nice, near by there is the pub of the hotel and also rooftop pub , you can see all Manhattan frome thereI strongly recommend , you can also find an interesting restaurant inside the hotel

This little hotel was the perfect location!So convenient to everywhere!The view from my room was amazing!Loved the rooftop bar and the restaurants are great!Everyone working there was extremely helpful and nice!

I had a great experience here, they were very hospitable and did everything they could to make my visit comfortable and entertained. I would recommend them each time in town. Jose was amazing with customer service

The staffs from Sean, Jose and Ray were very helpful and they made my trip comfortable and easy.The room with the view is beautiful at night. The room was very clean and modern. The restaurant downstairs was really good. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

We stayed here for our wedding anniversary during Pride weekend. The hotel staff were very gay-positive to us and to the many other gay customers. They were also very pet-friendly, handled their unexpected elevator issues promptly, and the front desk and cleaning staff were all extremely helpful with many small details. Additionally, the location and view were amazing. Highly recommended.

Jose had great customer service. Very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Helped me get checked in quick and made my trip very comfortable. I will definitely be coming back. Room was clean with a balcony. I enjoyed my stay!

Location was perfect for shopping in Soho. Rooms were very nice. Ramen restaurant, beer garden, sweet rooftop bar all in hotel so always great options for food, drinks, partying. Jose at the front desk was a lifesaver! Anything we asked for, he got us or arranged for us. What an accommodating, great guy!

Had a great stay at the Wyndham Garden Inn in Chinatown. Location was great, close enough to work and also in a cool neighbourhood. Jose was awesome during check-in, and his recommendation for Shinka for ramen was spot on.
user_name:
NorthStar30335153679
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I was traveling with the family (we have 4 kids), and we were planning on utilizing a "cot" to try to fit into a standard room. Jose at the front desk saw this, and decided out of the blue to upgrade us to a much larger corner room with one king bed and one queen bed. Not only did this make our day, but it made our trip! Thanks again Wyndham Garden Chinatown, and thanks again Jose :-)

Came here because the Airbnb we rented for world pride had a broken AC, and this hotel had the most reasonable nearby. Nadiana checked us in and gave us a beautiful room large enough to accommodate my friends and I with a great rate! Being that we arrived hours before check-in, Jose offered to store our luggage while we checked out the neighborhood. Housekeeping was great and the rooftop bar is beautiful! A great hotel at a great value.

This place was great. The check in was a little slow and I think that was partially due to Hotels Tonight but partially due to the staff. To be fair I did check in at 11 pm but still. But other than that the place was phenomenal. The rooms were very nice and neat somewhat chic (not a word I use often). The restaurants and the bars, while I did not frequent them, appeared to be outstanding and their reputations preceed them. Overall the place was amazing.
user_name:
Freedom40136440035
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice rooms, some of them with a great view. Well located in Chinatown, near to B and D train. Plenty of restaurants around, two blocks from Little Italy. It has stairs to reach the reception and nobody helps, be adviced if you can’t carry luggage

Basically a good experience except for the elevators being difficult...they most times had a mind of their own! Location is perfect for access to Chinatown and Little Italy, SoHo is just a few blocks away! The terrible coffee and spoiled milk in the Lobby Lounge! No place in the bathroom to set anything down!No hooks near the shower to hang a towel or robe! Who wants to use the toilet seat for this?These items should be easy fixes for the management to accomplish!Staff at front desk was very nice and accommodated us well!

I stayed here for the first time and didn’t know what to expect. The room I had was on the north west side of the building, had an amazing view of Bowery and midtown. The staff ( Stacey, Ray, and Jose) were extremely knowledgeable and accommodating, especially when I extended my stay. I’ll definitely be back. Also the on site Raman bar located on the main floor had one of the best broths that I’ve ever had. Overall a great place if you want to explore lower Manhattan. Again a big thanks to the staff. ~ K. Gulotta

Despite the rainy work week, it was a nice stay. The staff at the desk and the restaurant were super friendly not mention helpful. One of the male registration staff members which I feel bad I forgot his name,lent me an umbrella while I ran out for a near by meeting. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Stay57487905432
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I had the chance to stay here again over the best Western down the street. While I like the breakfast option at BW, it cant compare to the people here. The front desk team is always super helpful from suggestions to anything to make your stay more enjoyable. It's fast becoming my favorite place to south of midtown. I really like the the food options and its just convenient all way around. The views are very good as well.

A wonderful stay in a hotel with a great staff. The staff was there to help us whenever needed. Rooms are a bit small, but that is expected in New York City. Nice size bathroom that could have used a little caulking. Great location to get out and walk the city. We would definitely return to this property.

It's early/mid June in NYC. I call in to confirm the check-in around 1pm. We do so, and hang up.3 minutes later, I get a call saying that the room has no A/C and that there are no other rooms available. We only get an offer to cancel without late charge, like it's a favor.By that point, it's either put up (with the broken A/C) or shut up (or pay extra money for the day-of reservation at elsewhere).

Tha manager, Sean Sy, is a true assett to your hotel. He is kind and courteous and very generous. He gave us a free upgrade since it was my 12 year old daughter's first visit to NYC. ALL of the staff are wonderful!
user_location: Niagara Falls, New York, United States
user_name:
Tara R
Niagara Falls, New York, United States

review_body: Nice hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly. Only complaint was the air conditioning was not working properly. Did open the window but room was still a bit uncomfortable. Great view from room on 8th floor. Easy walk to subway

My 2nd stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown, they have a amazing staff! The view from my guest room was stunning direct of Empire State Building. Affordable rates for business, this my home away from home in the Lower East Side, thank you Wyndham!

This hotel worked for us as a location near our son on Houston street. It's a vibrant area of New York. Lots of great restaurants in the area. We cold walk to see our new granddaughter. Yada Yada yada.

I'm not the type to post reviews and in fact the last time I stayed at this hotel I didn't bother even though I had an enjoyable stay despite it being a business trip. Anyway, as luck would have it this time around they were having some AC issue. While the weather was not at its worst it still was a bit of a disappointment. That is until the desk staff member explained the circumstances to me in such a professional and empathetic way, I literally was cool (no pun) with it. They got me water, a fan and even a couple of drink tickets not to mention a discount under the circumstances. It's not about the items I was given but more about the follow up. I stayed for a couple of days but they continued to check in on me. The issue was finally resolved my last night but I just had to say thank you to Nadina, Jose, Gilbert and Shawn for their excellent service.

I stayed here on business. This hotel was aesthetically beautiful on the exterior. The rooms looked very dated. Doesn't matter to me. The real issue was the lack of air conditioning. It just didn't work! I woke up the next morning soaking wet with sweat. My room had to have been about 90 degrees. The thermostat on the wall was shot. You could have cooked a Thanksgiving turkey in my room. Just a very poor experience.

A smaller hotel with limited amenities but all things considered, it's a nice place to stay. Service was excellent and staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and simple. Efficiency is a good way to describe its essence. For business travel it's a good value if you're willing to be independent and resourceful. I'd stay there again.

Amazing view from our room on 16th floor. Room clean and comfortable, air condition loud. Breakfast in Ramen-Restaurant, american brekfast only. Not much contact with the staff, but were all friendly.

Better be sure the air conditioning works before booking this reservation. Miserable stay. Had to have windows open the entire visit. Horns honking cant sleep. HOT!! Expensive room for no air conditioning.

Excellent views of the city and wrap around balcony room 1501. Friendly staff, 2 blocks from the subway. Great location and great service. Room was stylish and clean. Great restaurant and roof top bar
user_name:
Go38847322131
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel had all the aspects of my trip that made it a great experience. It was idealy located near to the metro station. Food was available on the compound. thestaf was extremely helpful and friendly. the room and the entire hotel was clean and well mainted. i was pleasantly surprised especially since I did not know what to expect.

Good for the money. Good location for spring time. I've been to 4 hotels in NY...this has been the best i've stayed at. Though far from the best overall it is the best in its price range. Subway stations a block or 2 away.

AC not working the first day and could not open the balcony door to get fresh air in. Front desk refused to call a taxi "they would not get their commission" was the excuse. Room key only worked half the time, I had to keep three cards so I could get in my room. No room service which was advertised. I could have stayed at much nicer hotel for less than I paid here. No need for me to stay here again.

We where welcomed by a nice and warm receptionist called Stacey. She came out and help with the baggage. Fast check in , nice room with a view at the Empire State build. Nice bathroom. All in all a pretty nice hotel.

After a 22-hour flight I was hoping I would not be disappointed with the Hotel as I didn't want to spend excessively on the hotels nearer Uptown. But I was pleasantly surprised that the place was pretty decent and the staff were friendly and helpful. Location was good as it was walking distance to the nearest subway and a few good restaurants around too. GSM Sean was very welcoming during check-in. I also had some parcels delivered to the hotel prior to my stay and I really appreciate the associates (including the person who replied to my Facebook msgs) for assisting and keeping my parcels safe. Housekeeper Kumarie also did an excellent job keep my room refreshed daily.One minor thing was the toilets became very wet after a shower as the shower screen was not long enough to prevent splashes. Other than that, I would not hesitate to stay here again!Thanks!

I'm imbarrased its taken me my second visit to this hotel to finaly write a review but better late than never I say. Well I was here back in February and had a great time despite this being a work trip. The people at the desk are always so warm and friendly, not at all the norm for New York. I couldn't visit a second time without praising these folks. Thank you.

Very friendly staff especially at the reception desk, willing to help at any situation. Rooms are perfectly clean, internet available at high speed, subway station is very near, overall a great value for money

I stayed in this fabulous, zen, and fun hotel. The staff and manager are incredible and so warm. It was an incredible hotel. My boyfriend and I needed a one night get away. We were so zen! Highly recommend!

My fiance and I picked this place as to make one last getaway before our wedding in June. It was really our last so called trip being single. We had the best time in New York City, the weather was great and the hotel was perfect. We took the near by train which pretty much took us everywhere we need to go. The hotel staff was very helpful with suggestions and we even ventured into Brooklyn which was amazing. We are going to Greece for our honeymoon but I almost wish we could come back. I know where we will stay.

I have stayed in this hotel more than a dozen times. I can't say enough great things about it. It is centrally located in the big Apple and is accessible to all types of public transportation, to name a few. First and foremost, I always get first class services here. The manager, Shawn , and others such as Ray and Jose to name a few, always greet me with courtesy and professionalism. The maintenance staff and the maids also know me well.It is like a second home to me . It is no doubt a home away from home. The hotel is great for business travelers as well as all types of traveling purposes. The restaurant is terrific. The roof top lounge offers the best view of the city anyone can ask for. Not only is the staff able to anticipate my needs , they also address them at a rate at which I can't ask for more. Just to share an example. I am a coffee drinker. They are sensitive enough to know that. I never have to ask for more coffee. When I check into the room there they are. In fact I have no intention of staying at anywhere but this jewel when I am in town. Thankyou Wyndham.

My wife booked this hotel because it’s located in the heart of Chinatown(near Little Italy)and close to several subway stations(only 2 blocks away), which is very convenient as we are going back to China with many luggages. There are several nice Chinese restaurants around—you shouldn’t miss them!The room is not big but adequate. Sean helped us with a pre-check in; he is helpful and nice—he even prepares a translation app in case I don’t speak English. All in all, it’s a nice stay. Definitely will stay here again.

We are locals who needed a last minute hotel in the neighbourhood during a home renovation and this popped up on our Hotel Tonight app. Our parents had stayed at the same hotel about 6 or 7 years ago in a much nicer suite), and their room was quite nice and clean back then, so we went for it.Pros: Every staff member was polite and helpful and came to the rescue when needed. Shinka, the ramen restaurant downstairs and the rooftop bar are both worth a visit. Shinka is a great spot even for us locals. The location is excellent, close to many great restaurants and neighborhoods in Lower Manhattan.Cons: We checked in at 9:30pm or so and went into our room. We couldn’t find the lights. Went back downstairs on the super slow elevators and the front desk member told us how to turn them on. Not intuitive at all. Why would you put a dark brown light switch plate on a brown wall that allows you to then turn on the switch to the lights that are in the middle of the room? The tiny hallway light barely lit up the entrance way, let alone the sleeping quarters where this secret switch is located. It wasn’t even a master switch because turning the switch off did not turn off all the other lights in the room when we were ready for bed.While unpacking, I stepped on a mystery liquid in my socks on the dark brown carpet that turned my white socks yellow. The carpet between the two double beds had a big wet spot that clearly did not dry out even though we had the windows open for several hours while we went out. The smell permeating from the spot smelled like moss or mold or something growing underneath the carpet. We laid a towel over it just so we could get into bed since we wanted to take a shower and sleep after a long day.The shower control was difficult to use. We are frequent world travelers and have stayed in hundreds of hotels, and we have never had to call someone up to show us how to work the shower. Not even in the Amazon rainforest! The front desk member I called agreed the showers are tricky in this hotel. There’s always a first for every traveler, I suppose.The glass door of the shower is useless at keeping the water from getting all over the bathroom. Everything ends up wet after you shower. Again, the moldy smell emanated from the shower drain. Coincidentally, the shower wall abuts the beds...My husband, usually with a high tolerance for this kind of stuff, suggested that we Uber home after our showers.
