Room 1604 had an amazing view uptown so we never felt as though we were missing anything.Room had everything we needed and bathroom great (with same view).Staff all really helpful especially Emily at foh.Hotel is minutes fron subway and we loved being so close to chinatown little italy soho nolita. An easy walk to Brooklyn and Manhatten bridges and ols seaport.Subway gave us everywhere else in minutes with aircon! Photos all taken from 1604

Getting away form Times Square is a blessing. Decided to check out lower Manhattan this time. This hotel is decent. We all know NYC is terribly expensive, noisy, dirty and crowded. I wanted more cultural experiences rather than the time square/disney experience. Chinatown is perfect, steps from Little Italy and Soho. Arrival at the hotel was shaky. Was stuck in the elevator, because the button to 10th fl was stuck and had to go to 11th fl. and walk down. Rescued by a security guard. I avoided that elevator on the return.Key didn’t always work for 1st, 2nd try in the other elevator either. it's midnight and I'm hungry. NO room service but Highland Deli delivers. Got a burger and fries. Good flavor however, no salt or ketchup provided so everything was a dry, dry, dry. Make sure you request it if you order.My room is good., nice view, small and clean(mostly) something weird on my sheets. NO counter space for my cosmetics in the bathroom, that’s a HUGE pain. Put some of my things on the toilet seat to get dressed. The mattress is encased and therefore bedbugs are not an issue.:-)The closet is a problem too. it's a half closet and my clothes can’t hang without hitting the bottom and getting wrinkled. So I use the Bathroom hook. Why the bar is so low I don’t understand. No dresser drawers either.No tub in 1001, but good city view. The shower has a weird design, only half a glass and the water spills onto the floor under the sink after showering. So the floor is wet, not great while you are trying to get dressed.Fridge works, but it’s not turned on, you must open the door and dial the number up before it gets cold..Windows don’t open. Small rooftop lounge for drinks. Cosy restaurant below, but it was closed.You have to pay $3.50/bag after you check out and want them to hold your bags☹ Also, 1st water in your room is free, then they charge $3.00/bottle afterwards. Take a trip to the market across the street and stock up for .69/bottle

This is a nice little hotel on the edge of Chinatown and just blocks from Little Italy, the Manhattan Bridge and Tribeca. I found it to be decently situated within walking distance of several subway lines to get me where I wanted to go.

Modern, clean with great amenities including rooftop bar, beer garden and nightclub. Very cool especially for the neighborhood. Short walk to Lower East Side, Little Italy and many subway lines makes it desirable even if you aren't there for Chinatown.
user_name:
Jeff M
New York City, New York

review_body: Convenient and value basically sums up our stay at this Wyndham hotel. The staff was courteous and the lobby was modern. The rooms and shower was tight but as expected in NYC.

An otherwise very nice overnight in the city turned upside down when I realized I left a couple of dresses hanging in the hotel room closet after checking out and driving upstate. After calling the hotel to retrieve them on our drive back down, I was shocked to hear that they didn't have them. I guess those dresses pulled a disappearing act. Otherwise hotel was fine. Nothing exceptional. Busy corner, but good location. I just wouldn't expect this from a quality hotel with a good reputation like Wyndham.

Staff were very helpful and pleasant. And the Location was terrific. I have a couple of criticisms about things which should have been repaired more quickly: Street elevator for luggage not repaired for week; Slow internet for a week. Nonetheless, hotel is very clean. Rooms are pretty and well designed. Good experience.

The location is great and walking distance to Little Italy. I had a balcony view which was awesome! The room super clean and had all the amenities I needed (and they surprised me with a complimentary wine bottle...nice touch, thanks!). I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for 3 nights. Little Italy is just a few blocks away. There were also several convenient subway options. Our rooms were very comfortable. The music coming from the brewery on the bottom floor is a bit loud at night, but overall the stay was great. The view from the 16th floor room was gorgeous!

Usually when returning to my hometown, I stay uptown in Harlem because it's really home. I stayed here in Chinatown because as a Blasian (Black and Asian -- Chinese) I came for a conference of folks from the Chinese diaspora. I really love this hotel! A cool sidewalk bar/restaurant is really jamming! Oh! And the rooftop bar has the most spectacular views of NYC!

The view from our room was incredible (empire state building). The same view was also seen from the bathroom, it was great.The room was very clean, I liked the terrace and the bed was very comfortable.Only bad points is to make your guest pay to store their luggage after they checked out. That is not acceptable when you know we already spend $$$$ for a room.

This little gem was situated in a great location in Chinatown, down the block from Little Italy and near subway stations. The rooms are very nice and comfortable and have wonderful views with their full length floor to ceilings! There is a lovely roof top with awesome views, restaurant, and bar. The staff is wonderful!!! Extremely helpful and pleasant. Not a bad walk to the Freedom tower either. I will definitely stay again.
user_name:
elysezappia
New York City, New York

review_body: Started off good. My family and I were 3 hours early to check in time and I was able to get checked in which was great. The hotel was not stroller or handicap accessible due to no ramps at entrance and an out of order elevator that would've taken us up to lobby at the entrance. Hotel seemed clean.....minus a roach sighting. The view was pretty amazing as I could see the skyline of the city. I only stayed there two days but would definitely not stay there again. It wasn't worth the money I paid for the room.

Let's see that would be right price, right location and nice room. In New York it's hard to get that combination, but this place does. Quick check in, with wi fi password on room card cover. Room key access to your floor, nice security feature. Room size about 250 sq ft which is big by NYC standards. Desk, sitting area, nice closet, and room is clean and well appointed.
Wonderfu hotel in every aspect. The view is Spectacular. Location is hard on the weight so close to little italy. Our second stay. Can't wait. For the third.

One of three hotels I regularly stay at in Chinatown --- the room layout in the Wyndham is pretty nice, managing to get natural light into the bathroom and enough electrical outlets in the right places for a business traveler. Their rooms are the strongest part of the hotel offer --- everything else is average or perfunctory. The restaurant/bar at street-level is the source of too much noise (at night when I'm trying to sleep), and personally I'd get rid of it for something more civilized. So, if you go to bed early, get a room on a higher floor! Can't argue with location --- close to public transportation, lots of food options within a few blocks. Never had any issues with personal safety in this area, even at night.

The hotel overall is fine. There are some pluses, (floor to ceiling windows that provide a nice view, decent bar adjacent to hotel, fairly close to subway) but on my most recent stay (I've stayed here before) the air conditioning was not working. It was 95 degrees in NYC and the only thing you want after walking around in that kind of heat is to come back to a cool room to rest. It was awful - even the bedding was damp from the humidity. The front desk clerk who came up to check it (not even maintenance - the front desk clerk!) said maybe it was because the blinds were open. Um, it's midnight and the sun has been down for about 4 hours and the room is the size of a small closet, so I think if the temp in the room has gone UP since we arrived and set it at 68, it's probably not because the blinds were open. Then he tried to tell us it takes a little time for it to cool down. Like 8 hours?? No, not buying that. I asked to be moved and he said they were sold out. He offered a fan, which we accepted, however it did not do much to cool down the room. So we were not able to sleep much, which is really what we were paying for. On a separate issue, I asked at check in to change the credit card the room was booked under and the front desk clerk (same one from earlier) said he took care of it, but NOPE, he didn't. Vanessa, the morning front desk clerk was fantastic in helping to clear that up, and provided us with a late checkout which was much appreciated.
A modern,well constructed hotel in an old place. Excellent location in chinatown and near little Italy.Rates are reasonable,service excellent.

I stayed here for 2 nights prior to leaving for vacation from EWR and needed a quiet place to work with Wifi one of the days. I've stayed here before and got a great room which faced the bridges. This time, my room faced Bowery and was on the fourth floor so noise was a bit of a problem but otherwise decent, but small room. Kind of dark but the bed was comfortable and the maid service was accommodating to my request to clean the room at the end of the afternoon as I needed to finish computer work. Free WiFi worked fine. Elevators were a little slow as one was out of service. The hotel is 2 blocks from the nearest subway service and served my purpose well.

If you want to use any of your electronic devices while on vacation don't book here. This place has incredibly slow internet and no option to purchase a higher speed. It literally took five minutes to load websites. All reception had to say was that the speed decreases as more people join the network. No kidding. Common sense would tell you to invest in a better wireless system for your guests. In this day and age it's unfathomable that a hotel doesn't have reasonable internet service.In addition, the hotel was very noisy, especially if you're on a lower floor. The rooms are very small. Overall you get what you pay for I guess.

Stayed last summer for4 night and it was a great stay. Room was on the 7th floor, which has a shared balcony that faces north and you can see the empire state building at night. Comfortable bed and the hotel was recently renovated. I always stay down in LES, Chinatown, Little Italy when visiting NYC and this was one of the better hotels I've stayed at in comparison to Comfort Inn Manhattan bridge, Best Western Bowery Hanbee and NobleDEN. The last being the best one of the four, but also the most expensive.

The hotel was very clean. Room was great & loved the view with floor to ceiling windows. AC was perfect, cool enough & adjusted quickly. Rooftop bar was so fun, small, but lively with awesome views. Hotel does charge to store your bags, as many hotels worldwide do. It is customary to tip for each bag stored unless there is a charge. It is clearly stated, so there should be no surprises. Great location in the heart of Chinatown and close to Little Italy. Also only 2 blocks to subway. Staff was great too!

I am still shocked at the price i paid for this hotel. What a great deal in the heart of NY. This is the perfect location in the heart of chinatown with so many great places to eat within walking distance (katz deli, lombardis, and of course chinatown restaurants) the train is close as well. The room was bigger then i expected for a NY hotel and super clean with a great view of the skyline. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again

I would be happy to recommend the Wyndham Garden to my family and friends. The location is right in the middle of what I wanted to do in NYC, good food, good shopping and access to not only China but to little Italy. Rooms had a great view and had what I needed.

For this family trip, the hotel's location in Chinatown proved to be very convenient. Despite the glass and steel facade, the hotel's public spaces are functional and basic.We can only comment on our room. Like the hotel, the room is functional and basic. The beds are just right; not too firm or soft, and the pillows are soft. But the room needs more chairs and the a/c vent and system need to be reevaluated. The bathroom is different than the rest of the room and fits in with the expectations that one has of a glass and steel building. But the bathroom needs more than one hanger and lacks towel rods/hangers. Despite the eco-friendly offer to let guests reuse towels, the hotel doesn't provide any means for guests to hang wet towels to dry out. Granted that given the size of the bathroom, it may be a design challenge but nevertheless, this needs consideration.The room door warps in the door frame. When exiting and locking the door, this made engaging the lock mechanism difficult and required several attempts of pulling the door hard. On our last night, the lock seemed to be engaged but when I returned an hour later, I found the door unlocked and slightly open.

I stayed here a number of years ago and enjoyed it. I was therefore disappointed when I was given a room with a bathroom so small that I have to keep all my toiletries next to the bed. The only other option was keeping my toothbrush on the toilet which seems pretty unhygienic. There was simply no shelf or area round the basin to put anything. The management were very responsive and moved my room the second day to a same category but with smaller bedroom and slightly bigger bathroom. The rooms themselves are nice, modern with floor to ceiling glass. I should mention that although quite good the curtains are not black-out which for some is important. On higher floors you have very nice city views. However on lower floors and particularly the rooms overlooking Bowery noise is an issue. I didn't have ID so wasn't allowed to order a drink in the rooftop bar even though I am 50 this year!! Maybe that's why it was empty? Location is good - 3 minute walk from the B/D lines and lots of Chinese and Italian restaurants close by.

Rooms are clean and updated. Bed was great. Room Fairly good size for New York. Friendly service at check in. Plenty of things to do in the area with a great beer bar on first floor. Price is reasonable. Save 20 dollars on parking at hotel and use spot hero. Plenty parking in area for about 30 a day.

We stayed here just one night. We came earlier before check-in hour however we were offered to store are luggage. The room was clean and spacious. I liked the large windows with a great uptown and empire view (12th floor). It was little bit problematic for me to control the elevator.

This is a brilliant hotel in a great location. Right in the middle of Chinatown, and a few blocks from Little Italy. Some great restaurants within 5 minutes walk. The rooms are great. Comfortable beds, very clean. Great views of the Manhattan skyline. Would recommend a trip to the Skyline bar for happy hour drinks. If we came back to New York we would definitely stay here again.
My stay was good, nothing to complained about maybe the shower door was a lil weird being only half covered

the hotel was great...comforting room are great, friendly staff, easy location. very kind and helpful staff help. modern decoration. comfortable beds thank you very much.Small and urban hotel but very comfortable!

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights on what was our second visit to NYC. We chose the China Town area as it was better located for the sights we wanted to visit on this occasion. We used booking.com and after some clever timing managed to get a superior Queen room at just over £100/night, which we thought was great value for a 4 star hotel in NY. The hotel itself was perfectly nice, we didn't have breakfast included do can't comment on that but reception staff were always available and although not overly friendly, perfectly polite and helpful.The gym was basic but although I used it each morning I never shared it with anyone! Plenty of towels and cold water down there, also a daily paper on the counter.There is a rooftop bar (one of our reasons for booking here) but we discovered it is NOT affiliated with the hotel and is actually quite a dump (see separate review). In my opinion Wyndham Garden would do well to completely disassociate themselves from it.The hotel is located on a very busy crossroads and I was concerned before we arrived about noise. Our room had floor to ceiling glass looking out over the main road and was very noisy- that would be our main criticism. I don't know if any rooms were less noisy but on the 5th floor the traffic, sirens, horns and traffic cop whistles were irritating to say the least, preventing us from getting proper sleep. The room itself was furnished to a good standard with a comfortable bed, large TV and basic coffee making facilities. The bathroom lacked thought though. The shower screen was attractive but not sufficient to prevent the rest of the bathroom (including loo rolls) from getting soaked. There was nowhere to even hang a hand towel and not one shelf to put any toiletries on, meaning we had to nip in and out of the bedroom for everything.Finally, the long gold curtains in the room would have been a lovely feature if they hadn't been desperately stained and in need of a good wash!

We had a terrible experience with an AirBnB and this hotel was available in NYC and the location and staff were incredible! The top bar was awesome and had great scenic views of NYC. We went during the winter so the rooftop pool and bar were not open but would love to go back and see it. We absolutely love the food in the area and found that everything was very close such as food and entertainment. Our flights home ended up getting canceled and the front desk was able to take care of us and allowed us a discounted rate to get rebooked in so we did not need to find a new hotel in the crazy times!

One of the two elevators were broken during my entire stay. And I stayed longer than a week. The espresso machine was also broken a couple of days. The breakfast was below par so I went out for breakfast. Other than that I was pleased. The small gym had what you need to stay in shape, the rooftop bar was trendy and well frequented. The cleaning was good and the noise from outside did not disturb me. A good choice if you're on a business trip, but don't come here for romance. Except if you're madly in love, because then everywhere is romantic.

Location was great, located right in the Chinatown and close to Little Italy and the public train station that'll bring you uptown. Many great restaurant near by and across the street from what use to be diamond district. The rooms are newer,clean but small compare to other nearby hotels. The beds are actually smaller then what one might be normal with, a double is the size of a twin, queen the size of a full.

We had a room with a balcony on the 15th floor. Amazing view!!! Ok sized room, but it could use an upgrade, bigger bed and more storage space. I liked that room always were nice and clean, and you get fresh towels whenever you need it. The hotel has a good vibe, with a very nice rooftop bar, with also an incredible view. On the first floor you'll find a beer garden, with food and drinks. We really liked it there! The location is great, if you like the buzzing feel of chinatown! A lot of great restaurants in the area. Short walking distance to the subway, if you want to head uptown or downtown/Brooklyn. Overall a great hotel, but a little highly priced for that standard.

We were looking for a hotel in the East Village area but accepted an expansion of the search area and ended up at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. The property: our room was clean, reasonable size for a NYC hotel and it did the job. The heat was off for the season and we had a cold snap --- the staff brought in a space heater which solved the issue. The lobby is rather plain. Now we were only looking for a place to crash at night so it wasn't that big of a deal but if you really want/need a vibrant lobby this place won't scratch that itch. Location: Now in all fairness I did agree to the search expansion so that's on me .... but the neighborhood is a bit more on the run down side than I might've imagined. On the other hand there is certainly the character of the many markets and bakeries and restaurants --- even a fish market. For the price it was a very reasonable deal.

I am truly baffled at the logic behind this nonsensical design. Why on earth would you have only HALF A SHOWER DOOR? It just doesn't make sense. It probably isn't because of a price thing, cheaper for just 1 shower door. It has to be a design thing. Let me tell you, DESIGN FAIL!!!! I sincerely hope they have good flood insurance because they will need it. They are just begging for a huge flood to occur from within. Aside from that, I enjoy a steamy, warm bathroom when I'm showering. With just one shower door, that did not happen. I was too concerened with that growing puddle water where there shouldn't be any to enjoy my shower. Even with 3 folded bath towels used as bath mat, not enough. It's ridiculous designs like this that I might have to start bringing along a shower curtain.The room is cozy, comfortable enough. (I've been told that by NYC standards, the size of the room is "huge". (don't compare, you only setting yourself for disappointment) When did compact become the new acceptable standard? It's not asking too much that I can walk around in the room and not be doing that walking on the bed. Becareful to not hit your head on the ceiling while walking!) Okay, I went off on a tangent there. The room isn't that small, I promise. I was able to stretch out my arms on all sides of me and not hit walls. It really was cozy and comfortable. It certainly was clean. Loved the floor to ceiling window. Looking out to a rainy and busy Chinatown on a Saturday morning is an experience. Couldn't figure out why there's a portion of the room that was wasted space. Perhaps it's a structural support beam or wall.
user_name:
ChucoBearrie
New York City, New York

review_body: After much research, I found that Wyndham Garden Chinatown gave the best deal for the money and for a hotel in lower Manhattan. The room was lovely, with floor to ceiling windows and a view of the skyline, including the Empire State Building. Apparently the rooms with views cost a little more, but just a little and it was so worth it. The bed was comfortable and there was a nice desk and fridge. The staff are very helpful and the room was clean. The hotel is in Chinatown, with plenty of tasty and affordable restaurants nearby. Subway stops, bus stops and cabs are all nearby. The New Museum is also nearby. The Village, Soho, Little Italy and LES are all within easy walking distance. I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is in a great location for visiting the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, Century 21 etc, all are within easy walking distance and there are subway stations within east walking distance to access midtown NYC.The hotel is very clean and the rooms are of a good size, we didn't eat here because there is so much choice close buy. The only issue for me as a light sleeper is the traffic noise, which picks up about 5:30/6:00am, it is not too bad at night as by the time we were getting back to the hotel the traffic had eased off.I would highly recommend this hotel for its location.

My wife, and I made a quick trip to NYC to do some sightseeing. The hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. Great staff, clean room with a great view, and in walking distance to some great parts of the city. Would definately stay here again if I make it back to NYC.

I didn't expect this hotel will impress me as it is located right in Chinatown. The lobby is simple and the check-in agent is very nice and fast. There are 3 different style of bar/lounge in this hotel. There is a bar located outside the hotel lobby and one on lobby level. Another one with the beautiful view of NY are on the 17th/18th floor. The 18th floor is open roof deck and you can bring your drink from 17th floor and sit there. Although the room is small but it is very nice and clean. The bed is comfortable and there is coffee machine provided. There are tons of restaurants that you can choose from Chinatown. Also the subway station is right on Canal Street and within walking distance. If you like shopping, this hotel is not the right choice. The business Center is located right on the lobby for the guest to use for free. They also offer free wi-fi service. Their check out time is 12 pm instead of 11am. You may leave your luggage for $3.50 per luggage after check out if you are not ready to go to airport yet. Overall they provide all the needs and convenience.
Bathroom needs better lighting. Could not shave with the poor lighting in the bathroom of room 305.

I would highly recommend this hotel if visiting the Chinatown area or the Financial District. The rooms were very clean and updated. Great views of the Manhattan skyline. And the staff was friendly and welcoming. The price was very affordable for Manhattan.

We have stayed in NYC multiple times but this hotel by far is the best for the price! Clean, well appointed rooms. Our suite was enormous by NY standards and there were plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. If you love to sing...private karaoke rooms are directly across the street. Will definitely be visiting this hotel again and again!

the room was very good and clean. The views are fantastic. The rooftop was good as well. The reception service ok the other hand was really bad. They even charged us for keeping the luggage in the last day while we were out during the morning. I'll never comeback
clean, professional service and very cozy, a different scale compare to many other choices that could be easily overpriced and unsatisfactory.

The hotel is beautiful and very clean, with one of the loveliest rooftop bars I've been to in New York (especially impressive because of its location, surrounded by much smaller tenement buildings that do not obstruct the view). The neighborhood is very interesting at the edge of Chinatown and Little Italy, and just below SoHo. Marvelous restaurants, the Grand Street subway station and a Whole Foods are a short walk away.

My husband and I stayed here 2 nights for a getaway. Was very skeptical about staying in Chinatown but loved the hotel and location. Very clean and modern. Room was spacious and clean and very comfy. Bathroom clean and modern. Balcony was amazing touch to the vaca. Being able to walk out and look at the city and have a beautiful View of the Empire State Building. Perfect stay for the best price and close to everything! Only problem was the bathroom shower. I just didn't get the concept of an open shower that was littearly open. But other then that loved the hotel and would stay again.

Noisy!Arrived on a Friday night and was given a room on the third floor facing Bowery street, partly hidden by a scaffolding. Monday morning , I was awakened quite early by the noises and talk of busy workers a few feet away. Asked for a more quiet room and was promptly and politely given a fair sized one on the same floor but not far from the elevators. My suitcases were conveniently moved for me. Staff was impeccably professional and attentive, the barman concocted an outstanding martini and Kumarie, the housekeeper always had a warm smile and welcoming attitude. I was disappointed though that so much sound came through the room from the passage way, doors closing, elevators and chatting kept invading my space.Enjoyed several ot the cheaply priced but tasty Chinese eateries nearby. Walked 15 to 20 minutes to cinemas on Houston, bookstores near Union Square. Overall had a lovely time. Would come back.

This newer hotel is very reasonably priced and being close to downtown and the bridge makes travel to different neighborhoods (even Brooklyn) super easy. Only complaint is the bar & restaurant are poorly run (if run at all no one seems to care) and in dire need of a visit from Jon Taffer of Bar Rescue.

Not our first stay in NYC and I took time and effort to find the right hotel for our stay. The location is ok, but the hotel poor. Unfriendly staff, particularly the bistro and bar staff, who were completely uninterested and basically rude. The only happy and approachable member of staff was the maid! Room was very small and freeeeeezzzzzing! So much so that maintenance had to seal the door and housekeeping placed blankets on the floor, (pic enclosed). NYC is an amazing place, but this bad experience has definitely affected our holiday.

We choose this hotel for its location, reasonable price and Trip Advisor recommendations. Despite a very long wait (there was no one at the front desk upon our arrival), we were not disappointed. We would have preferred a room on a higher floor with a better view but otherwise the room was very comfortable, clean (Thank you Kumane!), quiet and everything worked well. Both Chinatown and Little Italy are within easy walking distance as is the wonderful Tenement Museum. One note of interest. The near see through glass wall between the bedroom and shower was an unique experience for us in 208.

Stayed the 20th to the 24th February. Clean hotel but the rooms are tiny, to the point wear you have to climb over suitcases to get to the bathroom. We had second floor room looking at a brick wall. The sliding doors to the outside leaked noise and the wind whistled through the night. I asked to move rooms as I had emailed them twice requesting a nice room (it was a surprise trip for my boyfriends 30th birthday) I never got a reply. When I asked to move rooms I was told there would be a charge. Having already paid for my room I wasn't prepared to pay anymore. Shower is poor just spits the water out and floods the bathroom.Lovely rooftop bar on the 18th floor with amazing views at night, opens at 5pm. Even though we had been there all week we were asked for id on the last evening. Bar food is nice (only ate on first night as we were too tired to go out). Nice big portions. Nice friendly staff.One other issue I have, I was asked to leave my debit card details, which I did as I thought this was standard procedure. Only to find out from my bank yesterday they debited $40 from my account FOR NO REASON. I will be contacting them when my statement comes trough. The hotel was all paid for as a package through British Airways. I should not have been charged anything.Don't give your card details. In terms of location - I would stay downtown again. Apart from the one day when we visited the 9/11 memorial, statue of liberty and Brooklyn Bridge we spent the rest of time around central park and times square. So next time I will stay up that end. Not many restaurants around china town, there is little Italy but as the name says it's all Italian. which is fine for one night. All in all I wouldn't return to this hotel.
Nice hotel Have stayed last 2 x in nyc This time I faced front of building and the view and sun was best Have never eaten here as there is dim sum and other awesome food nearby

Room sizes are decent and the bed was comfy, the floor to ceiling windows are great. The hotel is very well situated in Chinatown in the Lower East Side, close to what little remains of Little Italy and the glorious Brooklyn Bridge. Several subway stops are close at hand. Customer service was typically brusque and indifferent, as seems to be the way in NYC, which, frankly, detracts from the many good aspects of this hotel. I ate breakfast here once, and it was overpriced and below average. Far better options are available a short distance away. Both bars were rather tepid and uninteresting. Given the paucity of options at this price range in NYC, I would definitely stay here again, but it would be nice if the staff could be a tad more warm and welcoming.3.5 stars.

We were on the 10th floor thinking that would be high enough to muffle the traffic sounds but we were wrong. Sounded like we were @ street level, very loud outside noises. Brought dollar store shower curtain liner that helped with keeping bathroom floor dry, worked well. Duct tape helped hold it up.

Great location, very close to manhattan bridge. Hotel was clean, everyone was friendly and helpful, especially our housekeeper, kumarie. Our balcony Room was much nicer and bigger than usually found in manhattan. Roof top bar was cool as well. Would highly recommend and will definitely stay here again.

Definitely recommend this hotel if you in love with Chinatown. Even this hotel is not "typical chinese hotel", the surroundings are amazing. Close to Metro, close to lovely restaurants (also near to Little Italy), lovely rooms with great view, perfect staff.

This hotel is in The Bowery which was synonymous with down and out when I was a kid. It's now a safe but messy neighborhood. And it's Manhattan where everything is ridiculously expensive.I was delighted to find this attractive, clean hotel in the midst of all that. The rooms were a good size for New York. Some had spectacular views through large, modern windows. The lobby bar had tasty appetizers and excellent service. There is also a bar on the top floor. It's comfortable, spacious and has an expansive view of the city. We were disappointed to find they did not serve food or snack there. I'm sure that will get fixed soon.

I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown for three nights in February 2017. I was in town for a solo vacation.What I Liked:1. The location. I wanted to stay in a part of the city that was not extremely touristy and this hotel is ideal if you want that type of experience or if you just specifically want to stay in the heart of Chinatown.2. They really maximize the city views with floor to ceiling windows in the rooms.3. The free WiFi in the rooms is easy to connect to and works great.4. You are within 3-4 blocks of multiple subway stops.5. The heat, bed, pillows, everything was on point and comfortable.What I Didn't Like:1. The bathroom. I didn't like it so much I am knocking a whole star off the review because of it. Despite being a very spacious bathroom, it is just not designed very well. The huge walk in shower has no "traditional" shower head and just a handheld sprayer on a sort-of adjustable arm. So you either need the sprayer always in one hand or have to somehow position it on that adjustable arm just so. Plus the water pressure was lame.Also, despite having plenty of room, there is literally no counter space in the bathroom at all. Luckily my Dopp kit is in a hangable bag, but if I didn't have that I have no idea where I would have put my stuff.The bathroom aside, I enjoyed the property and had a wonderful trip to the city. I am not in the hotel room all that much when in NYC, so if the place is clean and the bed is comfy I am pretty easy to please. I would stay here again.

Booked this hotel based on a Cyber Monday deal so this hotel was picked based on price instead of anything else. Location is in Chinatown, right next to Little Italy with the Grand Street metro station one block away. Very easy to get to. We were blown away by the views from our room. Room was a corner unit on the 16th floor with floor to ceiling windows. Had an amazing view of the Empire State Building from the luxury of our bed. And also a view of the Freedom Tower. Considering how little we paid for this hotel, the views were unexpected. The room is small, but the windows make it feel cozy rather than cramped. Bathroom was updated and clean. No complaints. Stayed here 2 nights. Aside from the room, didn't see or do anything else with the hotel. Breakfast isn't included so can't speak to the restaurant. Bottom line: we would definitely stay here again for those views!

Its a very nice hotel - for the price!!Location was not our favorite - besides thousands of asian stores, there are no supermarket, delli, or similar store nearby. Room was nice, people at the reception seemed at times like they did not care about the customers. We had to pay 3 dollars per item, while they stored our luggage, the last day - never tried that before. They did not refill soap and shampoo - also, water for the coffee/tea maker was also not refilled. So we had to buy those things ourselves.

I found an awesome deal through Travelzoo over Black Friday/Cyber Monday for just $79/night for this hotel, so I had relatively low expectations for that price. But our room (1602) was a corner room with floor to ceiling windows wrapping around two sides of the room with an incredible, unobstructed view of the Empire State Building. The room was very small, with a queen size bed, desk and bathroom, but it was sufficient for our needs. And I thought it was very nice and a great deal for the price!

Right in the heart of Chinatown, and not far from 911 Memorial, this hotel and its staff were centrally located for where I wanted to go. And the staff was great. If you're looking for a great place to stay after experiencing the city, this is the place.
user_name:
John H
New York City, New York

review_body: We love the location of this hotel, it is centrally located to everything. We stayed in room 1007 which was not facing Bowery. It was much quieter this time.

The Good:-Well priced for NYC, especially with the $99 Travelzoo special-Modern hotel, still small NYC rooms, but well appointed, nice bathrooms, clean-Nice lounge with a great view of the city on the 18th floor. Outdoor roof area would be very nice in warm weather.Not so Good:-Located in Chinatown, not really near most NYC attractions. Good subway access-Nickeled and dimed us:  -Charged us an extra $20 for a room above the 6th floor. Initial room we were given had a glass door to a 2nd floor roof area. My wife wasn't comfortable with the security. -Charged us $3 for a cup of hot water at breakfast. My wife had a cold and just wanted some hot water to drink. -Breakfast area was the dark lobby bar. Not real enticing. Food arrived on the cold side.

Rooms on the upper floors, with floor to ceiling windows, will give you a wonderful view of Manhattan, Brooklyn or both.Great staff, relaxed, understanding yet accommodating.Acceptable gym that allows you to have a full workout.Coffee machine in rooms, which is convenient. Despite all the positives, and me being a returning guest, I won´t come back until management comes it senses.At check-in I was informed that storage of would cost me USD 3.50 for each item.It´s not about the money, of course, but about principles. What´s next up for additional charges!? Welcome to our hotel, sir. Would you like to have air in your room? Well, that´ll be an extra 10 dollars a night.Though the staff handled my frustration beautifully, Wyndham Garden Chinatown has lost my business until management puts an end to this nonsense.

I stayed in this hotel a few times. It's very functional, clean, good service and provide great value. If you're on business or just visiting, you likely not going to spend much time in the room anyhow, take this hotel and spend the change elsewhere!

I had a great stay here! My room was bigger than I expected, I was never cold in the room, and the views of the city were great. I would definitely recommend staying here. I was skeptical because of some of the negative reviews but im very happy I chose to give it a try!

The hotel is not fancy but it is clean and the rooms with a view are great! Ask for a high floor with a view. We had a great time. Free wifi a mini fridge in the room. We'd love to stay there again soon
user_name:
Etabby4
New York City, New York

review_body: We selected this hotel because of the location and price. We were looking for something affordable because we needed 3 rooms for our group, and we wanted to be close to Brooklyn where we would be visiting family. The hotel is not fancy, but does have a lobby lounge as well as a rooftop lounge and restaurant. The rooms are small but well-laid out. Outside noise was minimal, which is helpful when you are in New York. It is right in the middle of Chinatown and about 2 blocks from Little Italy, so there are plenty of places to eat, as well as lots of markets with local flavor. It is also about a 10 minute walk to Soho for great shopping and restaurants, and about a 5 minute walk to the nearest subway station. One thing to be aware of - there is a frosted glass wall between the bathroom and the bedroom. When you are in the shower, you are literally right next to the bed on the other side of the glass. So, this could be a little awkward depending on who you are traveling with. Also, there is a half glass enclosure for the shower, so water tends to go all over the floor no matter how hard you try not to splash. Overall, the hotel was functional and affordable.

Found this Chinatown gem via Hotwire. Rooms are nice and clean (high standard with US measures). Staff (front desk, bar and restaurant) are very friendly. Very ambitious beer assortment in the outdoor sports bar on ground level. They also serve great tacos! Highly recommended in the summertime.

I stayed at the Wyndham Garden from Dec 28 - Jan 2. Upon arrival, I discovered that I had no hot water. I reported this to the front desk that afternoon, twice again on Thursday, twice again on Friday and again on Saturday. Finally, after four days, they finally moved me to a new room. The Front Desk people were completely rude about the entire situation.

This hotel room has the best view of any NY hotel I've ever stayed in. My room, which ends in 2, is a corner, with floor to ceiling windows in two directions, up to the Empire State Building, and east to the new World Trade Center complex. Ask for a high floor and a corner! Room is compact but clean and well appointed. I has little interaction with staff but what I had was good. Located in Chinatown with Little Italy right down the street. Nearest subway station is about 2-3 blocks away, which is good. The neighborhood is sparsely populated at night but feels safe enough if you are confident. Hard to find a late night bite nearby though, at least that was my experience midweek in winter. Overall this is a great option; I would absolutely stay here again.

I am very thrilled that I got to enjoy this beautiful experience at this hotel. Employees were very helpful. My room was very clean, and comfortable. I was very satisfied with the morning breakfast but there are also good food places around the area such as little Italy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to explore New York City and its beauty.

Great, quick overnight stay here. It was a 12-15 minute ride to/from the Manhattan Megabus stop and we checked in around 1 p.m. on Christmas Eve. We had no issues checking in early and the guy at the front desk upgraded us to a room with a view when he realized we booked a room without one. The lobby was nice and lobby bar looked nice, too. We booked a room with one queen and paid the $30 rollaway bed fee for my daughter. Although it was a small room, the room was very nice and comfortable. The floor to ceiling windows were wonderful and we loved the views. The bathroom was spacious and modern too. Although I didn't go, my husband told me there was a nice rooftop bar and they also have daily happy hour from 4-8 p.m. Pretty cool!I liked how this hotel was within Chinatown and also close to Little Italy. I was very pleased with our stay here.
Nothing worked, the air, the elevator the tv. I got a rollaway for one night was charged for 3. Impossible to get a hold of anybody. I don't know how this is a 4 star hotel, it was more like a motel.

I'd like to say, the staff is friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient. Lot's of public transportation around the are all within walking distance. I would like to thank the manager for following up with us after the stay. He is very proactive and handled the situation quickly and effectively.

The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was nice, comfy, and clean. Smaller rooms and bathrooms but being in the city it should be expected. If you're lucky to get a room and Bowery you have a great big window as your 4th wall with great city views. Room service was quick and delicious. The 24hr snack room is perfect for late night cravings...but you will pay extra for the on-site convenience. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend others to stay here.
user_name:
laurasI193OY
New York City, New York

review_body: Awesome staff and hotel! Very friendly and informative staff on all shifts. Rooms were clean and they go out of their way to help your stay be the best. Very accommodating to hold our luggage till we could check in after arriving early to start our day in NYC. Great location.

Excellent front desk staff & service. They allowed me to check in at 10am and shower. Even my room near the ice maker was quiet. Lobby bar has great inexpensive wines. Local food choices are great, such as Dimes Restaurant. Go for it. Terrific value.

Stayed here over thanks giving hotel was spot on for what we needed. Staff were great food and drink reasonable especially daily happy hour. Fantastic views of Empire State Building. If you like to go for a few drinks on a night the hotel is perfectly placed for all the nightlife on lower east side where you will find plenty cheap bars in clusters def will return

This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had, and I do not recommend for anyone to ever stay here. Our hotel room on the second floor was so cold it was hard to sleep, and the hotel staff were not helpful. I had turned the thermostat to the mid to high 70s, but this changed nothing. I called the front desk asking if there was anything they could do about how cold the room was, and the man came to our room, turned the thermostat temperature to 90 (the maximum) and said that was all he could do. The thermostat might as well have been a decoration on the wall because it simply did nothing. It did not work, and the room remained extremely cold. I called them again and said that the hotel heating system must be broken for this room as the thermostat does not work, and asked if I could be moved to a different room on a different floor. I was told that there were no other rooms available that night, and that there was nothing they could do. Frankly, I don't believe this, we were staying during a very quiet time and it's likely they had nicer rooms on higher floors available but simply refused to move us even though our room's heating was broken.This supposedly 4-star hotel in New York city costing $200+ per night had a broken heating system and they did nothing about it, and they refused to even have us move rooms. I don't know how they can think this is remotely acceptable.Personally, I will never stay at a Wyndham again. I had even called their customer support after the stay, and they never got back to me. For anyone reading this, you're much better off staying with SPG, IHG, Marriott, Hyatt or Hilton.

The room was nicely appointed, modern, comfortable, and clean.Views from a 16th floor corner room were gorgeous— could see so much of the city from there, and the Manhattan Bridge extends across the East River from Brooklyn Heights and to land in the neighborhood— you get to see that from an interesting angle.The room was impossible to get warm, though. Kept turning up the heat, but...Lobby had zero atmosphere and seemed minimally staffed. I wasn't looking to hang out there, so not a big deal. Check-in was prompt and easy.

We've stayed for 1 night (3 guests) in November. Pros: rooms were clean, with all basic amenities. The hotel is 10 min from soho, and right in chinatown, which provides the cultural experience of walking through the markets. Cons: staff was ok but there's room for improvement in friendliness and concern with the guests. Regarding the price i must say that NY is getting to be a very expensive and overpriced city, and although the 380$/night was probably the best tariff we could get in a good hotel, its really overpriced for the overall quality of the hotel... but its NY.... Another thing is that the hotel charges 3,5$/each piece for storing our luggage after check out. this service is free of charge in all hotels i have ever stayed.

I stayed here for 5 nights with my dad in July. We were with a group of people all staying at different hotels and I have to say I think we chose fantastically well. People had paid so much more for their hotels and we had more in our rooms than they did.Very welcoming reception staff and the foyer area is beautifully clean.Our room was an excellent size and we had two comfy twin beds. I loved the bedding it was so soft and comfortable, I slept so well here.We had a coffee making machine in our room, something that other people didn't have in other hotels. The coffee was excellent and was most enjoyable first thing in the morning.We had floor to ceiling windows and had views up towards the Empire State building.What I loved most is you walked out of the hotel and you were smack bang in the middle of China town and there was so much going on, but it was great being around normal New Yorkers rather than in Times Square with the tourists.So you can walk to the lower end of Broadway where all the shops are in 10 minutes, you can get to Little Italy in 5 minutes, you have at least 4 different subways to hand, lots of coffee shops in Little Italy. Round the corner near Manhatten bridge is a dunkin donuts for anyone wanting a quick breakfast, also along Canal St there is a 7/11 which is good to get snacks.There are so many restaurants nearby but we were on a schedule with family that we only ate at one of the Chinese restaurants nearby, I wish we had had more time to eat there again.I would not chose another hotel as I felt this hotel offered all that you needed plus it was in an amazing location that would show a new visitor more than being in Times Square.The hotel also have a fantastic roof top bar which we only visited once which i regret as the view was to die for!

Hotel is so so.Location is good in the heart of Chinatown, not far from Nolita.But hotel is the equivalent of a 3-star ratings.I wouldn't recommend to pay more than 200$ a night for a double room.Service is just ok, the minimum, no extra-mile.Terrible characteristic: you have to pay a fee for luggage storage which is shocking. The poor reason we were given to explain this: "our storage room is small hence limited. We have to collect a fee".I would't return to this place.

This is what you expect of a Wyndham property. Easy check in --maybe a wee bit longer than some if you want to be picky. Bed was comfy. Location was convenient and central in Chinatown near the B/D stop at Grand Street. Our room, 309, was conveniently across from the ice machine, and no, you did not hear it at all from the room. There was a good hotel bar but the view is much better on the roof bar. If you wanted to be outside, there was a 2 drink minimum though. And, no, you can't take drink back to your room unless you dumped it into a plastic cup. Major con was the flawed shower design. It was just a partial glass enclosure but it wasn't big enough so your rug was quite soaked with water.
I stay here often. Vanessa at the front desk greets you with a smile and is helpful and efficient. Give her a raise and some flowers! Love this place.
user_name:
James B
New York City, New York

review_body: Unfortunately my review will have more critiques than accolades. For those driving in (and leaving your car overnight) the valet drop-off is nearly non-existent during peak times - nothing is clearly marked; it's simply a parking spot on the corner of Bowery. Your car will then be driven to a satellite parking lot (my car was unscathed so no complaint there). The front desk upon my arrival was super helpful but I was surprised to see that she was the only staff (they could use more). The elevators during this time were pretty slow and reduced to only one operating - wait time matters when you're trying to get some rest. Thankfully there's a lot of good food and shopping within walking distance. The centrality of the location is great for convenience but not the best parameter for restful sleep. The showers in this place are kind of weird as they are separated by a half wall. There are great views of Manhattan available in the hotel's terrace bar. The bartender was kind enough to escort us to the empty deck on an overcast evening - do note that there was a two-drink minimum to access the patio area. By my valuation, the experience was overpriced but it was the right place to stay for a weekend getaway in Chinatown Manhattan. It beat having to coordinate with an airbnb host.

Traveling with 2 small dogs passing through for a day, we managed to get good parking and visited the 911 memorial, quickly drove to the hotel, parked at a place around the corner for 40$ for 24 hours, walked with in minutes to the hotel, was quickly checked in within minutes. The room on the 11th floor was above the clamor in the streets, gave a great evening view and was a a beautiful room, clean, and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. The bathroom was large and modern.Quite simply, wonderful hotel, and if you are a Wyndham rewards customer you can use your points and get a FABULOUS room and great location at a killer price.I would definitely stay in this hotel again and highly recommend it, and their restaurant which is an open air sports bar cafe which was also dog friendly, great staff, fantastic food.One street behind was a large safe park to safely walk a dog who prefers less hustle and bustle than a city street, just please be kind and pick up after your dog!Wyndham got this place bundled up perfectly, and it's nice to have a top of the line dog friendly hotel...THANK YOU!

I guess this is an average overpriced NYC hotel. Roomes are small, some with nice view. Other than that its pretty boring and undertsaffed. Reception and bar staff totally uninterested in guests and service nominal. Room was clean and housekeeping staff very polite and nice. Hotel is brand new so in good standard. In any case my stay there was ruined by the check out. Having 6 hours before my flight I wanted to leave my luggage with the consierge. To my surprice they asked for $3.50 plus tax per bag (small or big). The discussion around this and frustration to this pettiness made me now want to come back. I cant understand how a hotel, that charged me $70 for a night, would want to ruin csutomer experience by adding $7 to hold my luggage. It was obvius that the staff was accustomed to guest being upset about this. They told me it was the first hote they had worked at that charged for holding luggage. To make matters worse, Wwen I came back to collect the luggage the reception area was deserted, my uggage was sitting unguarded in the little store in the reception. I could just grab it and leave wand nobody noticed. So basically anybody could have stolen the luggage.

I recently stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel in Chinatown. While the location was great, the room was clean, and staff generally friendly, they had a major computer glitch where we had to be let into our room or wait for someone to be available to let us in.I also inquired about a complimentary upgrade since we were staying four nights, and were positioned right across from the ice machine, which made noise throughout the day and night. For the first two days, I was told they were sold out and they couldn't move us for the first two nights. You can imagine how upset I was during the third night (Friday) when I asked how full they were, and the person letting us into our room casually replied, "Not too busy, we're not sold out tonight".Since this computer glitch happened, into my second night there, another guest and I asked what the hotel would be doing to give us a discount for the inconvenience. We were told that they would straighten this out and by giving us a credit later. It's been 12 days since and my credit card was just charged, with no invoice or credit whatsoever for any part of my hotel stay. When I called and asked, they would not give me the name of a manager to talk with because they were overwhelmed with trying to fix the computer problem, and asked me, "Could you call back tomorrow?"I asked that they call me back tomorrow and gave them my number. Then I was told that someone might call me back in a few days, they "could not guarantee that someone could call me back tomorrow." If this was the case, then why did he ask me to waste my time calling back, when he couldn't "guarantee me an answer?"I pointed out that they went ahead and charged my credit card with no notice of what the charges were, even though I left my email address with them. I also pointed out that the dates were all wrong. At least he acknowledged the date problem on the invoice.I would have rated them much higher if I had gotten some good pro-active customer service during the four times that I inquired about the problems. Still waiting for this to be resolved.I get that it wasn't the staff's problem with the technical glitch; however, after seeing them note down my name and being told that they have to deal with "hundreds of guests" that was not good customer service. I pointed out that I'm one of those guests and also deserve an answer.

We stayed the weekend of Oct 22. Left the room Saturday morning on a rainy, cloudy day with mid-50's temperature, and returned at 11:00 pm to our lower-floor room that was 78 degrees (I assume that if appliances were on and warm bodies were present during the day it would have been even warmer ). The front desk told me that the hotel switched that day to heat for the winter season and they can't provide air conditioning as well. Without operable a/c or windows, room comfort was sorely lacking. Perhaps in deep winter on sunless days when temperatures are freezing there will be no risk that a/c is required. But if 78 degrees is your room temperature, then I recommend this hotel. Room is small but not especially so for small NY rooms. Furniture, bed are new and comfortable. Great lower east side location.

This is the second time I have stayed here- both times the staff were great. They are friendly, helpful and very informative. The place is very contemporary with an Asian influence. The rooftop bar has a great view and the rooms are nice. As we were going to visit MOCA (Museum of Chinese in America- a must see) on Centre Street - this location was very convenient.

Nice hotel in Chinatown. Very nice staff, attentive even though they had to deal with key systems being on the fritz. Lovely bathrooms and very comfortable beds. Excellent views from floor to ceiling windows. Would definitely stay again.

We have stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown four times, and will continue to come in the future. It is very modern and clean, conveniently located, and the staff is very attentive, friendly, and helpful.

The Wyndham Chinatown is the best place to stay in NYC. It's your home away from home. They have excellent customer service, and they do their best to make your stay a pleasurable experience. The hotel is clean. That sweet mist that greets you as you step in is so welcoming and refreshing. Thank you for everything

For 269.00 per night, this Wyndham was a pleasant surprise. I needed to stay near my daughter who was moving into the East Village. This hotel although, possessing an unremarkable lobby, had clean, modern rooms with an updated bathroom, white duvets and careful housekeeping. I've stayed in more expensive hotels who have offered less. They are undergoing some construction but are up front about it and the work does not start until 9:00am. Very easy to get a cab or uber from the front. I never had to wait more than 5 minutes.

I've stayed here on four separate occasions and have enjoyed my stay every time. I absolutely love the location at the edge of Chinatown. It is very convenient to walk to a number of different subway lines from here and if you like Chinese food, well, you are in heaven. I'd much rather stay here than the tourist traps near Time Square or Central Park. That being said, the hotel is showing its age -- a bit. I found my room just a little more worn and dirty than on past visits. There was hair in my bed and the bathroom smelled musty. Both were minor issues -- really no big deal. There are many good places to eat around the hotel so I usually eat outside the property. The beds are comfortable, showers run hot and room temperature easy to control. You might want to bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The hotel is on a busy corner and noise from the street can be an issue if you are on a lower floor, though I can sleep through just about anything. I can't say the staff is terribly friendly, but they are not rude either. I'm still giving this hotel four stars and will stay again.

I'm a Marriott guy but my wife and I needed to be very close to the MOCA (Museum of Chinese in America. I'm glad she booked it. We had a marvelous 15th-floor view with an extended balcony. Only a couple floors have this type of balcony. It actually extends the length of the building so you can actually pass other rooms if you so choose. We were happy enough basking in the view where we were (looking north towards the Empire State Building). We did go to the rooftop (19th floor) and saw a more panoramic view where we saw the new World Trade Center.The service was excellent. The room was small but hey, this is NYC so that is expected. My wife was here a year earlier where she said she did not have the view nor was the room laid out well. This time, the room was laid out better according to my wife. For me, the room could have been laid out a little better. We had a queen size bed with a nice flat screen TV coming out of the wall. Because the room is small, it took me 3 tries before I remembered to lower my head when walking around the bed. If you are shorter than 5'6" you are safe! Everything is contemporary, clean and well done.It's the unique neighborhoods that make this hotel stand out. It is very near to Manhattan Bridge for easy access by cab, Uber, etc. Chinatown is at your doorsteps with all the great restaurants. MOCA is also walking distant and so is Little Italy and Soho.We noticed the heat did not work but I did not bother telling the front desk as I only wanted to quickly warm up the room a few degrees. The A/C had been on upon arrival making the room a little chilly. You will be paying NYC prices unless you get some kind of special.
First time stay at Wyndham Chinatown was a great experience! Centrally located to little italy, soho, flatiron, financial district. Quiet rooms, clean, great views.

Good location with Grand St station around the corner and easy walking distance to Lower Manhattan, Little Italy. Great views on higher floors although the sky bar was expensive. Would stay here again.

Great view of the city and location. Very clean rooms. But most of all, the service was impeccable. All of the staff was very helpful with our crazy heavy luggage & local accommodation for food and fancy cocktails. I will return for sure.

Stunned by the price of hotels in New York City during the global UN Meetings when every country's President was in town, I searched for an alternative: an affordable room. I expected I'd be unhappy with whatever I found...but i knew it was the cost of staying in NYC this particular week. I found a room at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. 93 Bowery. Uh-Oh! I'd heard about washing up on the Bowery all of my life. I expected panhandlers and toothless drunks.What I found instead was a lovely hotel with friendly staff, excellent views of midtown and quiet. True, believe it or not quiet. Amazing. I'll stay at this hotel again and again. Thanks Wyndham for providing this great alternative!

We took a chance on this hotel through a Groupon and are VERY GLAD we did. We loved the location, being able to walk a block into Little Italy late in the evening after a day of touring NYC was perfect. The room was small but very nice. We reserved a room with a balcony, loved having the balcony access - great views. The street level bar was also very nice. We'll definitely stay here again!

I arrived in NYC late and didn't get to the hotel until 2 am. The staff was friendly and quickly helped me to my room. When I opened the curtains to look outside, I couldn't believe the view.....gorgeous! Terrific bar on roof as well. Highly recommend. Lots of affordable restaurants nearby.

Friendly staff, clean rooms and a great view. Parking is challenging but they do valet, just be patient. Great little beer garden type restaurant on site. Right in the heart of China Town, tons to do, all within a short walk. Will stay there again.

I travel to N.Y.C. on business about once a month and normally stay in Midtown Manhattan. I had difficulty getting a room at the hotel I normally stay at, so I chose the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown. What a delightful surprise when I stayed 2 nights. The hotel staff were excellent and very cordial and accommodating making me feel very welcome and at home. You are right in Chinatown and about 2 blocks away from Little Italy. I will stay there on my next trip to the City..
user_name:
labrmon
New York City, New York

review_body: Really friendly service, very clean room, and I happened to have a large terrace accessible from my room for the other rooms on my level. Kumare was cleaning other rooms on the floor when I arrived. She greeted me with a huge smile and told me her name and said to let me know if I needed anything. As I was leaving she saw me again and wished me well. Definitely not your typical hotel service. Well done!
Vanessa was very helpful.There was a problem with shower and she promptly resolved it.She also confirmed that my new room was satisfactory. I will definitely Italy stay here on my next visit.

This past weekend I flew in from Dallas on a Sunday nite and arrived in NY around 930pm I was in town for business and was advised that everything had been handled. When I arrived at the hotel the Manager name Shon told me that the business credit card he had on file could not be used because there was no authorization mind you this was not true the DA's office has used the hotel numerous of times. I advised management that I just arrived it was late and where was I supposed to go because I had reservations with them, he told that wasnt his business. He never offered any other solution and even told me I was trying to force my way into the hotel. It was almost 1030pm he told me to call the people who booked the hotel and i kept advising them there was no way to reach anyone in fiscal at that time of nite and he still didnt care. I called the govt travel emergency line and he was even rude to them and still didnt budge. I asked him for his name and he just said Shon and when I asked for a last name he refused to give it. Also asked for general managers info. In the end I had to pay for the room with cash and deal with his bs late at nite because of an error on their part. The hotel is nice and in the mix of everything but i will not be staying here again

Although the room was small (and I do mean small), it was more than sufficient. First, the room was laid out well, so the size did not matter as much. Second, housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room and bathroom every day. There was a safe, refrigerator and coffee pot in the room. I also slept well. The hotel was about 2 blocks from one subway stop and 3 blocks from another stop. I did not eat in the restaurant or use the exercise room. I would stay there again, especially if I could get the same deal on the room rate.

This is a solid, reliable choice, with a terrifically convenient location and value. It's easy to catch a cab here anytime. I'm glad to have stayed here, and I would happily do so again. It delivers on the essentials: cleanliness, noise levels under control (despite being above the busy Bowery), free strong wifi, sufficient supply of towels and bath robe, good water pressure and temperature controls in the bathroom, and adequate toilet pressure. The bright, well-designed rooms mostly face north (always great light levels), with floor-to-ceiling windows that mitigate their modest sizes. If you go above the 15th floor, you'll be rewarded with spectacular views of midtown. Compliments to the afternoon clerk Daniel, who cheerfully checked me in, and was very friendly and helpful.While the basics are absolutely solid at this hotel, but why don't I rate this place higher? A few small details prevent it from being a great hotel. The luggage check is somewhat chaotic due to lack of space. The food at the ground floor restaurant is generally forgettable. More than anything else, it also feels somewhat impersonal, even though it's not that huge a hotel. It's certainly does not feel unfriendly, but it doesn't feel all that welcoming either. Even when they are not ostensibly busy, most clerks here are completely indifferent as you come and go. Just a few nods or subtle smiles of acknowledgement will do wonders. Frankly I took these gestures for granted until now, when it's missing.

I always come to this place, but I feel that the service and rooms has gone down.My room was HOT. The AC didn't work. I requested service to look into it, but recommended to provide a fan — except a huge fan was already in the room. All it did was blow more hot air.I didn't sleep well that night.

Everything was excellent... Just one thing I thought was odd was my shower. There was no door/curtain...just a half of a glass wall. My concern is, the floor outside the shower was getting wet. I was very worried about falling.

Got the hotel for $260 with tax on September 8th in the afternoon. Had to cancel it a couple hours after. The hotel didn't let us, they were going to charge us the whole stay even if we weren't staying. I found it very unfair. Because we booked the hotel for the next day not the 8th, but the 9th. They didn't let us change the date unless we paid the difference of another $200. But we ended up going anyways. They gave us a free drink at the bar which was nice. We had room 1205. Very nice view. The bathroom was a little confusing with the half glass door. Overall nice and small room. They have a restaurant in the top floor but we didn't go. It's a good location for the train. Very upset that we paid $50 for valet. And when we asked for the car the next day it took about 45 mins to get it to us when the car was only parked one block away. Very upsetting waiting for it. I had a couple of disappointments but overall nice room.

We stayed here for 4 nights. I slept very well all nights so the most part. The beds are very comfortable as are the pillows. It was very hot during our stay and the AC in our room could not keep up. The beds don't have top sheets, only a comforter which was too hot...but I can't sleep without some sort of cover.....so, I used the comforter and often woke up drenched in sweat. The rooms had a nice TV with decent channel options as well as a safe, refrigerator, and a coffee maker. There was a small closet but very little other storage. The bathroom was a major challenge as there was no door on the shower, only a half wall which meant the entire floor for soaked. Between that and the humidity in our room, our towels were all completely drenched everyday. The only other complaint about the bathroom was the door. It was glass! And didn't latch properly and offered very little in terms of privacy. The restaurant onsite offered decent food, some things we got were really good, others not so much. Service was spotty. If I need to stay in Chinatown again, I will consider staying here again, but will also look into other options. Front desk staff was nice. The lounge on the 18th floor was nice but offered the same view we had from our room on the 11th floor.
What a great hotel. From check in to check out the staff was great and hotel lovely. We really enjoyed being next to Chinatown and Little Italy.

Just had a lovely holiday in New York and we stayed in this fabulous hotel. Every member of staff we came across were very friendly and helpful , nothing was too much trouble.The rooms were small but had everything you needed , bathrooms were top class and as for the view from your window priceless. Everything was spotless prices in the bar were on par with everywhere else. I would definitely stay here again

Can someone help please. This isn't a review but I am looking for some information please. I have just booked a 4 night surprise break for my boyfriends 30th in February. We will be staying at this hotel and and first I thought it was the best decisions. However, after reading more reviews im not sure. I wasnt aware I would be staying in china town, not that that matters but how far out are other restaurants. I like a chinese meal but not every night. How much are taxis to places like central park? What is the subway like? if it's like London then it's a nightmare? I'm a bit nervous about those sort of things. We want to see the usual Central Park, world trade centre, gound zero. Eat in some quirky little cafes. We are not BIG drinkers but how near are the bars? Can anyone give me some feedback please. I need to know I have made the best choice!!!!

We were impressed the first time we used this hotel 2 years ago and this time it met all our expectations again. Located in an interesting and lively Chinese neighbourhood, but feels very safe, with several subway stations close-by. Within walking distance of Little Italy.The rooms are immaculate, very modern decor with spacious shower. Views from the room of Manhattan skyline very impressive especially as external walls are all windows from ceiling to floor. Very quiet other than the normal city sounds.

This hotel was just what I was looking for. Reasonable price, great location, clean contemporary room and great service. Located mid way between midtown and downtown Manhattan in Chinatown and steps away from Little Italy, this hotel was a welcome surprise. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and well attended to. Perhaps the best part are the views from the floor ceiling windows. Highly recommended.

I've stayed at over 20 hotels from 2 stars to 5 stars, and have never written a bad review until now. First of all, when we got there, the front desk was cold. Asked us for our ID but when we handed it to him, he just stared somewhere else for ~5 minutes, leaving us to stand there awkwardly. Then we find out that our room wasn't available despite us getting there at 7. We had to wait while he found another available room. It seemed like originally we were supposed to have a higher floor room as he first checked the rooms on top, but after he placed us on the second floor, you know because they weren't available. Housekeeping apparently still hadn't cleaned it?Then the issue of the elevator- it seems the buttons don't work consistently. Some times after we swipe it would light up other times we had to press it multiple times. Oh and the elevator seems old and small too.When we got to our room it was tiny. I mean I could understand that part at least, but it was still small even for NYC standards. Another issue was the fact that there was no laundry machine. Seriously? 4 stars and no laundry?Sometimes there was no present staff at the front desk as well. IDK how this hotel has a 4 star rating.

As others have said, great location; great views on high floors; AC is inadequate on warm days; rooms are very very small. Note that if you book a balcony room, the 'balcony' may just be access to the lobby roof on the second floor. To get a balcony with a good view you need a room on the 15th floor. Those rooms are sold by Wyndham as 'executive queen'--- 16th floor rooms w/o balcony are also sold as 'executive queen' so check that the description says balcony AND 15th floor. Other types of rooms could be on any floor.

The hotel is spectacular-looking from the outside, especially for the area, but all that glass comes at a price. I was in a corner room and could never get the temperature below 73 degrees, even though the thermostat was set at 60. I was told that it was because it was a corner room and I had two glass walls and the AC was blowing in the wrong direction. They tried to alleviate it with giving me a fan to help circulate the air, but it didn't do very much good. Of course, as I was leaving I found out one of my coworkers was also in a corner room and her temp was always at 68. So, who knows.The lobby is tiny, it's slightly claustrophobic, but that's NY. The other thing that was crazy, like I almost switched rooms, was when I got into bed, I could feel the end of the unfitted sheet on my feet. Like, the maid forgot to tuck it under the mattress. This, more than anything, was the biggest strike against them. I quickly realized I was insane to get irate over this and dealt with it, but it's just not something you expect at a hotel, especially a Wyndham!Anyway, in general it's nice, the 18th floor bar with the skyline view is great, but the rooftop bar, with it's insane spending minimums was not visited.

The Good: Room was very small (even by New York standards) but was well appointed. Our room had a great view of freedom tower. Some staff were very friendly. Decent location. Good value.The bad: We stayed eight nights and were room didn't get a proper clean the entire time we were there. Our shower leaked onto the bathroom floor and the floor was filthy by the time we left. There was also an issue with shower pressure, it would die off every so often and the temperature would drop before coming back on and scalding you.

My stay was great! Will definitely return :) I wish i knew the name of the person who checked me in on that Saturday August 13th around 7 pm. He was very polite and helpful and to top it of had a great smile on his face!
user_name:
Alejandra E
New York City, New York

review_body: i absolutely love this place the staff is so nice and the rooms are always immaculately clean , not to mention the views of the. it's skyline i love it
Overall a great experience here. The room was clean and tidy, and staff was very friendly. We will be back for our next trip to NYC.

We were fortunate to have a room on a higher floor in a corner at the front - lying in bed we could see up Bowery and clear view beyond to the Empire State Building. It was a stunning view! From the other window we could see the new Trade Centre and financial district. Amazing views! Our room was spotlessly clean, bed really comfortable and en suite was good - more water pressure for the shower would be nice though. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient - big thanks especially to the night manager Mark who is from Liverpool:) It's a 5-10 minute walk to a subway station at Canal Street which gives you quick routes up and down town. Don't miss out on the Penguin Ice Cream shop that is opposite the hotel - unique way of making ice Cream!! We had a meal at the XO Chinese restaurant just a two minute walk away and the food was superb. Avoid Little Italy which is a five minute walk away - tourist trap that is expensive.
