Great location, excellent, friendly staff. Awesome outdoor bar, beer garden. Free WiFi everywhere!!!Visiting rooftop bar was mixed experience. The view is spectacular, the staff was kind of behaving strangely. Maybe because we have arrived just an hour before closing. Still, the view will stay, waiters may not :)Good value for money.

I was preparing to write an awful review... then along came a front desk staff member (Mark) who was genuinely friendly and helpful. It's funny how one person can change your feelings about a hotel by seeming genuinely caring.I admit that I was a bit annoyed from the start, when I called to talk to the hotel itself and could NOT get through... only to the main 800 Wyndham number. The 800 staff would not give me a direct hotel number... would only relay my questions while I waited on the phone. (i had some super specific questions, like whether the floor-to-ceiling windows were treated for privacy... the answer was going to affect the sleeping attire i brought.) I also requested the highest floor in our category and/or a corner room, letting them know it was a special occasion. There was absolutely no mention of this... no note of congratulations... no nothing. We had paid for a more expensive 'empire view' room' because it was a special anniversary. Our room barely had a view. Our request was ignored and when we politely asked, the answers were super officious. You know the drill... "well, mam. we can get you a higher room for X-amount per night.... The woman working the front desk VERY grudgingly moved us to a corner room the second day (so annoying... i believe they are just betting that clients will not want to pack and move if they put off the room change to the next day.) I DO believe that she knew that the air conditioning wasn't working properly in the new room. It was almost 100 degrees that weekend. We got home that night, having let them know earlier that the air wasn't working, only to find an oscillating fan set up in the room. REALLY??So --- unbelievably hot and tired (being a tourist isn't easy!!) --- and on our actual anniversary night, we had to pack up and move again. In fairness, our next room did have a beautiful view. However, it had a balcony outside the windows, which I don't recommend. As others have mentioned, it is open to all rooms on the floor so there is really no privacy if your neighbors decide to walk around-- back and forth-- which our neighbors did frequently. (**note to future guests-- stay in front of your own room to enjoy the view!! It's just good manners, no?? Also-- the smell of (I assume prescription) pot was so very heavy on our floor that it was even strong in our room. This went on for 3 days. One could smell it from the elevator. I don't understand why the hotel doesn't take some control of this. I certainly didn't want to be the floor monitor on this issue, and chance an unpleasant confrontation with our neighbor. I feel this should have been their job... and it would be IMPOSSIBLE for them not to know. Honestly--- read my hundreds of reviews. I'm not usually so negative and am really quite forgiving. But this hotel has a couple of very unpleasant people at the front who really put us off so that things like broken air conditioning became harder to overlook.What we loved? The bed was super comfy. The room was kept super clean. The large windows are beautiful. We had a yummy breakfast in the bar area. Water pressure was excellent. Wifi was good. The rooms were very well insulated so that we couldn't really hear our neighbors. We liked the neighborhood... close to such a variety of cultures and experiences. They need to hire front desk staff that does a better job of at least pretending to care about needs and concerns.

Lovely place. Perfect location. Disappointed that the rooftop bar was closed the entire visit. Nice patio, street level bar. Close to Little Italy, Soho, etc. great views from upper floors. Clean rooms, nice beds. Staff were very helpful. Wish the rooftop was open.
The showers don't have a complete barrier, which guarantees you will flood the bathroom.The elevator was broken the 3 days we were there.Convienient location and the chambermaids were helpful.
Staff at the front desk were knowledgeable and efficient. The room was nice, clean and a great view of the city.

The room was small, but very comfortable and clean. I slept well all three nights. It was nice having a fridge and small safe in the room, both of which I used. And, even though the neighborhood is busy during the day, there was no noise at night when I went to bed. The hotel is two blocks from one subway stop and about 3.5 blocks from another subway (different subway lines). Unless you like Chinese food, the food options were limited in the immediate area. I would stay here again.

Stayed 2 nights at the hotel on a business trip and was totally pleased with the accommodations and staff. Shon was outstanding at the front desk, Diane and Lindsay (Sales) department went above and beyond to assist me. The room was very clean and comfortable. Location was perfect to where I needed to stay. The rate was perfect and affordable. Great job to the team at the hotel!
user_name:
Anthony T
New York City, New York

review_body: I recently spent a week in New York on business and stayed at the Wyndham Garden in Chinatown. The location is perfect. Walk a few blocks down Hester and your in Little Italy, and a few more your in SoHo. When I was there the temperature was almost 100! I found my room a little hot and let Vanessa at the front desk know that I would like to have my air condoning looked at. The next morning I told Vanessa that my room was still on the warm side. She informed that she had reported the issue and it was being addressed. When I was leaving I spoke to Mr. Mecca the night manager about my situation, and he said he would be willing to compensate me for issue with my room. I sent an email to the Sales Director and complimented all the staff I met at the hotel and thanked her for the compensation I was offered. I travel at least 2 weeks a month, and have stayed at Wyndham properties in many states. Problems can occur that are not resolved immediately or can't be, but how the staff and administration respond is what makes the difference. I look forward to my stay at the Wyndham Gardens Chinatown.

I come to NY on business several times a year. Sometimes I stay uptown, other times I stay downtown, depending on where the majority of my meetings will take place. I'm a former NYer and I've always loved Chinatown, and this location is great--easy access to many subway lines, fun restaurants in Chinatown, great restaurants across Delancey St in Nolita. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable and the staff helpful. Depending on what time of year you come, room rates vary, but I have always found it to be a good to excellent value. And you are in the heart of one of the last true neighborhoods in NYC--one that hasn't been over gentrified to expensive twee-ness or mall-ness (and you can easily walk or train to find either experience).

I stayed 1 night on 4 Jan 2016 and paid a total of $123 = Hotel Tonight $104 rate + $19 taxes and fees. First impression: Fancy for budget in NYC. New hotel in Chinatown. Small sink. I don't think I'd go back, unless it was similarly priced, but it wasn't BAD or worthy of a 3-star rating. Small (but very nice and modern) rooms. Bathroom sink was really small, bathroom overall just so-so. BUT… VERY COOL: There’s a Penthouse bar on the 18th or 19th floor that had a cool vibe, floor-to-ceiling views looking uptown (Empire State Building was visible)… and zero people inside on a Monday night at 9pm. I love empty spaces like this, so I'd recommend it. If you're coming here as a business traveler, you won't be disappointed, you can get work done and it is a modern room. But the location isn't ideal, sort of a "dead zone" for hot restaurants etc. 4 stars is a perfect rating for this at that price.
user_name:
NickIFE
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is just a few minutes from Bowery and Grand st. Stations. We caught the J train from Jamaica after our arrival from the airport, so cheap. We even caught the train to Coney Island and back for the day. It is also a few minutes from the restaurants of Little Italy. We used the subway a lot, so it was no problem staying far from midtown, two to three stops from the action really. At night it was the best because we loved to eat at the restaurants nearby. We thought the staff were reserved but polite when we had questions. The room was a good enough size, clean and comfortable with an excellent TV just in a perfect position to watch it from bed. Bathroom big and super clean but the glass shower screen is definitely too small, so to stop the water from spraying everywhere, the pressure is low, so you cant take a quick shower because of that. The water was plenty hot enough though. The maid always left plenty of towels, of every size and her cleaning was the best I have enountered in any hotel stay. We had a wardrobe, safe, coffee machine with pods and teabags, a fridge and free water. The Chinatown location shouldn't bother anyone if they take the subway. It took us a day or two to get used to it. In summary, the hotel is an excellent choice for a very clean comfortable stay that doesn't charge the earth, with great restaurants and souvenir shops within walking distance.

Clean room however too noisy (both from the street and other guests). I think it is overpriced. I only stayed for one night and chose this as I needed the be in the area and other budget hotels seemed unsafe/unclean. Otherwise very close to transport.

I stayed here for 8 straight nights, with the first four as a solo traveler, and the last four nights with a roommate. For the first four nights, I was given a 12th floor queen room, with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. Since I had a roommate joining me for the last half of my stay, I had reserved a double twin bed room. Because my roommate was arriving after taking a red eye flight, I asked if I could check into my new room early so that I wouldn't need to store my bags after I checked out of the first room. The staff went out of their way to help. They said that if the new room wasn't ready by the time I needed to leave for a meeting, I could just leave our bags in my old room and they would transfer them for us. Instead, housekeeping and the front desk worked hard to quickly get our new room ready. It happened to be the room right next door, so it made things very simple.The location of the hotel is perfect for those who want to stay in Manhattan, but not pay the price for being in midtown Manhattan, and avoiding the isolation of the FiDi. The Grand Street subway station is a very short walk, and that station has express service to the West Village, midtown, and into Brooklyn. Yes, the hotel is located in Chinatown, which can get crowded, with dirty streets, and an assault on the senses if you're not used to it. Get over all that. This is New York CIty.The only complaint I have about the hotel is something that they are unable or unwilling to address. There is absolutely NO way to have a shower and not create a flood. The glass partitioning wall does nothing to keep the water inside the shower. You'll need at least another towel or two to have on the floor because the shower mat they provide is woefully inadequate. I'm not usually someone who has housekeeping come into my room on a daily basis, but this was the only way to ensure getting fresh towels and clearing out the wet ones.

WE were upgraded to a room on the 16th floor with a great view of uptown NY! Very romantic. Check in was easy. The room was clean and we were offerered a noon check out.Disappointed that the hotel charges $4 to store your bags? I have never heard of that before. Additionally, this hotel boast a beautiful rooftop bar but we were unable to access this unless we paid $50.. very disappointed as that was the single reason we reserved this place to begin with

From the Grand Street subway you can get almost any where you want to go in Manhattan or Brooklyn. Very clean, polite staff, and well maintained.The room service is cash only as its separate from the hotel. And don't be surprised by the $3.50 per bag fee if you want to leave luggage before your flight (we did this at 10 and were back by 11:30 so didn't understand why the clerk didn't wave it, since we could have kept the room...).Shower was super squeaky and you can hear sounds in the rooms next to you, but thankfully our hallway was relatively empty.They also have envelopes to leave money for the cleaning staff in the room which is a great gesture. Would stay again.

Overall everything was great. Room was clean, modern, and new-ish. Only complaint was the shower that doesn't have a curtain but rather a partition wall. The water sprayed out quite easily on the floor.
user_name:
occasiontraveler1234
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I love this hotel the staff are very professional nice atmosphere very respectful nice hotel clean room Diane is amazing she's very sweet made me feel like I was home I felt comfortable from the moment I met the staff I will def recommend this hotel to others "two thumbs up !!!!!

Loved this hotel. Clean, modern room, good bed and furniture, good tv selection, coffee machine in the room, and absolutely beautiful views of the city. Only con was that the airco was a bit loud, and so was the icemachine in the hallway just outside my door. Allthough nice to have an icemachine on the floor, I would have preferred if they placed in the basement. Location is fine, walking distance to a lot of nice neighbourhoods, various subway lines in the vicinity,easy to catch a cab. Be aware that Chinatown in summer gets kinda smelly though when you walk around on the street at night or in the morning.Overall excellent value for money.

Room and hotel was fine. Receptionist at check out was really the worst I ever met, looked away and didnt care about my questions to the bill.Chinatown is Chinatown.So, if you prefer helpful staff and clean streets, stay away. Otherwise, the hotel is good value for money.

Stayed at this hotel several times and would not stay anywhere else. Very Clean. Centrally located to so many places in Manhattan. Subway close by to make the whole city easily accessible. The front desk staff was very friendly. Ling was such a great help in coordinating transportation to the airport.

I recently had my third stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown. I chose this hotel because the rooms are immaculate, the staff are friendly with a focus on customer service, and the hotel is conveniently located near mass transit (subways and buses). The icing on the cake is the SPECTACULAR floor to ceiling window views of New York City. A pleasant surprise for my third stay was the new outdoor Beer Garden with great food and drinks. I'm already looking forward to my next stay and happy to give this property an EXCELLENT rating. Free Wi-Fi is also a nice perk!

The new outdoor beer garden is great! It was so enjoyable to sit outside and enjoy a few drinks! The hotel itself is clean and the staff is friendly. We were really excited to be able to walk to dinner in Little Italy. I'll definitely stay again.
user_name:
kpdeming
New York City, New York

review_body: Convenient - non touristy location. Hidden Gem with great views. Rooms are very modern and the Outdoor bar is a great addtion to enjoy New York. Great for finding little restaurants and avoiding the insanity Times Square hotels.

Such a great experience! I hadn't been to the city in decades, I ended up here and it couldn't have worked out better! GREAT service! GREAT location! From the gentleman who checked my in and just about everybody in between. Diane and Lindsay were amazing and have won my business. Kumarie took care of the room and is probably the best I've come across, great outlook and positive energy. (I spend 70-100 ntgs/year on the road) Thanks to the team, I look forward to coming back! Rob

Great location with nice clean rooms with a trendy chic look! The beer garden and the rooftop was also a kool place to grab a drink before dinner, very awesome views! I can't say enough about the staff and how accommodating they were during our stay. I would definitely stay here again!

Hotel is in a great location situated between SOHO and Chinatown. The rooms are nicely designed with floor to ceiling windows and very spacious compared to most hotels in NYC. You have some of the best views of downtown from your hotel room. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. Overall excellent place to stay!!

Stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown over 4th of July. Was blown away by level of service and quality of the hotel. Had amazing views of Empire State Building along with One World Observatory. Will definitely stay there again!

Attentive staff, excellent location, spotless rooms with stunning views! Several food and beverage outlets throughput the hotel which provides a variety of options. Rooftop bar is particularly enjoyable. I highly recommend you stay here!
user_name:
LTG1986
New York City, New York

review_body: My company uses this hotel for our business guests all the time. It is an easy walk to some of the best neighborhoods and by far the best quality for the price in the area. Their rooms are quiet and the quality of the rooms is better than what you are paying out there. We also use their conference room located on the 17th floor. I would highly recommend it for meetings. There is an outdoor terrace and floor to ceiling windows with an incredible view. The price comes included with all AV set and you can use an outside caterer to save on price. The hotel even offers a local business discount. They are very easy to work with Lindsay which responds quickly and always helpful.

Never thought that staying in Chinatown would be so incredible.....rooms are amazing but the view from the rooms, incredible!!! The beer garden is a great place to meet both work colleagues and friends alike. The location is fantastic and more importantly it was so easy to get around all parts of the city while staying at this gem of hotel. Kudos to our staff...they are both kind and efficient!

Stayed at least 5 times at this hotel. Good location between down- and midtown Manhattan. Rooms have floor to ceiling windows and have decent size for NYC. Had room on 15th floor with stunning views of the city and also a balcony. Nice outside beer garden. Was able to watch the EURO on TV whilst having having a nice brew :-). Hotel has also a great roof top terrace which opens in the evening.

Having hosted various meeting around NYC. Am always on the look for hotels that accommodate my smaller groups and still treat them like VIP clients. The sales team there go out of their way to make my VIP clients feel like they are the most important people in the hotel. Diane in sales personally found gluten free cupcakes at the last moment for our meeting and arranged for umbrellas for whole groupIn a downpour. Just little things that make me going back.
user_name:
JDlovestoviajar
New York City, New York

review_body: My company uses this hotel for our business guests all the time. It is an easy walk to our Soho office and by far the best quality for the price in the area. Their rooms are quiet and have a desk so it's perfect for those coming in for meetings or needing to take calls. The quality of the rooms is better than what you are paying for. We also use their conference room located on the 17th floor. I would highly recommend it for meetings. There is an outdoor terrace and floor to ceiling windows with an incredible view. The price comes included with all AV set and you can use an outside caterer to save on price. The hotel even offers a local business discount. They are very easy to work with; Diane and Lindsay respond quickly and are always helpful. We are very glad we found this gem!

Recently, I organized a birthday party on the 17th floor event space. The coordinators, Diane and Lindsey were super helpful and a pleasure to work with! They were able to work with me on my limited budget, helped me with the food choices and ensured everything went off without a hitch.On the day of the event, Ryan (the manager of the kitchen and bar) and his staff were incredibly professional and friendly. All the guests remarked how amazing beautiful the space was and how great the event turned out.Thank you all for making it such a memorable event!

First off, you should understand and be familiar with the exact neighborhood this hotel is in. It's in Chinatown. Not necessarily a bad area, but it's not a trendy area or an area close to mainstream shopping or mainstream tourist attractions. It is a fairly close to a subway station for a NYer, but if you are a suburban person and not used to walking, it is NOT right around the corner from a subway either. Also, this is one of the busiest, most hustle bustle areas of town during daytime, so keep that in mind.It's a small hotel and the rooms are small. The windows are all glass, so depending on which aspect of the building you get a room in, you may get an excellent view.There is also excellent light in the bathroom because the walls are glass too.We didn't have a problem with noise, despite what other reviewers have written, but that might have been our luck.On the bad side, the separation between the bedroom and bathroom is glass as well and there is hardly any noise privacy. If I were to pick another negative, it is that the room is really small and the closet space is small too.We were perfectly happy with it for the price we paid which was good for NYC standards.

The hotel was pretty much as described on the website. I paid a little extra for a room with a view which was definitely worth it. The room was clean, with all amenities. A short walk from the subway (although a little confusing so be sure to get your bearings). Not many options for breakfast in the area but plenty of choice for evening meals. Only one minor gripe and that is that only paper cups are provided for the tea/coffee maker and these weren't always replaced.

My boyfriend and I stayed here to celebrate our anniversary and my 30th birthday. It was an amazing hotel, in a perfect location for our stay. We wanted to stay close to the East Village, and its only minutes away. The staff was great, the view was insane (had a balcony premium room - amazing!) and the room was clean, comfortable and just beautiful. I cannot fault this place, and recommend it!

Absolutely loved it here, really comfortable room, lovely staff, nice views and the bar is great! It was a shame we could only stay one night, but I would stay again. It's a really beautiful hotel, the bathrooms are really nice, and it's really close to loads of things, plus because it's in China town there are loads of nice places to eat near by.

First time visiting the city and this hotel was great! The staff was super nice and the rooms were modern, very clean and comfortable. The outside bar on the first floor is enjoyable as is the rooftop bar on the 18 & 19 floors with unbeatable views! Ask for a room on the 7th floor to get a balcony! Only draw back is not close to Times Square but minutes away from a subway and Little Italy.

really enjoyed our 6 days at the wyndham.nice size room and great shower.floor to ceiling windows give excellent views.even the lower floors you get to watch chinatown which is never dull.roof top bar expensive with slow service,the bar connected to the hotel is a better bet friendly and lively,there is plenty to see downtown eg liberty,9/11,brooklyn bridge so dont be put off by the location and feel you need to stay in the madness of times square because you dont.
user_name:
Matthew T
Margate, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Rip off on valet parking, very poor services by check in staff, no bottled water amenity, they charged for $3 per 8oz bottled water, total rip off.
I utilize the Wyndham Garden Chinatown on a regular basis for business purposes. I always enjoy my stay as the people who work there are very courteous and friendly.

Comfortable room, convenient location, and responsive staff made for a nice two night getaway. Not the most romantic of locations, but there are plenty of food options nearby. A good option, especially if your schedule is more downtown-centric.

This was a terrific stay, a little gem in a gritty part of lower Manhattan. I met folks for drinks at the bar downstairs/outside and it was a pleasure with tasty $5 drinks during happy hour. Never made it to the rooftop bar but I will next time! My room was cozy and the views to the north were fabulous! If you can, get a room above the 6th or so floor for the best views.

this hotel was in a very convenient place to go anywhere you wanted in new York. the room was spotless and very modern looking. bed was comfortable and the staff was helpful. woyld definitely come back

The hotel is a standard chain 3 star hotel located in the Lower East side. I'm accustomed to staying in mid-town or the Upper West side, so being at this location was sort of an adventure. The room was clean, the bathroom way TOO small and lacked a towel rack. The most surprising and disturbing thing in the bathroom was the shower, there was only half a shower door. After showering, I had to use several towels to dry the floor. The room, which is small (that's expected in NYC) could use some updating, the lamp was outdated and didn't provide adequate light for the room. And alas, the window didn't open, it's always nice to get some fresh air. The hotel is located close to the Brooklyn Bridge and several tourist attractions. I truly enjoyed being able to nearby Little Italy and eat at Ferrara Bakery, where the food and pastries were wonderful, and the waiter was truly welcoming and polite. One positive aspect of staying at this hotel was the reception staff, who were very accommodating, even when they were busy. That's certainly a plus. I ate at the hotel restaurant, mostly too avoid the unseasonably wet and cold weather, the food was adequate, but again the waiter was very friendly. I doubt I'll stay at this hotel again (a very long walk to the subway station I needed), but it was quiet, pleasant and affordable for a three night stay.
Fine hotel with excellent and friendly staff.My second stay here.Get a room facing uptown. Incredible views.

I stayed at this hotel on my visit to New York. The rooms are clean and it appears that the hotel is quite new.The staff there a friendly but not very helpful when you are new to the city and trying to understand your way around.There is a business center available that is in the main foyer to the hotel.There are 4 bars located at this hotel but at the time of my visit the Wu restaurant located on the lower ground floor and the bar on the 19th floor were closed for renovations.There is a roof top bar witch gives you a great view of New York and a great place to see the city skyline while relaxing having a mean and drink.The bar restaurant offers a variety of chooses to choose from and the staff there a helpful.The closest subway station is 1 block away (Grand Street Station) witch gives you access to the B and D lines to and from uptown.The hotel is located near China Town and adjacent to Little Italy.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May. We booked a balcony room with kingsize bed. Check in was ok, there was nothing outstanding about it. The man checking us in did mention we had the best room as we had "2 balconies with our room" We walked into our room and was pleasantly surprised with the room, however when we tried to open the door to the balcony it had been sealed off. It transpired that the door was actually broken and we couldn't actually get out onto the balcony. They did change our room and refunded us the 2 nights we spent in the room with the broken room. The hotel has an impressive and functioning gym with a cardio and resistant equipment. There are 2 bars. 1 x on the ground floor. This is a great bar with great bar staff and reasonably priced drinks. E second bar on the 18th floor is more exclusive and more expensive. Literature within the room says guests receive a discount in the bar on the higher floors however when we went the bar staff advised this was incorrect and they offered no discount. The hotel was well positioned within Chinatown and only a block away from the Metro station with direct trains to uptown Manhattan and Times Sq
Pleasant staff to talk to. Very hard working. It was a nice experience that had a lot of good tourist attraction recommendations.

Just came back to the UK from spending 5 nights at the Wyndham. Very clean and modern hotel. Our room was lovely but a bit small, nowhere to put the suitcases! Wifi worked really well even from the 11th floor! staff were friendly. Not the best location, its's very noisy and i couldn't believe how dirty the streets were it was a shock! 5 min walk to Little Italy which had nice restaurants but it's a bit of a walk to any subway station. Next time i will look to stay further uptown as although it was a lot quieter and it was cheaper, its better to pay a bit more and be closer to everything.

The hotel is in a good location in Chinatown close to the subway and in between many of the sights. Room was clean and felt new, but small. Hotel staff is very helpful and accommodating, especially Massy. He was very friendly and retrieved our luggage quickly, gave us much needed transportation advice and called us a cab!

Set in the heart of Chinatown, so be prepared for lots of traffic noise, dirty streets and sirens day and night. The hotel does not have double glazed windows so you hear everything from the street. The rooms are an ok size but there is a tiny wardrobe and nowhere to put any suitcases, so these are left on the floor next to the bed. Free wifi was included and was a pretty good speed.Found staff to be neither helpful or rude, just doing their minimum job! The hotel has a bar downstairs right on the street corner which could be loud at peak hour traffic times.The restaurant is full of fried foods, so if you have food intolerances this is not the place to stay...Close to Canal street station which is handy on getting to most places in New York, also very close to Little Italy which is good for restaurants day and night.

My husband and I stayed here for four nights last weekend, and enjoyed it tremendously. We had reserved a King Executive on floors 8-12, but were upgraded to a Queen on the 15th floor with the balcony. Not sure I would do the balcony floor again. It wasn't very private, and was more like an open-air walking track outside your room, with no furniture or place to hang out. I think you'd have more privacy, and probably more room, with a King on a high floor...since the view is basically the same. Our room was pretty small with very little drawer space, but that was okay since we spent very little time inside the room. It was quiet enough and very clean. The bathrooms were nice, the shower faucet was odd, but once we got used to it, it was fine. I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Hotel as a whole is nice and modern. Reasonably priced for Manhattan as have found there are many older dilapidated hotels that charge more. Location is ok, beside the subway for getting uptown and walking distance to all that downtown has to see. My only gripe is the staff, found them not the most helpful. We had an issue with the A/C during our stay, every time we mentioned it to the staff you may as well have been talking to a wall. It came down to me having to demand to move rooms (most hotel staff would think and maybe suggest it first).

Just stayed here for a week. We had a fairly spacious room overlooking the side street. I had read the reviews about the road noise so I was well prepared with ear plugs. The noise wasn't too bad but I still put the ear plugs in! The staff were friendly, polite and efficient. The hotel was spotlessly clean. The subway station is only a couple of streets away so it was easy to get around. We walked to Little Italy for breakfast,where there are many places to eat. It was nice to come back to this lovely hotel at night.

The team didn't give attention to the guests. Some of them were nice but two ignored us! The room was preety clean and the location is excellent. Close to soho and .many good resturants are in this area

The hotel took my card details for a 'holding charge' in case we used mini bar etc. We used nothing so did not expect to be charged. But on return home I found I'd been charged over $200! Hotel not explained nor reimbursed the charge and terrible communication. DODGY - do not stay here.

Great location, pleasant room, super clean, very comfortable. Staff were excellent, friendly, and helpful. Parking is expensive and it's not clear where to leave your car if you use their expensive valet service. But get the Spothero app and find overnight parking in the area much cheaper; I was happy with parking 1 block away; 89 Chrystie St. The room was a bit small, but very well laid out. Great view of midtown. Walking back from Soho at midnight was a bit dicey with some of the groups of strange rowdy characters on the street. I did this walk with a suit and tie on, and wouldn't have acted the role of "target" by walking alone. I wouldn't recommend walking alone in the area late at night. I was walking with my wife. By the way, it goes without saying there are many great restaurant options in Chinatown!
The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are pretty big for NYC with wonderfully huge windows and a fabulous view. I was impressed.

Clean hotel in China town with pretty small rooms but with nice views uptown. Breakfast is basically served in their bar which is dark and has no tables for more than 4. Find somewhere else for breakfast. Has a rooftop bar with nice views. Should not pay more than $275 for a room. Good location if you are spending time in the tennement district as you can walk there. SOHO is also within walking distance. Near subway.

Wow. The room we booked was not what we were given. We made the reservation for a queen bed two months prior. The room was ver small and the bed was even smaller. When I spoke with the manager he said, "that we had a queen bed" . I could not believe he said what he said.. The bed was a double. BEWARE

Decent hotel. NY standard rooms . 5 min walk to subway. It all matters down to price. I wouldn't pay anything more than 180-190 USD. Anything more midtown is ideal.Soho is close and I would say soho-broadway is a good bet for shipping and eating out . Times square is great but Soho is great as well.International power convertors should be provided. When I asked for one I was told to buy from a shop opp the hotel. The bar upstairs is slightly over rated I feel. Once the outside area opens it would make better value . Sitting inside and paying the high prices isn't worth it.

I decided to spend a full week in New York's lower Eastside doing street photography and attending the Tribeca film festival. I picked the Wyndam Garden Chinatown because of its convenient location and price of rooms. I was not at all disappointed. The hotel was immaculate physically and the staff was friendly and professional. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that owants to experience the "real New York City" and at the same time stay at a first rate modern hotel. It is only a block away the subway stop and literally steps away from entering the central part of Chinatown. Highly recommended. They also have a great outdoor bar and a happy hour on the 18th floor with fabulous lower Manhattan views.

Me and my boyfriend just got home from staying in wyndham garden in chinatown for 9 days. We had a booking with queensize and balkony and the first two nights we were put in 2th floor (the view from there is straight into a building) The room was nice, clean and fresh, but we were a bit dissapointed at the "balkony view" So we asked to get a room in a higher level, they didnt had a balkony room but we got a much needed kingsize bed instead on the 11th floor - so the rest of the stay was just amazing. Waking up and going to bed with the view of manhatten, it's beautiful!! The staff and housekeeper was really friendly and so serviced minded! We just loved it all. Just a 2 min walk from the subway and 10 min walk from brooklyn bridge.There is really no need for staying near times square, the treaasures of NY lays in between! We lived in chinatown, walked to brooklyn, dined in greenwich, did shopping and sightseeing all in walking distance. Also the subway is super easy! We loved NY and wyndham garden sure made it perfect.

We had a third floor room in this little hotel, so we didn't have the sort of view we were hoping for. But the bar on the 18th floor had a spectacular view. Pluses: it was a good size considering that most NYC rooms are quite small. There was room to walk around the bed. It was very clean. The decor was newish and there was room around the sink. The shower had pretty tile. One block from a subway station. A great little diner just a few blocks away if you don't want to pay for the hotel breakfast, which is not included. Minuses: The shower handle was stiff. There was no tub. The bar didn't serve anything in the way of hot non-alhoholic beverages. I wanted a chocolate, but they only offered me sake. Nope. Sorry.We had the opportunity to compare this with another hotel in mid-town where were moved to be near family in the latter half of our week. This was way nicer.

A gem in PRIME location. Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho, all within a few steps and the views are absolutely gorgeous! Service and staff very extremely friendly and helpful. Excellent overall experience, very clean and comfortable rooms. I highly recommend this property and will most certainly be back! Thank you for a perfect stay!
user_name:
freddyjrg
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was excellent but the shower stall was odd. Just a short lip to try and keep water from spraying all over the bathroom floor was not a fan of at all. The bar had broken table and chairs in the bottom floor. The roof top was a disappointment due to it being closed. Both bars were poorly lit and the one downstairs you are only allowed to sit at specific spots per the bartender/server/room service person. Seems very inefficient to have one person fill all 3 positions and the person there did a miserable job at all 3 of them during my stay. I gave up dining here after 1 meal.

Rooms small but very clean. Bed extremely comfortable. Our room had a window with gorgeous views looking uptown. The only downside is that the nearest subway is several blocks' walk, and taxis are hard to come by in that part of Chinatown. If you're a Uber-user, you'll be all set!

This was the hotel I got through a "name your price" website. I love Chinatown so I was fine with the location, but little did I know that my room would have a panoramic view of Manhattan, including the Empire State and Chrysler buildings. The room is quite small but extremely well-appointed, updated, and clean; the bed was incredibly comfortable; the shower had great pressure and hot water; there was even a mini-fridge in the room if I'd wanted to bring some food or drinks in. I would stay here again in half a heartbeat.

The hotel location is good. From the JFK airport, you can take the air train to connect with the subway by taking the J line to Bowery station (around 40 minutes) and take a walk around 10 minutes (3 blocks) to get to the hotel. During stay the closest station is Grand st. (B/D line) that can take you anywhere in Manhatton, also walk around 10 minutes to Canal St. (4/5/6 line). It depends on where you want to go and which line you have to take. This is very convenience. Moreover, Ms.Vanessa who is working at front desk. She greet the guests with smile and give helpful information. Aslo, I got a very serious problem with her colleague (night shift) about billing problem. She could handle very well with professional well train. She made all the issue clear, unlike the other one. The surrounding area will be closed and quiet after 9:00pm. There is no supermarket or convenience store open 24hrs or late at night. Thererfore, if you wanna buy something to drink please do it before get back to the hotel or you can buy bottle of water from the hotel. Overall if you are looking for a place to stay in Manhatton (Chinatown area) with good location. This hotel is recommended!!
Overall, no complaints, but nothing stands out about it. Low marks for rates when booking directly. Small rooms. Good bar tender, but mediocre fair.

Came down solo to see a son who attends school near NYU. Was on the second floor which had that balcony that you could drive a car on - runs the length of the hotel. Nice addition. My room was very spacious and most of all - clean, very clean. Good amenities - the wifi, fridge. Nice bathroom and I actually like the open shower glassed in (more light). Comfy bed. Modern. I am always most appreciative when you are at a hotel where the cleaning and maintenance staff are welcoming and friendly. I had an issue with the heat and the maintenance man was there immediately, and even followed up (called) a few times to be sure problem was fixed. I thought that was impressive. I was surprised how convenient to subways the hotel is. You do have to walk several blocks - but so what. The neighborhood is very lively and convenient to Soho, the Village, Little Italy, etc. Would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
JedR808
Bar Harbor, Maine, United States

review_body: My experience was excellent at your hotel, as usual. I have stayed here twice and previously stayed elsewhere in southern Manhattan. My only complaint is your $3 baggage storage fee when checking out, which I have never experienced before in NYC and neither have any of my friends I spoke to about this. Should we just not tip the maid to pay for this extraneous expense? Don't want to take this issue out on them. Thank you for asking my opinion of my stay.Other then what was stated above, I love your hotel and all of your gracious and accommodating staff. Promise I will be back and recommend you to all of my friends and family

We planned a weekend in New York, focusing on Chinatown and Little Italy. The Wyndham Garden Chinatown is perfectly located for both. Easy walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go and only 5 minutes from the Grand St subway station.The room was very good. It's New York so we went there not expecting much space, but it was a decent size. The bed was clean and comfortable. The one weird thing was the shower, which was one without a door and so every time we took a shower there would be water splashing out. The room had a fridge and free wi-fi, plus a reasonable view of the Empire State building from the 8th floor. There's a rooftop bar offering better views, good drinks and friendly service.

Great property here in Chinatown right on Bowery. Rooms were sized larger than I expected for being in the city and room was clean when we checked in. Lobby staff was great and super helpful when it came to storing our luggage for the day and details for valet parking for our car. Parking is $50 for 24 hours with no in/out just fyi. Location is great - a few blocks from Little Italy. It's a little bit of a walk to NYU, which is where our activities for the weekend were but a great walk in the city in the springtime.

We were planning a weekend trip centered around a show on a Friday night, and almost left NYC to go to another city where the hotels weren't so darn expensive. A really great deal on this hotel (offered at $160-180 a night depending on the room) kept us in the city for the weekend and we couldn't have been happier. The location is really great - right between Chinatown and Little Italy, a few blocks from the heart of Soho, and even walking distance (15 minutes or so) to Tribeca, Financial District, Greenwich Village and the Lower East Side. If you get bored staying here, its your own fault. You can also get to the Grand Street subway in about 5 minutes, and the Canal street station in about 8 minutes. Plus, if you want to take a taxi, we were pretty much able to walk out of the hotel and get one within 90 seconds at most. It is a high traffic spot, coming off the Manhattan bridge, so there are always empty cabs heading towards mid and uptown. Beyond the location, the staff is friendly, and the rooms are nice. It is a NYC hotel room, so don't expect anything spacious. If you can, get a higher floor room - there is a good reason why there is a rooftop bar there, as the height of the hotel in this part of town gives it an amazing view up towards mid town - a clear shot to the Empire State building - and on the front side towards the Freedom Tower. No major complaints about the room or hotel - good outlet accessibility, good HVAC, good bed and pillows, clean well appointments rooms. If I had to pick any complaints, I would say it would be that the hot water took a long time to get going in the morning (at least on the floor we were on), and that the shower is one of those that doesn't have a door that closes - must be something about this part of NYC, as I've stayed at others in the area with the same design. After three days I couldn't figure out how to take a shower without getting water splashing out of the shower. Truly a hidden gem in the area and great for anyone looking for a fun weekend in the city.

I came to NYC for what I thought would be a brief business trip, but the stay expanded (and shows no signs of ending). Life had been a bit depressing in my first hotel (it will remain nameless), but it has definitely gotten better here. Though I still spend most of my time hunched over my laptops working, my days are brightened by the incredibly kind housekeeper on my floor, Kumaire. Even when I'm my most manic work mode, she kindly cleans around me, and makes sure I have everything I need. The room was spotless when I got here, and somehow it seems even cleaner by the day. I guess beyond Kumaire, I should add that the room is decently sized -- especially for NYC -- and the downtown location is cool. Though it says the Wyndham Garden Chinatown, Little Italy is basically a block away.
user_name:
Jim M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great hotel for a business or shopping trip. Central location in Chinatown but quiet. Staff is very nice and makes your stay very enjoyable. Rooms have decent size for New York Ciry where you can always be happy when you are able walking around the bed or can store your luggage. Roof top Bar has amazing view.

We stayed in the Wyndham Gardens hotel in Chinatown for 4 nights. This hotel is in a fairly good location if you want to stay downtown. The World Trade centre is nearby. There are plenty of restaurants and a few diners nearby to eat in. There are not as many bars nearby, so it depends what you’re looking for. There is no bar in the hotel. There was no restaurant in the hotel at that time. There was a mix up with our room when we arrived – our booking had not recorded that we’d paid for an upper floor room, so we had to spend 2 nights on a lower floor before they could move us to the upper floor we had actually booked. We got a very small refund on our room rate for those two nights, but no compensation, and no real apology. The rest of our stay went smoothly. The rooms were clean, and the lifts were a good size. The view from our upper floor room once we got it was fantastic. They did store our luggage for us on the last day before we went to the airport. They called a taxi for us but the service was really poor, they tried to charge us per item of luggage rather than on the type of vehicle we hired – our luggage comfortably fit into a normal sedan with room to spare. I think you could manage to hail a cab yourself instead.
user_name:
TravelLass82
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Floor to ceiling windows are the key to making small rooms feel spacious. One tip is that if you book through Travelzoo, as we did, the highest floor you can get is the 6th floor, which sort of crimps the view. I suggest comparing the Travelzoo rate with booking directly through the hotel and taking your chances on getting a high floor.. But in any case, we enjoyed our room, which was comfortable and nicely designed. We also loved being in the heart of Chinatown; one of us really loves the Chinese bakeries.....;). But in general it is a good location. Be sure to go to the bar on the top floor for the most spectacular view. Nice place for a nightcap.
user_name:
Davida W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hotel staff were courteous and helpful. Room was quiet and clean. Location proximity to LaGuardia, East Village was very beneficial. Breakfast menu choices and quality poor. No cereal or yogurt. Need a better restaurant in general.

It couldn't have been a better stay. ALL of the front desk associates were AWESOME, especially Massy. Very very helpful, which was greatly appreciated. I would highly recommend this hotel if your staying in Chinatown.

The Wyndham is located on the Bowery in the heart of Chinatown, two blocks from (very) Little Italy, and a 15-minute walk from many interesting sites in the Lower East Side. The room we are in is small but very comfortable with a modern bathroom (not a great shower but okay). The staff is most friendly and accommodating.Don't miss the roof top lounge! Fantastic view of New York at night!
Overall satisfied with my accommodations. Was not satisfied with restaurant /bar. Staff was friendly Didn't like food beverage or even water.
user_name:
Sharon R B
Buffalo, New York

review_body: For the price and location, this hotel cannot be beat. The hotel is in the heart of Chinatown and within walking distance of downtown, Tribeca and Soho. My room had a beautiful view of the city. Additionally, the room and hotel had all of the features that any business or leisure traveler may need. Overall, an excellent property in the Wyndham family.

Just awesome hotel in Chinatown. Walking distance to subway. Very close to East river and Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges.Beautiful view from room, ask for top floors, when book a room)Regular breakfast, just eat and go.

Great cheap and clean hotel with nice service but had no food when I was there in January. Excellent views of the city looking uptown and had a small refrigerator. The rooms are small but well equipped.
Very professionally managed yet friendly. The staff made the stay easy, the neighborhood is a delight.
user_name:
Stephen W
Ocean City, New Jersey

review_body: We stayed at this hotel in July 2015 and we was not disappointed.The hotel would appear fairly new and although the rooms aren't the largest they are perfectly sufficient. We choose the rooms with the balcony and although we were disappointed to find out the balcony was shared with others it still enabled us to get out the room when needed.The area around the hotel is china town and what was apparent is that this was a little dirtier compared to other new York areas so be prepared for this when staying here.What some people might not realise is the hotel has a sky bar on the top floor and albeit a little expensive it is worth a visit.All in all we had a good visit and wasn't disappointed for what we paid (we got the deal through travelzoo)
Helpful staff, clean, comfortable , not noisy.Have room service and it was good.Free internet!

Staff was so friendly and laid back, they allowed me and my girlfriend to check in a few hours earlier, no issues whatsoever. Told us where we can get food, where to stop for drinks and where we can buy cool crystal jewelry
user_name:
Mchung11
New York City, New York

review_body: A really nice hotel, location is not great but the hotel is clean, homely, welcoming and easy to stay at.Rooms are small, bed even smaller but room is clean and well presented. The staff are excellent, the check in is easy and the overall customer facilitation is top class.The area is not nice, in fact it is quite an urban concentration that has not had any development in the area bar the new hotel.

The hotel grounds are very nice and clean. Rooms are small but nicely done. Rooftop bar is great , the staff are exceptional. Everyone on staff that I encountered were helpful and friendly which goes a long way in my book . Highly recommend this hotel

Hotel was very clean and staff was friendly and helpful. Nothing bad to say about this hotel. Would definitely stay there again. In the heart of Chinatown and three blocks from Little Italy. Plenty of great places to eat are nearby.

When we arrived, our allocated room was on the 5th floor. We did ask if there was anything available much higher up but unfortunately there was nothing. The front desk was very apologetic and at least put us on the 7th floor so we had a better view than our original room allocation. We did have a shared balcony and faced north so we were able to see the Empire State building and the Chrysler building. The room was clean, decent size, quiet and the bed comfortable.What more do you need?Got woken up by the ice machine filling up at 5am but apart from that no complaints.Handy for restaurants and 9/11 memorial.
Easy check in and out. Very clean, organized quiet hotel. Stayed with my boyfriend on our 1 year anniversary and we loved it. We will be coming back and staying at this hotel.

Enjoyed staying here, the hotel is in a good area near the Grand Street (B, D train) and Bowery (J, Z train) NY Subway stops. Excellent food options nearby. The bar on the 18th floor is great, Sabrina is the best bartender!

The hotel is clean, well maintained and in a great location. The area is an ethnic heaven with both Chinatown and Little Italy at your doorstep. Katz's Deli is just a short walk away. It is convenient to get to by two different subway lines with connections to other boroughs and to Midtown Manhattan. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay and the views from the lounge at the top were spectacular. Noise in the area is typical of a city that never sleeps but the rooms block most of the noise. The floor to ceiling windows allow for great views from the rooms. The rooms were roomy for a NY City hotel room but small by comparison to a suburban motel. The rooms had a safe and a refrigerator which came in handy for leftovers. Will definitely stay here again.

I have been coming to this specific Wyndham for 3 years now. I can afford any Hotel in Manhattan but I choose to stay here because it's quiet, clean, and gives you a 5 star feel all around. I stay here when I travel for business and the staff is so friendly and accommodating. This time around I noticed they added an outdoor bar, but due to the inclement weather, it was not open. It may be nice to stay in midtown or even near Central Park but this Hotel has all sorts of delicious restaurants and bars in the area. I would highly recommend the Wyndham Garden Chinatown to anyone looking for a modern, decedent, clean, quiet Hotel experience.

We got a great rate at this hotel and decided to stay here when we were in the city for one night. The hotel is in a great area in Chinatown New York City. It is very close to Little Italy and Soho. We felt very safe here, the hotel was very clean and the room was a nice size. Our view was of the trade center and the Empire State building. It was not noisy at all. The bed was super comfortable, and the room was a nice size. The front desk staff was helpful. We were a little disappointed in the bathroom, although it is a nice size and we got plenty of towels, the shower was more like a European shower. There was half a door, and no water pressure. Plus the water was not that hot. In spite of that I would return for one night, but if I were to stay longer I would request another bathroom.

room temp control didn't work - 75 degrees all night long. False fire alarm and 4 loudspeaker messages from 12:30 to 1:30 in the morning. Front desk poorly attended. No apology for the fire alarm from staff at check-out, only laughter. Won't stay here again.

5 stars all around for this 5 star Resort. From the front desk, to the bellboy, and Bar. Absolutely Amazing service. I live in Long Island and come the Manhattan often to go to Live Shows and usually stay the night. I always try to Stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown everytime if it is already completely booked which happens often.....Because it's such a wonderful Hotel. Again out of all the Wyndham Hotels Wyndham Garden Chinatown is my Favorite.

Booked this through booking.com. Very pleasant and helpful staff. While the location is china town and not really an upmarket area but that was hardly a concern. The hotel is near subway station and bang on Bowery Street. The hotel has great views of the Manhattan especially from top floors. The rooms are small though but they are super functional the housekeeping staff gave me everything that I needed - shaving foam deo stick (wow). The linens were awesome the bath area is quite large and the bed is just perfect for a great sleep. The reception guys were very helpful with directions and had a great knowledge of restaurants at the neighborhood. In fact one of the guys at the reception pushed me to take the subway and ever since whenever in New York I hardly take a cab. This is the hotel I would like to come back and stay when in New York. Kudos to the staff and management for this great experience.

We stayed here because we left it too late to find a reasonably priced, clean, hotel near Times Square. There is nothing that we can fault about this hotel except the distance from Times Square and it being a few blocks away from a tube station, which generally didn't bother us but at the end of the day when you begin to feel tired, it can feel a bit of a trek to get back. Otherwise, this was a perfect place. Quite, clean, reasonably room and pleasant, helpful staff. It feels very modern and the room was very stylish and immaculate. Probably the best room we have ever stayed in, in New York. I loved the area: Chinatown which felt very safe at night. Furnishings were really nice and modern. We stayed here in September 2014.

Yes, the rooms really have views like in the photos! We stayed for two nights during the Lunar New Year parade weekend. We were surprised that the cost was reasonable during such a busy time, we were convinced there must be something wrong with the place, but it was great!We had a corner room on the 8th floor and loved the views to the north and west. We could hear traffic on Bowery but it wasn't super loud and I always bring ear plugs with me when I travel anyway. The room was a little chilly, owing to the floor-to-ceiling windows (store bags and clothes away from the windows so you don't put on icy jeans!). The view was worth the chill. The thermostat was adjustable, and I like it at 65 F...I'm sure anyone could adjust it higher to counter the chill from the windows though.I really liked this hotel room and I definitely will be back, but I'm giving it a 4 rating instead of a 5 because the bathroom really irked me. I think the designers sacrificed functionality for form. It LOOKS beautiful but there were no towel racks! There is a very small hook behind the door, but nowhere else to hang a towel. Also, the shower has a glass half-partition, but this one felt shorter than half. As much as I tried to aim the shower head the opposite direction and close to the wall, water got everywhere. The toilet paper rolls hang right there, and they got soaked each time we showered. The floor is ICY in that bathroom - bring slippers or thick socks!!! But it did LOOK nice. It just wasn't as functional as I would have liked. It won't preclude another stay, but I felt it was pertinent to add this info so other people are aware and prepared.Overall, this was a great stay. I'd love to return!

The room, furnishings, amenities and view were all excellent. The hotel is located 1 short block from the Manhattan Bridge (to Brooklyn) ramps, there is heavy traffic most hours, and access to this hotel is very challenging. There is no portico, driveway, or curbside unloading zone, and no signage for arriving guests. If you're driving your own car, skip the expensive valet parking, use the garage at 89 Chrystie St. (cash-only).
Amazing. They upgraded to a suite and gave extra blankets and a rollout bed and couch! I'll be there again soon

I stayed here for one night! I picked this place because of the great reviews & location. It is in the heart of china town. Lots of restaurants & shops nearby. Only a 5 minute walk from the train. The hotel looks very new. The staff at the front desk was very friendly & professional. There is a computer in the lobby where you can use the Internet/print. There is also a bar in the lobby, a restaurant on the bottom floor & a lounge/bar on the roof top!Our room was very nice! Extremely clean, comfortable bed, & a great view of the street! Nice flat screen tv & there is a fridge in the room!We invited a couple friends to the hotel & we chilled up on the roof top..bar/lounge area...omg, it was amazing!!! The views from the roof top is one of the best in New York. We had so much fun there. The vibe was very laid back & they played good music. It isn't a club by any means but they had several tables & comfortable seating.We also ate at the restaurant on site, it was average price but it wasn't that good. I had chicken wings, which were bland & my friends had a cheese steak & chicken tenders which they also thought was bland. The customer service was good but the food was blah. My only complaint about this hotel was the noise! You can hear cars honking throughout the night. I am a deep sleeper, so it didn't bother me much but if you are a light sleeper, don't stay here.Highly recommend this place!

This was our first visit to NYC. This hotel is fantastic. We were on the 9th floor and had an amazing view. Empire state building out of one windows and the freedom tower out the other. Comfy beds, free wifi very clean and quiet. Couldn't ask for anymore

This is a beautiful hotel, perfectly situated if you're exploring the lower east side on foot. We loved the decor, the service, and the rooms. Everything was perfectly clean, just the right size, with a gorgeous view! We will most certainly be back.

The rooms are very clean, adequately sized, everything worked and it was very quiet. The decor was nice, the staff was great! I had no problems whatsoever during my stay, and the best part was it was a convenient walk to my class I was taking that week. It is very close to SoHo and NoHo, and great restaurants! And just two blocks away from the subway station too! No complaints! Loved it!

hotel is in a great location.right in chinatown and two blocks from little italy and two blocks from the subway station.rooms were great and staff was wonderful.many great restaurants within walking distance.we liked cherche midi which is at Bowery and Houston streets.

I needed a room for 1 night and the Wyndam was located in exactly the spot I needed, very reasonable rates, wonderful view of the Empire State Building and the cleanest hotel room I've been in, hands down. The staff was very friendly and attentive, efficient and helpful when needing suggestions for dining, etc. Highly recommended.

I loved that this place was pet friendly and the free wifi! My kids loved the big beds and free breakfast! It is truly a great family hotel. The breakfast buffet had eggs, bacon, toast, donuts, pancakes, and sausage! My big, round belly was stuffed after eating that but it was worth it
Hotel was very comfortable and clean. Friendly staff, easy access to transportation and food. Would definitely stay at this hotel in the future
Nice hotel, subway near by which is very convenient. Rooms are small but clean, staff were very helpful.

After alot of thinking, I finally took the plunge to stay in a different area of Manhattan and didn't regret it in the slightest. This hotel is fantastic. I booked a room which I knew would have a view and on entering the room I was overwhelmed! Took me about 20 minutes to move away! Room was immaculate, bed so comfy, great TV, all amenities and a fridge. Staff were fabulous, always pleasant, welcoming you back each time. The rooftop bar is just as good as your more expensive ones so why bother with them! Couldn't fault this hotel at all. Location is excellent with a subway two blocks away. Plenty restaurants and grocers roundabout. I will definitely be returning to this hotel. Thank you all, keep up the fantastic work.

Our flight arrived at Newark early in the morning, by the time we took the Newark Express bus to Grand Central, and then the Subway to the Canal Street station, we ended up arriving at the hotel at 10:30AM. We were sure that we would have to store our luggage until our room was ready, but much to our surprise, our room was available for check in at 10:30. Bonus points there! The room itself was without much of a view being on the 4th floor, but that's fine, since got quite a good price and we were there only to sleep and shower. The bed was heavenly, bathroom very nicely designed with a boutique hotel style to it, nice flatscreen, free high speed wifi, and a convenient mini fridge. The lobby is super clean and always staffed with a friendly smiling face at the front desk. There is a bar/restaurant on the main level, and a rooftop bar, both of which we did not use, but we checked them out and the view from the rooftop was definitely a nice one looking uptown towards the Empire State. The entire building is new, I would guess under 3 years old, so everything is new and fresh and contemporary which is always a treat. I actually prefer being in such a cheaper location than somewhere around Times Square where you pay double. Don't see the point of that. Which brings me to the next point.Location of the hotel is very convenient, with loads of Chinatown restaurants starting across the street, so much choice, its a foodies dream here! Little Italy is 2 blocks away, and Grand Street Subway station is a 3 minute walk away - 3 stops and you're at Rockefeller station. Canal Street station is under 10 minutes by foot. We always felt safe, even later at night after midnight. We would definitely consider staying here in the future and will recommend this place to our friends and family looking for an affordable 4star option in Manhattan.

Absolutely cannot fault this hotel, from the room to the staff it was amazing. It's in the perfect location for eating out and exploring Chinatown & Little Italy and only a minutes walk from Grand Street Station.Our room was beautiful with everything we needed, great shower, comfortable bed and the most stunning views.The staff were friendly and helpful in every way.We will definitely be booking again, hopefully in the summer.Thank you to everyone at Wyndham Garden for making our first trip to New York so special.

I stayed here in July 2014, very new hotel believe it just opened. It's located on a busy junction but room was quiet. Smack in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Chinatown, which I understand some people may not like. But I'm okay with 'liveliness' as I'm Singaporean Chinese and enjoyed the convenience of buying fruits from downstairs to enjoy back in the hotel. Good sized room for Manhattan standards and easy access to 2 subway stations nearby. And of course this being New York, enjoy walking around and getting lost.

This hotel is nice, modern and an excellent choice for families, business, and travellers. The staff is friendly and it's close to one of the canal street subway stations, and actually a bit of a walk from the Broadway station. If you take a right on hester (from the front door), and another right after a block, there's a great diner/breakfast joint called the cup and saucer. Little Italy is just around the corner, as well. A new bar/loung/chill spot is opening up on the ground floor and I met the GM, Laura. She was a real sweet heart and this place comes recommended, as well. Back to to the room: cozy, big tv, comfy comfy bed, desk, reading lights and fast wifi. The bathroom was really cool too, had an art deco feel to it. Ok, check it out!!

Enjoyed the stay like before. The staff was excellent. The only complaint I have about the hotel is the cleaning service. When we got to our room I noticed the toilet seat was dirty. I found a pee stain or some kind of stain on there which tells me that the cleaning person probably didn't change the bed sheets or vacuum the room. I did inform the cleaning person in the morning about the stain and to sanitize the restroom but during our whole stay I kept thinking about how dirty the room was when we got there. The who,e time I thought the room was never clean.

The hotel is convenient to subways and an easy walk to many Asian restaurants and what's left of Little Italy. The bed was comfortable and the room was fine. Don't tell anybody about this excellent and affordable hotel.

I had booked this property through Hotwire and arrived at 10 AM (5 hours before check-in) and the friendly front desk staff was able to accommodate me with a nice room. The rooms were clean and we had a great view of the Empire state building. Would stay here again. Free-wifi in the room is also a big plus, but unfortunately the rooftop was rented out for a party.
user_name:
Jeffrey C
New York City, New York

review_body: Good hotel, well located for travel to all parts of Manhattan. Friendly staff and comfortable room. Restaurant was being renovated so food failities were limitedRecommended for business and vacation
We were looking for something nice yet affordable. The Wyndham in Chinatown was within walking distance to so much to see and great food.

Conveniently located by local transportation. The views from the hotel balcony and the bedroom (floor to ceiling) windows are stunning! The surreal views were just a reminder of where I was, incase I had forgotten in the comfort and class of my upgraded hotel room.(15th floor) The accommodations made available to me ensures my inevitable return.

After checking in with a confirmation with Wnydham, checked out 3 days early because of strong odor in room. Was overcharged on first night by $ 19.00 and 2nd night by $44.00.. The desk clerk said the manager would phone me to explain the charges---never received the call. Terrible customer service

The hotel was very good and the staff were really nice and helped if you needed anything. The only bad thing was that the hotel is in Chinatown which I didn't like at all. There are several metro stations near the hotel so it is very easy to explore the city from the hotel.

Despite losing our reservation for the 16th floor, hotel found us something suitable on 8th floor at reduced rate. Accommodation was excellent. Hotel is either new or newly renovated to a very high standard. View of city skyline was wonderful. Floor to ceiling window was great.

If you're lucky enough to be allocated a room on the 8th floor or above facing uptown, you will be amply rewarded. This modern hotel has floor to ceiling plate glass windows affording spectacular of Manhattan views by both day and night. Don't expect luxury, terrific food – or even a bar or rooftop restaurant that opens! But for Manhattan, this is great value accommodation for quick access to Greenwich Village… and if you're feeling fit, it only takes about an hour to walk to Central Park. Bowery station is about 5 minutes' walk which links you easily to the subway network. The tall glass structure of the Wyndham contrasts sharply with the rest of Chinatown and is easy to spot from any direction. The prices for a double room seem to fluctuate wildly, from about £160 a night to about £190 a night depending on how your booking was made… this needs further examination on my part… but overall I was impressed. I'll be back.

We chose Superior Queen Room, it was very big and comfortable. Also, very clean an bright. We had a corner view of the Empire State Building, a nice bonus!Hotel itself was very quiet - we never heard our neighbours. Unfortunately, Bowery street is very busy and noisy throughout the night, it was a big nuisance, my partner got used to it after the 3rd night but I continued to use earplugs.Location was amazing - 3 minutes from the tube station, with a little park behind and the wonders of the China Town district.Strongest points - location, clean and spacious room.Weakest - noise from the street. We didn't eat at the hotel, however, we wanted to get a breakfast just on the first day but the staff at the bar was indifferent and made us feel as if we bothered him, so we quickly cancelled and ordered just coffee and juice instead. But I must stress that the rest of the staff seemed engaged and was very courteous.

My business partner and I have stayed here several times over the years. This small and modern hotel has remained rock solid in every way. Staff are pleasant and helpful, rooms are bright and clean, location is perfect for a great meal in either Chinatown or little Italy and the price is reasonable. See you again soon.

Got there and tried to check in early. Not possible, but the host would let me know as soon as a room opened up. Appreciate the thought, though he forgot about me and 2 hours later I went back to the desk and was able to get in an hour early. Room was small, as most are in NYC; but clean. Two disappointments - the restaurant was going through a remodel and there were lower rates on line that the front desk would not match. Doubt I will stay in a Wyndham Garden property again.

I stay at this hotel 4 times a year for business. It is near many great restaurants in Chinatown and Little Italy and convenient to subway station. The staff is courteous and friendly. The rooms are clean and safe. I left a pair of pants and top in the closet drawer and the staff could not have been more helpful in getting the clothing sent to my home. I checked out on Thursday and realized on Sunday that I had left a brand new out fit in my room. I called the hotel and they referred me to housekeeping. I was told I would hear from someone in 24 hours. I received a call back from a supervisor 1 hr. later and she had my clothing. She requested I send an email with my mailing address, etc. The next day a hotel manager called to let me know that my clothing would be sent out that day! I gave him my credit card info for shipping and my package arrived 2 days later. I called again to thank the staff for such prompt and courteous service. I have travelled extensively for business and stayed at many different hotels-four seasons, ritz Carlton as well as Marriott and several boutique hotels. The service at this hotel ranks among the best!
user_name:
Chloe152015
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband and I stayed two nights this past week and we found it to be a good value for Manhatten. It's not the lap of luxury and it's in Chinatown, but that's why it's reasonably priced. We like character and Chinatown definitely has it. The hotel is one block from the Grand Orange subway stop, so you can get almost anywhere in Manhatten within 30 minutes. It's about 3 blocks from Little Italy and maybe 9 to Soho.All the beds are doubles and the rooms are almost as small as in Paris, but I've heard that's common in Manhatten. My husband and I usually sleep on a king and we don't sleep well, but we had no problems sleeping. The bed was firm but comfortable. No sign of bedbugs. Very nice pillows and they promptly brought us extras when we requested them. We also requested a portable room fan for white noise for sleeping and they promptly provided that. We were on the 5th floor and near the elevator and if we hadn't had the fan, we would probably have heard some street and elevator noise. The street was fairly quiet at night and the hotel is so small there's not allot of people in the halls to create noise though. The staff was very courteous. Our only issue is that the shower door is like they have in Europe, only covering half the needed area so that tons of water spews out on the bathroom floor. I don't understand why anyplace would want that, since it's got to decrease the life of the bathroom flooring. Make sure you have plenty of towels to sop it up. The top floor restaurant is currently closed for remodeling. If the price stays reasonable we would definitely stay here again.

Fabulous view, well kept modern facility. Restaurant was not open during our stay (but we didn't care). Love the neighborhood (Chinatown, close to Little Italy, Nolita, Lower East Side; obviously YMMV). Very convenient subway access: Grand two blocks away, Bowery and Canal a bit farther. Very happy with our second visit, looking forward to returning.

the purpose of my trip involved tasks to be accomplished in chinatown. so the location of this hotel is ideal for me. i am satisfied with the level of service provided and the cleanliness of the guest room. but clearly this is no ritz carlton. so 4 stars is the max rating i would assign to this hotel.

Close to a lot of nice areas but located on a rather ugly street. Rooms are rather nice and clean. Breakfast is awful and limited. Service is uneven some things are good and some are not as good. It' s not a bad choice but you can find better hotels within The same pricerange

The hotel itself was okay. Not great, but definitely serviceable. Everything looked new and clean, as far as I could tell. Everything was very small but I assume that is standard in NYC (this was my first trip there). The price was pretty reasonable compared to other NYC prices, but still kind of high for what you get. It was pretty close to a train station, so it wasn't too hard to get around. The area itself was pretty dead though, there were no bars, stores, pharmacies, etc other than the small grocery stores that comprise Chinatown and those all shut down pretty early. The restaurants were not very clean looking, so I did not partake in any of them. You'd have to walk at least 20 or so minutes to get to anything good. The hotel bar and restaurants were closed, with just a printed notice in the rooms telling you it was closed for menu changes, which seems weird for a supposedly new location. It was just really inconvenient since there wasn't much else around to go to, it would have been nice to have a place to eat quickly. I overheard the hotel staff being very short and kind of rude to a customer who was inquiring about this. I guess they're tired of answering questions about it, but there's no need to be rude. It's your job. As far as the room goes, the bed was comfortable. There was very little storage for clothes, just a very small armoire, no dresser or anything. The view from our room wasn't terrible if you turned your head and looked down the street.The bath room is my biggest complaint, but I think we were in a handicapped room so that could explain some of it. There was absolutely no place to put your toiletries. There was a pedestal sink with no room for anything. No counter space, no shelf above the sink, nothing. There is a very small shelf next to the shower, that's really the towel rack, so we put a couple things there, but most things had to cram into the very small clothes armoire and be carried in and out (I felt like it was a dorm bathroom!).
