I stayed at Room 608 and it looked nice. But at the night the traffic sound outside was so loud and I couldn't sleep. The shower design was open and thus I felt cold while I did the shower. My experience was very poor.

Your current website quotes an average cost of $130 per night. If this were true, I'd stay there more often, since I plan to be in NYC's Chinatown about 4x per year. My actual average cost turned out to be more than $190 per nite. When I said something about it as I paid my bill, I was informed I had to stay there in February to get that rate. It's misleading.

We stayed in 1505 a queen terrace room. The good news first. The room was well equipped with coffee maker and refrigerator. The bed was great - very comfortable and TV worked. The view is amazing and the bathroom is a decent size and very clean. Water pressure was okay but not super strong.Service was excellent and housekeeping great too.No complaints over staff what so ever - all friendly and helpful :) Wifi worked great too. The terrace room does feature a large shared balcony with 5-6 other rooms so it is not very private - a few flowerpots to divide the space and a couple of chairs would have been a great improvement. The view is fabulous though. The room is extremely small for two people. Only room for one suitcase and does look a lot smaller than the rooms shown on website but it might only be this room? There is an ice-maker right outside this room which is quite noisy at night so if you are a light sleeper avoid it. The room was very cold even though I turned the heat up but it was unusually cold in the end of April. I paid an average of 220 US per night which is probably too much for what you get. Had I paid 180 US I would have been happy.(no breakfast included).Location: It is a few blocks to the subway on Bowery street but that is only brown and orange line which does not take you uptown. For uptown you need to walk over to Canal street which takes about 10 min. Restaurant and shopping starts in little Italy and Chinatown a few blocks away so not a bad location. It is easy access from the airport -20-30 min at nighttime at roughly 60 US incl. tips. If I could get it a bit cheaper I would stay again.

nice hotel. got a hotwire deal, about 300- a night. right in chinatown, walking distance to grand st. subway, little italy, lower east side, soho, etc. quiet, nice bathroom, okay amenities, but you get a fridge, which is always handy. the only problems i had were 1) terrible TV channel selection; about 10 sports channels, yuck; 2) only one little hook on the bathroom wall (weird!) so nowhere to hang towels; and 3) i wasn't crazy about the location right in chinatown--my opinion only. while it's walkable to lots of places there aren't a lot of useful amenities nearby, e.g. a drugstore, coffee shop, places to eat, bodegas.
user_name:
lee p
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Staff were tops, rooms were clean, subway was close. I really couldn't ask for more. Will be back in future

Hotel was conveniently located in the heart of China Town and a short walk to what's left of Little Italy. Excellent location and close to subway. Checked in an hour early with no problem. Room was small but clean. Shower set up a little unusual and needed towels on floor to keep dry. View on 7th floor was outstanding!!

Came for a quick visit to NYC and chose to stay here because of proximity to J line to Brooklyn. Upon check in, Vanessa was so sweet and gave us a room on the 12th floor with spectacular evening views of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings. We took advantage of our location and had dim sum for lunch in Chinatown and dinner al frescoin Little Italy, all an easy walk from the hotel. Our room was well laid out, clean and comfortable. Will definitely be back!

Yes, you are a few blocks from SoHo, but you are in Chinatown. So don't count on finding an espresso around the corner. And don't expect a complementary cup of coffee from the hotel in the morning. Instead they'll charge you 3.50 for a regular. Stayed at a regular room which was quite claustrophobic with a tiny closet not tall enough to hang pants. Then switched to a 15 floor room with a shared balcony, which was beautiful and with amazing view of Manhattan. Fitness facility is small and limited. Overall not a bad hotel but I would wait until the neighborhood develops a little more before coming back.

The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The room is a bit small yet for one, more than enough. Wireless worked flawlessly even when streaming Netflix, which is a bit of a rarity! Cold AC made the sleeping nice, it was relatively quiet, as did the dark curtains. Get the breakfast included rate as after all, you are in NYC and hotel and other brekkies can be pricey. Sushi restaurant on site if the weather turns bad. Easy check in, no hassles.

We loved this hotel. Excellent location with excellent access to China Town, Little Italy and Nolita. Rooms are a decent size (by New York standards) and nicely decorated. Comfortable bed, good shower pressure and all very very clean. Friendly staff. Gym is basic but did the job. The only issue we had was the fact that we were next door to a pet friendly room with a dog that liked to yap through the night (very annoying.. Lucky we were tired from exploring the city during the day and slept quite heavy!)

Stayed here a night for my 17 year olds Bday weekend. Her and I liked the room very much. Cool view, clean and tidy. Housekeeping respected the do not disturb sign! Just a few minutes from Times Square, etc.

A brand new hotel, modern and up to today's standard. Room was good, fairly spacious and bathroom small but comfortable and stylish. WiFi worked well and was included. Room came with balcony, but BEWARE. The balcony is a shared balcony with all the other rooms on that floor on street side. This does not feel safe and takes away the sense of privacy. We did not find this comfortable, but the hotel could not offer an alternative. We booked including breakfast, this was continental and basically means coffee, juice, fruit and either a pastry basket (mini-croissant, mini-muffin and mini-danish) or oatmeal (not both). No savoury toppings, just a mini-jar of jam. You can choose a warm option (e.g. eggs with bacon & toast) by paying extra, but be prepared to pay USD 5 per person extra, not the USD 2 difference on the menu. We got into a whole discussion with the breakfast room staff due to them adding tax and service charges etc. Not worth the uncomfortable discussion and avoidable if they were more clear on the actual extra costs on forehand. Knowing what we do now, we would not book breakfast and grab something elsewhere, as the USD 10 for the continental is NOT worth the money. The breakfast room is in a restaurant offering sushi for lunch and dinner, with fair prices. We didn't try it, but it appeared good. Atmosphere at breakfast was not great, staff was not unfriendly, but lacked any enthusiasm or smile. You can go up to the roof of the hotel for a great view of NYC. Location-wise, it is good for exploring south manhattan, and about 5-8 min. from the nearest subway. We did a lot on foot. I was not that comfortable with the neighbourhood (especially Canal Street towards night time did not feel nice) and both Chinatown and Little Italy were disappointing, so not worth being in the middle of. Lacked nice restaurants or coffee bars in the street. But that is personal preference. We were on the 2nd floor and I had to sleep with ear plugs in, but my boyfriend did not, so depends on being a light sleeper or not. Overall, it is a very comfortable and clean hotel, but in our view rather pricey for a 3-star. Our special thanks go out to the maids: we have NEVER met such cheerful, friendly and pleasant cleaning staff anywhere else (and we travel a LOT). They were so kind and helpful, plus did a great job cleaning, that they set a great example for how service and a great consumer-experience should be. Hats off to you!

Nice affordable Manhattan hotel, but the shower has got serious problems. No door on the shower and the glass wall is way too narrow to stop the water from entering the bathroom floor. You get a severe flood every time.
A great location for my business trip. Great value for the money, and staff were very helpful. Room size not bad for NYC, especially with the floor to ceiling windows.

This was my fifth time in Manhattan but my first time on a budget as previously I've mostly gone for work or been with friends so have been able to split the cost with them. When you're going alone Manhattan is undeniably very expensive. Admittedly I got a great deal on this hotel through booking.com so wouldn't have been able to afford it otherwise but if I compare it to somewhere like the Cosmopolitan hotel in Tribeca which is about the same price normally if not more, this hotel is better in every way and totally worth it. The hotel room size was much larger than other hotels I was looking at with the same star rating, the staff were very friendly, my room always clean and coffee etc replaced every day. These may seem like things that you would assume all hotels did but I have stayed in a lot of hotels over the last few months with higher ratings and have come to learn there are many things you can't assume! I asked for a quieter room, which they fulfilled, my neighbours were pretty noisy in the morning but I can't blame the hotel for that! I also spilled something in my room and they sent a cleaner up right away to deal with it. I don't have a bad thing to say about the hotel. I can't comment much on the restaurant, I had breakfast there one morning which was OK but have a feeling the lunch and dinner menu may be better, it has very good reviews on google. Although bang in the middle of Chinatown, the location was great too 5-10 minutes walk to shops and two minutes to the closest subway (Grand St) and close to areas like Tribeca and West Village too.Nice powerful shower too, would definitely stay here again.
Small but very clean and well laid out rooms. My only gripe is that there are too few public restrooms, otherwise was a wonderful stay!
user_name:
Jennifer B K
Purchase, New York

review_body: I had rented an apartment a few doors down using AirB&B and loved the location. Smack bang in the heart of China town, little Italy and walking distance to SOHO. The apartment wasn't double glazed so the noise was more than I could handle. Checked in to this property and I couldn't believe how quiet it was. Clean, friendly staff and really all I ever needed. I couldn't fault it in any way. The price was considerably cheaper than other hotels close by. Would highly recommend.
user_name:
Milo O
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was a lovely surprise. A short two blocks walk to metro and Little Italy. Excellent customer service. Would have been helpful to have a room service menu actually in the room. The lounge apparently is a popular Friday night spot was too crowded and too loud for me at 8pm.
user_name:
Robin G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown hotel in March 2015. The hotel is located 2 blocks from a subway station (Grand St, B & D trains).We found this hotel to be priced well, compared to many other hotels in Manhattan. Yes, the rooms are smaller than a typical hotel room, but it's New York City. But with two of us in the room, we found it to be sufficient. The decor, both in the lobby and in the room itself, was stylish and modern. The room was clean and well-stocked with amenities (bottles of water, toiletries, etc), and the bed and pillows were comfy. Wifi worked very well for us, and we didn't experience much street noise (though we did have a loud, noisy neighbor one night). The front desk staff was particularly friendly, helpful and efficient.There were, however, some minor flaws we experienced. *Our room (702) had a balcony, which is great, but the balcony was shared with the rest of the floor. In other words, we could walk past all the other rooms from the outside and even see into the other rooms if the curtains were open. It made me a little uncomfortable, and made me double and triple-check that our balcony door was locked. We also never opened our curtains.*The shower didn't have a curtain or any sort of enclosure, which caused a lot of water to splash out of the shower and onto the floor. We used our extra towels as bath mats because there was so much water outside of the shower. Even the toilet paper rolls got wet because the water from the shower splashed out.*The only towel hooks in the bathroom were on the opposite end of the bathroom, so you had to walk out of the shower (and drip all over the bathroom) to get to the towel hooks. Hooks or even a towel bar could've easily been placed right by the shower (there was plenty of wall space in our room).*When we arrived back to the hotel one evening after a long day of sightseeing, we went to the bar ask for a bottle opener to open a bottle of Coke we had purchased. We stood at the bar for almost 10 minutes (no one was behind the bar, but there were plenty of patrons sitting at the bar). When the bartender finally arrived, we realized he had been standing outside the whole time and had seen us waiting there but never bothered to come in and even acknowledge us. That was our only poor service experience at this hotel.Despite the flaws, we would stay here again. The price, the location (close to a subway station), the cleanliness, and the great staff (front desk, at least) make it worth it to stay here again when we return to NYC.

We stayed at Wyndham gardens Chinatown for 4 nights in March 15. It was booked for us by friends as a gift as we travelled to NYC to get married at City hall (10 minute walk away - very convenient!). We arrived late from jfk on the Saturday night but there were staff at the front desk to check us in. Our room was on the 15th floor and the views uptown were incredible! Although the room was fairly small, it was clean and tastefully decorated, with floor to ceiling windows and a balcony that you could walk round to take in the Manhattan panorama! The staff were attentive and delivered flowers and champagne to our room (as organised by some friends) on the day of our wedding. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant one evening which was good, great noodle soup! Chinatown itself is a vibrant and interesting neighbourhood, and within a 15 minute walk to soho. All in all a wonderful hotel! I'd recommend it to anyone planning to stay in this area. Try booking a higher floor, for spectacular views!

Despite being a non-smoking hotel, the whole floor (level 5) and our room smelt like cigarettes. The room layout was quite awkward, there was a narrow hallway from the bathroom to the bed. The room itself was clean. The location wasn't as close to SOHO and the subway stations as expected. The area was completely dead after 10pm, but seemed relatively safe though late night dining was not an option. Grand (B-D line) station was the closest, though next time will return to either TRYP or Intercontinental for the A-C-E line.

This hotel is probably the newest thing in Chinatown by 10 years. The building is very modern. Our room was ready when we arrived (at 10 am), very pleasant surprise. The room was very, very nice, clean and while small it wasn't tiny by New York standards. We were on the 10th floor and street noise was a non-issue, very quiet. The subway was only a block away and it is very close to Little Italy and the East Village. Staff was helpful and friendly.

We arrived on a Friday night - nice room, but small. Queen bed. Lots of street noise - so remember to bring ear plugs. There was a fridge and a coffee maker in the room - that was nice. The bathroom was weird - it had a frosted glass door that was no opaque - and the shower was likely handicapped accessible - but it got water EVERYWHERE. Free wifi was nice. I likely would not choose to stay here again. I got a good deal on hotwire - so for the price it was okay.

We stayed 6 nights at Wyndham Chinatown. The room on the 15th floor had a fabulous view over NY and Manhattan. Though a bit small, the room had a really comfortable bed, a nice bathroom with shower and bath tub. The room was clean an fresh, an the hotell staff nice and helpfull. Also, the hotell is set in a good location for exploring NY. I hope to come back soon, 6 days is not enough for this exciting city!!

Good Points:1. The location is fantastic, it's only a couple of minutes from the subway station for easy access to the sites. Additionally it was a real novelty staying in the heart of Chinatown and the surrounding area was really nice.2. You really do get value for money at this hotel. I spent several days searching for a hotel that was of the quality of this one and at similar price range and I couldn't find anything. The decor throughout the hotel is stunning and it felt incredibly luxurious.3. I ordered room service several times during my stay and while the food was only of an average quality, the price was very competitive.Bad Points:1. The only negative, and it was only a minor one for me, was that if you're hoping for an early night then bring some ear plugs because the area is relatively noisy. But personally I think for the fantastic location some noise is worth it.

My wife and I stayed on the 15th floor with a balcony view of the city that you can walk around and pretty much see the entire city. We extended our stay an extra night at the front desk and got an even lower rate than we could find anywhere online. The walk to the stations and food was close and if you don't want to walk there's a restaurant and bar in the hotel food graded system from the city was an "A" highest you can get and it showed. The food and drinks are top quality and the service from every staff member was way up above what you would think for the city. They reminded me a lot of my neighbors next door down the road in a small town. There was on staff member, Rushika Perez, she went out of her way completely to help us with good places to go and making sure you got the most out of the hotel/NYC vacation I've always wanted for me and my wife. Think about laying in bed and opening your floor to ceiling windows and looking uptown with your beautiful wife. This hotel will remain our choice over every hotel in the city every time! See you guys again! Thank You,Thomas &Linnea P.

İ stayed at this hotel with friends.The hotel is located in Chinatown,NY City.The strret,Bowery which the hotel is located, does not have a nice look.The hotel is within walking distance to Little Italy,Soho and Financial District and 3 miles from Times Square.The hotel is brand new and the rooms are very nicely decorated with a moderate size.The staff are helpful.The breakfast room is in the basement floor with no street view but very clean.The breakfast is adequate.The reception area is quite small with little sitting area.İ would recommend this hotel for business and leisure stays.

We were traveling with my sister's family who required us to economize over our usual Midtown choice. After consulting TripAdvisor, decided to try this Wyndham hotel in Chinatown. We were not disappointed. Clean, quiet (quiet in the building - there was some street noise - car horns), comfortable. Responsive, friendly staff (actually much more friendly than you will find in larger hotels Uptown). $100 less per night compared to our favorite Midtown choice, Novotel. One thing to note - if you are sensitive to left-over cigarette smoke look elsewhere - this hotel's regular clientele appears to routinely ignore the no-smoking restriction. Our room had previously been occupied by a heavy smoker which the hotel promptly set about remedying. It didn't matter to us, but it may to you.The lower level restaurant for breakfast was a bit odd - my guess is it is independent of the hotel. Good price and food with very uneven, yet friendly service. Not busy. The "Cup and Saucer" diner nearby is a much better option (classic NYC diner - prompt, friendly service with good food at bargain prices). Excellent location for financial district, ChinaTown, Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn Bridge type of day. Several good restaurants nearby.In summary - if you are looking for a NY hotel bargain, this is it. The trade-off is spending more time commuting to sites on the subway (up to 60 extra minutes a day compared to staying in Midtown). My sister's children didn't mind.

I had never been to this part of town before and booked a suite with a seperate bedroom area as I was travelling with the wife and kids. The hotel itself is very new and nicely furnished, the fixture and fittings in the hotel are very high quality and the bathroom is very nice. The best thing about the hotel is the views. If you have a room high up you can see the skline of midtown. You can also take the elevator to the 19th floor roof and there is a terrace up there with spectacular views of the whole of Manhatten.My slight disappointment was the layout of the suite. When i travel with children i really want some privacy from the kids and there is no door between the bedroom and the living room in which the kids stay. Also, the bathroom door has gaps around it (and is frosted glass) so privacy in the bathroom is almost non existant. When you have a shower the room can get very steamy as well.Overall a good place and near to China town, Little Italy and SOHO

For a recent stay in NYC, we stayed here twice at the start and end of our trip. The rooms are spotless with one whole wall composed of a window making the room lovely and bright. The bathrooms are also a good size with one of them being v.bright due to a frosted window/wall into the bedroom creating natural light.Great shower in both rooms although bit of a splashback so had to use extra towels on the floor. Didn't use much of the amenities although the hairdryer was sufficiently good. Comfy big bed, good TV channels, interesting neighbourhood to walk out into and along to Littly Italy and Soho for delis or shopping; not much more I can say! Would definitely stay here again next time in NYC.

Needed a hotel near the SoHo area so we stayed at this Wyndham. Never had an issue with any Wyndham, didn't have one here either just came across a slight design flaw that had me shaking my head. First, very nice front desk staff. Friendly, helpful, accommodating. Everything you'd want in your front desk staff. Room was on the 12th floor, very small but comfortable. GREAT view of the Empire State Building. HOWEVER, the bathroom is what I'll remember. For starters, they have a huge frosted window in the bathroom! You can't see in but you can clearly see what the person is doing in the bathroom. PLUS, at 5am when the lights are off and your guest is trying to sleep they won't be asleep fr long when you put the bathroom light on. With the window there it lights the entire hotel room! Second, no shower door! There's a tiny glass partition but only on the shower head side. After my shower there was a huge puddle on the floor. I used three towels just sopping it up. They apparently are trying to be a boutique hotel with these designs, but it doesn't work. Ya gotta be practical too!
user_name:
Dlove72
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed 3 nights. Spotlessly clean modern hotel. Heart of Chinatown. Ordered room service and food was very good. Comfy bed and good bathroom. All round excellent value for money and would stay hear again

As the hotel goes, there's nothing to write home about, but if you're looking for somewhere clean, safe, well located and for a good price, this is an excellent choice.The rooms are small but of good quality, and the staff were helpful and friendly. No problems with the hotel at all.Easy walking distance to Lower East Side and right in Chinatown / Little Italy and well connected for the subway.

This is a nice, new hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful (where to eat, which elevator gets you to the fitness room, best way to get to the airport, etc). The only thing that drove me nuts is the European style shower. There is no door and no matter what you do, water gets all over the place. Other than this, we loved the location, the cleanliness and modern accommodations. We will stay again.

Was looking for a hotel in a prime location near SoHo and decided to stay at the Wyndham Chinatown. The front desk staff was extremely helpful, friendly and very attentive. Our room wasn't ready being we arrived 3 hours prior to check-in, but they offered to hold our luggage and personally deliver it to our room once it was ready. The room was nice, small as you'd expect in Manhattan, but it was perfect for our one night stay. We had a nice view of the skyline directly facing the Empire State building. I understand many hotels like to be trendy and hip with their design and decor, but I can't understand the design of the bathroom in our room. There was a huge window, although frosted, it still was odd and there was no door on the shower, so we practically flooded the joint while showering. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and it was the perfect location for our adventures in SoHo and Little Italy.
Great location and hotel.Service was outstanding and the Night manager was fantastic.Loved it my new go to hotel in NYC.

This was our first time and fellow reviewers suggested asking for an upper floor. We did just that and it was so worth it. Massy and Danielle are two of the most helpful and friendly desk staff I have ever encountered. They went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. It is so close to many awesome restaurants. Very clean and all the staff were friendly and professional. Definitely a place to return to.

This hotel is warm, clean, and comfortable. It is conveniently located near central NYC. The staff were welcoming and helpful when asked. Despite being in busy Chinatown, it is quiet. Overall, it is not cheap but I would go back.

This is a great location to be in N.Y. I brought my 14 y.o. son and he loved it. Rooms are not huge, but very clean which is more important. Central to everything. You can grab subway around the block and East Village, Chinatown and Little Italy are so close. I want to thank you guys for Room 1501 it was awesome with a balcony. Much love from Ca

Stayed at this very nice hotel for 3 nights. We arrived early and our rooms were ready when we got there around 12:00. There were 6 of us booked into 3 rooms. The rooms were on the small side but well appointed. Excellent views of the Empire State Building and city skyline. Our room was on the 10th floor. Very quiet clean hotel with comfortable beds. The only thing I can say was the shower door was not big enough to contain the water and it ended up on the floor. Free Wi fi was excellent. Very close to subway and Little Italy. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Check out was 12pm. Our luggage was stored on site for the day because our flight was not until late in the evening. We arrived back at the hotel after our final day of sightseeing picked up our luggage and had a car arranged by the hotel to take us to the airport. Excellent service!

We used this hotel for 3 nights while in New York and it was good. Very clean and modern. Free wifi which is always a plus. Staff very helpful at all times. They have a green policy and if you don't want towels changed each day you can hang them up but bathroom lacks hanging space for wet towels and that is the only little negative comment. Would return to this hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Really service minded staff and nice view from the room. Made a request for at least floor 10 and got 12. Got good info of "what to do" by the guy working at the bar. Definetly recomend this hotel.
Nice hotel just on the fringe of Chinatown and two blocks from Little Italy. Block and a half to the subway. Clean room, competent staff, highly recommended.

Stayed for four nights. Room on 15th floor, with shared balcony, and excellent views up The Bowery, with Empire State Building in full view night and day. Also saw the aftermath of the explosion in the East Village, and the billowing smoke.Right in the heart of Chinatown, which is ideal if that's your thing. Some brilliant dumpling houses nearby - $1 for 4 dumplings is a bargain lunch/dinner/snack. Little bit of street noise still, which didn't impact sleep once I had inserted my ear plugs. It's New York after all, so I don't expect it to be completely silent. Room extremely clean, very comfortable bed and pillows. Hotel itself seems quite new, and is handily placed for access to subway, with Grand Street Station just two blocks away. Bowery Station and Canal Street Station both ten minute walks, so the access to multiple lines means you can get pretty much everywhere quickly. Overall, excellent value for money, and would stay again.

I would definitely give ZERO for this hotel if i can. Front desk people's manners are so bad and rude. I have to ask them several times for every question. I will never book this hotel again. When two of my 16 year old son were waiting for me, they sent them out by considering they are not their customers. P.s. it was 2 degree Celsius outside

Good big and clean room, with good free wifi.Quality and price met.Subway station is near only 2 blocks.Many little chinese cafeshops near for breakfast!I recommend this hotel and i would choose this hotel next time when i visit New York!!

Great stay at the hotel room warm comfortable views were fantastic we had a room on the 11 floor. thank you to the manager who went out of his way to make our stay excellent.All the staff were helpful and freindly could not fault.

I was not happy with the location as a first timer to New York, would have preferred to be more up town, that is my only negative. Stayed 3 nights very good staff all helpful. Looks to have been recently refurbished to a high standard. Very nice room with a great view of the New York skyline. Once you know how to get around town its a great location. When I go back to NY I would consider staying again.

I stayed at this hotel, when visiting from the UK, with a friend for 5 nights. The hotel is only about 5 years old so, as you would expect, it's very modern on the outside and the inside. It certainly stands out in Chinatown anyways!All of the staff were very friendly, accommodating and gave good advice whenever you asked them. The hotel rooms were very modern, clean and they were average in size for New York. It's very unusual to have a 'big room' in New York.The area isn't fantastic but all of the locals are friendly enough and the hotel is a 5 minute walk to Canal Street Subway and from there there's multiple subway lines taking you to locations across New York. The subway is really cheap as well. We got a taxi home from Times Square, on St Patrick's Day evening after a few beers, and it cost 15USD including tip. I would expect it to be a lot more during the day with traffic. The hotel also arranged a taxi for us to Newark Airport for 79USD as the weather wasn't great - the bellman arranged this and the service was great and the transfer arrived 10 minutes early.We wanted to visit the Skyline Bar but this always seemed to be closed whenever we wanted to visit it.We also requested a high floor room as we wanted views of the Skyline and also we didn't want to be too low down as we were aware the traffic can be quite loud at all times of day! The hotel acknowledged our request and, thankfully, we were allocated room 1204 which was a twin room.I would certainly recommend this hotel to anybody staying in New York. Taking into consideration the rates on offer in comparison to a lot of other outdated hotels In New York, I wouldn't hesitate in returning.

Friendly service from the minute we walked in. They had to deal with an irate customer, but handled the situation well. The rooms for New York City were average in size. Rooms were equipped with regular amenities, and the bathrooms were elegant and modern. Only reason I wouldn't give my experience a 5 is because the city view bar was closed hours early for an employees birthday. Most definitely in bad taste. Would stay again.
I was greeted quickly by valet, staff was excellent and made great recommendations. Will visit again. Thank you for the wonderful experience.

We stayed for 5 nights in a 4th floor room. All was very nice. The location has excellent subway connections so you can travel easily in Manhattan. While the neighborhood is in Chinatown with its bustle and aromas - it is safe and quiet at night. The hotel has a nice bar and restaurant. Our room was reasonably sized and very well furnished. A lot of thought went into the details.While it was fairly new - some elements were not that functional. The shower control was not very well designed and not at all intuitive to either of us. The shower only has a half enclosure so that the floor gets fairly wet. The bathroom doesn't have a exhaust fan but only relies on the central HVAC system.The biggest issue was the traffic noise on our 4th floor as we faced Bowery. Get the highest floor that you can!!!All in all we had a wonderful stay and would return again without any hesitation...but would insist on a floor above the eighth!

Pros : Spacious rooms. Fantastic carpets , work desk and bed. Great Bathroom and linen .Cons; not well connected to Manhattan and canal street is a bit of a walk . Front desk can do with a lot of training to be more customer friendly .Housekeeping hadn't cleaned the room even though i had stayed for 2 days , but immediately sent up fresh towels when i had informed them Have not tried any of the in house restaurants hence no comments there
great room, clean, functional, location is super, if lucky, ask for a room at a higher floor for a spectacular NYC view!

We have stayed here before, and really like the hotel. The staff is very courteous, the location excellent and the rooms are clean and pleasant. It is in walking distance to the courthouses and excellent Chinese and Italian food. If you are a beer fan, visit One Mile House Bar on Delancy.My only suggestion is that visitors who require hand rails in the bathroom request a handicap bathroom. Able bodied guests will have no problem at all.

This is one amazing hotel. I noticed a number of reviewers use the word gem.,.. And it fits. This place sparkles...with outstanding staff attitude, excellent thinking-outside-the-box design, comfortable bed, and mindful touches. 15th floor has a shared balcony for that floor's half dozen rooms... And the floor to ceiling glass really delivers a breathtaking view of midtown. Makes your time at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown not just a stay but an event.

Great motel, very contemporary glass façade that sets it apart from its surroundings. Booked it through Hotwire, and once we got there we had only one bed, but preferred two. Janice and Rusheka (sp?) were very kind and upgraded the room at no charge, really without us asking. Great service! Since we were there early walked to Lombardi's (NY first pizza) only a few blocks a way - never a disappointment! Those looking for the eclectic there is a hidden bar very close called Apotheke (google it!) and about a mile north in the East Villiage is the famous very old McSorleys (light or dark beer only choices). Back to the motel, very clean, beds were great, had one of those modern half showers, not my preference because water gets all over the bathroom floor but still kind of cool. Over all a great stay and would definitely stay there again.

Had a nice stay, love the Chinatown area and walking distance to many wonderful sights. Little Italy, Financial District, Soho, Chinatown, Freedom Tower, Wall Street, etc. all close. Hotel has a 24 hour fitness center that is great. Did not try the restaurant there, so many choices in this area outside. Staff nice and friendly, my housekeeper, Fumarie, was especially attentive and pleasant.

My budget was limited and New York is expensive but after reading reviews, as always, I opted for the Wyndham Chinatown and I wasn't disappointed. Yes I could have stayed nearer to all the action, but to be honest the action is everywhere in New York and riding the subway is no issue. The staff at the hotel were really friendly and helpful, always taking time for a chat at the end of my day and being very helpful with directions and which buses/trains to catch. Although I ended up walking pretty much everywhere, if you like walking then it's probably the best way to explore New York. The room itself was clean and comfortable, small and compact but it had everything I needed except, which pretty much every hotel lacks, towel rails. All hotels want you to re-use towels but then don't provide adequate racks for drying etc. But that was it for me, as for quietness actually this hotel was pretty good but considering you're in New York, there is going to be noise, always take those earplugs with you and a good nights sleep should be guaranteed. Overall I would use this hotel again.
Based on the location, you would not expect to find a gem like this. Affordable rates, personable staff and comfortable accommodations. The view from a corner room on the 12th floor is breath taking.

It was a nice little hidden gem, affordable and quiet. Nice view. It would've been even better if there were shelving in the bathroom, an armchair and the on-site restaurant was in motion and good. I think these little improvements can generate a lot more business for the hotel and liven up the atmosphere.

We stayed at the Wyndham Chinatown for three days and had an amazing time, mostly because the staff really does go the extra mile for you. Very caring, attentive and polite. We loved the location of the hotel right in the middle of chinatown couple of blocks away from soho and Metro station Grand Street. We absolutely recommend this hotel, great staff, comfy beds, good location and price rate!

My wife and I are long time NY City residents who moved to Chicago two years ago. I had business in New York during the week and my wife met me for our first New York City weekend vacation. The Wyndham Garden Chinatown proved a perfect place for our stay. Reasonably priced, in a fun location that is central to Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, The Lower East side and East and West Villages. Nearby subway stops gave us easy access to the rest of the City. The hotel room while not large was roomier than many of those that I've stayed in, it was comfortable with a floor to ceiling window offering a lovely view of the New York. The staff could not have been nicer and always helpful.

Wyndham Chinatown has a convenient location, with lovely amenities and excellent staff. Danielle and Mossy at the front desk made sure to go out of their way during my birthday weekend stay. My boyfriend and I were upgraded to the 16th floor with an absolutely beautiful view of the city. The restaurant downstairs, Elevate, was delicious with great staff as well. I highly recommend this hotel, we will definitely be coming back for another stay!

We come to NYC several times a year for business, and like to stay in a different borough when we can. The location of this hotel was in Chinatown and we loved it! It was right next to Nolita, Soho, Little Italy and LES. The room was exceptionally clean and extremely comfortable. We had a wrap around balcony with a beautiful view of the city. The staff is extremely courteous as well, and go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. My wife had fallen ill on the day we were supposed to check out and we quickly made a decision to stay another night. Rather than make us move out of the room and check into another room, Vanessa quickly made the decision to upgrade us back into our original room (which was an upgrade) to make my wife feel more comfortable. I will totally stay here again and will recommend this hotel as well.
user_name:
Mickey W
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

review_body: My husband and I stayed here Feb 20-23 and it was great! The room was very comfortable and everything we saw at the hotel appeared new and clean. Our room was a bit on the small side, but really, we are on a budget and didn't spend much time in the room at all as we were out exploring! We were right across from the elevator so we were worried that there would be a lot of noise as people came and went, but we couldn't hear a thing! As well, because we were on a lower floor, we thought there would be a lot of street noise, but again, we couldn't hear anything! The staff we encountered were very friendly and courteous. The location was great - really close to lots of delicious Chinese restaurants as well as about a block away from the nearest subway station. We will definitely keep this place in mind when we are planning our next trip to New York!

I've been staying here an average of 40 times a year for the past three years - I think they've been open only 5 years now. Best views of midtown. You're in the middle of Chinatown and Little Italy is a 4 minute walk. Just about every subway line is within minutes B,D,N,Q,R,6,J,Z I can easily get to the hotel from just about anywhere in Manhattan and go anywhere in Manhattan just as easily.

Well actually I have to amend the title. The lobby was cold. However since the temperatures in NYC were below freezing for our entire stay, I forgave them. Upon entry a friendly greeting and quick professional service. This attitude was shared by all of the staff from housekeeping to the restaurant. Special praise must go to Rushika and Danielle at the front desk who were both very helpful. We used the restaurant only for breakfast. The French toast was the best my wife and I have ever had. They also have a happy hour for an afternoon drink with great prices. There is also a small bar in the lobby. The room while small was well furnished and equipped, it even had a small fridge. The shower was forceful with plenty of hot water. There was some street noise but you're in NYC. Great location for exploring Chinatown, Little Italy, and lower Manhattan. Excellent al around value.

Shopping and location ! Location ! I'm sure come spring We will be there! Everyone was so nice! However we had balcony room that we couldn't use due to snow and the room was so cold we turn up heat still cold. We do plan to go again and agin because I'm sure they will fix the problem and be the 5 star hotel at a fair price!

While I was having a dinner party with my friends family, I received a voice mail from the airlines advising me that my flight has been cancelled for the next morning. Feeling a bit stressed by this, I proceeded to check online with my travel site to search for another hotel, because the one that I was in, was okay. But, I didn't want to pay the full amount, just to extend my stay one more night. The view from my window, I could see the Wyndham Garden and how beautiful and new it was. So, I checked to see if there was a rate for this hotel. Success, I found the rate that I was willing to pay and booked it right away. Now, all I have to do is pack up and move across the street.Well, my room was not ready, however, I left my bag with the Wyndham and proceeded to enjoy my day in the freezing cold of 19 degrees of New York City, on my unexpected, extended stay in the Big Frozen Apple. The room: absolutely gorgeous. At first thought, I could have kicked myself for not staying here first. Four panels of Ceiling to Floor Glass Windows that framed a perfect view of the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, and all of its neighboring landmarks, like the Citibank Bldg. The bathroom is spacious and roomy by any standards also fashioned with a Ceiling to Floor Window pane, that shares the similar view as the main sleeping/sitting area.Everything is well decorated with a touch of Chinese Art. Nice comfortable bed, sitting chair at the desk and the sitting chair in the corner under the wall mounted television. I can't say enough about this room and the hotel. It's just too bad I only enjoyed it for a few television and sleeping hours. I would've loved to explore this hotel and wanted to see the rooftop bar. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

This was my second stay at this hotel. I spent 9 days here eight months earlier, and was impressed enough to say that whenever possible, this would be my NYC home going forward. With that in mind, I booked a quick 4 night trip over the Presidents Day weekend.Upon check in, the front desk clerk looked up at me at said "welcome back." She had recognized my face from my previous stay. She couldn't remember my name initially, but caught on as I began to say it. Check in was a breeze, and that was a great way to start off the trip. The queen room was clean and comfortable, and was a good size for a Manhattan hotel room.My main previous issue with the rooms at this hotel was the shower setup, which resulted in a fair amount of water collecting on the floor. That's an issue that won't get solved anytime soon. This time around, there were two things that annoyed me to the point that I could only give a 4 star rating this time around. The first issue was the water temperature in the shower. On some of the coldest days in the winter, the water temperature at whatever time I took a shower was downright tepid. It meant for some quick showers and a fair amount of shivering afterwards. Not good when the air and wind chill temperatures were 0 to -10F (-15 to -25C). My next door neighbour indulged twice in room service, and when done, left his dish tray out in the hallway. Both times, the trays were left in the hallway for more than 4 hours, as they were there when I left my room and still there when I came back. It really isn't all that appealing seeing someone's half eaten meal staring at you. All in all, I'll still come back here. The location is still convenient enough to everywhere you would want to get to on the subway.

last minute booking for my trip to the city. the hotel lobby was inviting and clean. staff were very friendly. The one bedroom we stayed in was compact but very clean. hotel located in NY Chinatown and a few block to little Italy. subway station was a block away. lots of food and shops nearby.

Everything about this place is new, crisp and tasteful. The bed was outrageously comfortable. Great views of lower Manhattan from my corner room. Only downside was that the restaurant/bar was closed for renovation. This will likely be my go to place for visiting my son and taking in a few museums and galleries.

The room was well furnished and the bathroom was nicely tiled. A Lot of extra towels were ready. The water pressure was great. Hot water was available on demand. The staff was very friendly and they continued to be friendly after we left.

stayed for 3 nights.hotel was fairly new.location great for walking around the village.only problems were the restaurant/room service was closed and the shower door is only a half glass so the water ends up all over the floor.they did have a continental type breakfast in a conference room but it didn't seem like anybody was maintaining it.would definitely stay there again.
It was a very nice, clean facility. The staff was very friendly and helpful.It was my first trip to "The Big Apple" and loved being part of "the melting pot"

It is located near a diverse group of restaurants and neighborhoods. Since it is in Chinatown Noodletown is right down the block, Les Crepes in the Lower East Side is a few blocks east, and Pancere in Little Italy is 2 blocks west. A lot of the restaurants near there are even open late. The hotel is clean and modern. Small like the usual NYC hotel room. I took of a star because the hotel's restaurant and lounge "Elevate" was closed for some reason during the weekend of our stay. Would have loved to see the view.

My friends and I (there were 4 of us) stayed in one room from Dec 3, checked out on Dec 8, and were very happy with the beds and the comfort of the room. The bathroom was clean, though the shower panel is too narrow that water goes everywhere. Ask for a lot of bath mats. We were on the 3rd floor on the Hester St side, but did not find any problems with street noise levels. The hotel is very well located with a 5 min walk to the Grand St station and a 10 min walk to the Canal St station. Also, it's a 5 min walk to Little Italy. Our stay was even made more pleasant by the lady who cleaned our room, Kumarie. She made sure that all our needs were seen to (e.g., bath mats). And the lady at the front desk, Janice, was lovely, too. She was very helpful with our questions about the area.

We stayed in this hotel for a change of pace as compared to the normal areas of New York for tourists.... The staff was exceptional, be prepared to walk to the subways but with in a 10 minute walk... In Chinatown close to Little Italy.... I would certainly stay again

Stayed here for a week in October for work. The location is excellent if you are in or around Wall St or like me needed to get to Jersey City. It was a 15min walk to either the Path or the ferry. My room was really nicely decorated and had great amenities. The only small is was the shower, water tended to spray over the floor which was a pain. There's a bar on the 20 something floor with great views up Manhattan. There's also a small but perfectly formed gym. I would stay here again. It was value for money.

Wyndham Garden was exactly what we needed. As we often go to the city from CT, the intimate environment, location and view this hotel provides we have found our home away from home. Clean, convenient and reasonably priced.

The hotel it self is smart and modern, the rooms are clean and nicely decorated, the reception staff were very helpful, the only problem for us was the location, and probably the time of year as it was -4 and not an ideal place to wonder around while freezing !! It has a roof top bar which although small it does offer a fantastic view of the city. The downstairs restaurant serves as you would expect sushi type menus, which I didn't mind but the wife found it hard to pick a meal as there wasn't much vegetarian choice or regular meals, breakfast meals were limited as well in our opinion. Sorry to say but not the best we've stayed at,

I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown back in September for 5 nights and, having stayed in many hotel in the NYC area, I can safely say that this one is my absolute favourite! I had stunning views on the 8th floor of the gorgeous NYC skyline, I kept my curtains open throughout the evening just so I could wake up to that beautiful view! Seeing the Empire State building all lit up and gorgeous just before you fall asleep is just incredible and a view I will never forget. I know many people have mentioned about the bathrooms having a frosted glass panel letting light in from the room into the bathroom, and to be honest, it never bothered me. In fact, I wouldn't mind my bathroom at home looking like that! The bathroom was brand new with a wonderful shower and was light and spacious thanks to that frosted glass wall.  Even the cleaning staff were lovely! I got speaking to one lovely lady when I popped back to drop off some shopping before popping back out to see a show and she was absolutely lovely and had nothing but lovely things to say about the hotel, which is always a good sign! She did say that next time I should try and get a corner room as they have even BETTER views (if there is such a thing!) so I shall keep that in mind for my inevitable next visit. Transportation is excellent with Grand St Subway station about 50m away from the hotel front doors and there is an abundance of good food around the Little Italy area which I shall 100% utilise properly next time. The only slightly negative point that I had was that the restaurant on site wasn't the best (and I'm not really picky about food) but if that's the worst thing about the hotel, my goodness they're not doing badly at all! All in all, I absolutely ADORED my stay at the Wyndham Garden Hotel and I'm missing NYC already. Well done Wyndham Garden Hotel, I'm sure you'll be seeing me again very soon!

I stayed in the Wyndham Garden Chinatown in New York during the period January 6 to 12, 2015. The hotel is situated in a central place with many restaurants and shops close by. The China Town is full of shops selling Chinese goods at very reasonable rates. I had a wonderful view of the city from my room on the 11th floor. We had our training programme on the 17th floor with a beautiful view of the NYC. The hotel room, though not very specious, was just fine for a single person. The maintenance and facilities offered were quite good. The bar downstairs seemed to be a popular joint for the guests as it was always found crowded.

Stayed here for 9 nights with my partner. It's in a great location with cheap eateries all around you as well as little Italy and soho close by that you can walk to. There are also subway stops a few minutes walk that you can use to save money on cabs. The room we stayed in was small but I expected that. Bed was really comfortable to sleep in. Not sure if it was just our room but our shower would fill up with water which was really annoying and the glass panel which barely closes off allows water to go out and onto the floor. This wasn't nice. If I stayed here again I would choose a room with a view of the Empire State, I stayed on floor 6. The hotel is great value and you won't find a better price for location and quality of room. I still have not received my security deposit of $50 back on my credit card. It's frustrating that the hotel doesn't have an email I can email them on about it as I can't call since I'm still travelling and not using the service on my phone.

Stayed here for 1 night for my bday & I wish I would have stayed longer! Hotel looks very futuristic. Views are amazing, very clean & classy! Service is great! The way the hotel was built amazes me, with windows surrounding the whole place! Low price for a NYC hotel, this place is a gem! Location is close to many shopping destinations. Just great, would absolutely stay here again. This is now my goto hotel when I visit NYC! Good job!

You didn't hear this from me. But there is an employee named Vanessa. Who made my trip worth every penny. Her customer service was out standing. If every hotel mimicked this girl professionalism Hotel Hospitality and Customer Services would be more appreciated. I was given a great view of the city and expect to make this hotel home anytime I am in New York. She idolizes the Hotel experience of what guest should feel when they are visiting from out of town. I was very pleased.

Clean rooms. Expansive views of the city from lower Manhattan from balcony. Lounge on 18th is a wall of windows. Only a block from little Italy and a few blocks from financial district. 2 blocks to subway lines, no trouble after dark walking to subway or little Italy. Great place if you want to stay out of the tourist areas.

The front desk staff was very patient, cheerful and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is clean and attractive, relatively inexpensive and located within an easy walk of several good (as opposed to famous) restaurants, mid-range shopping and bakeries for a quick breakfast. The neighborhood feels safe, even at night. This was my second stay, and I will be back again.
The heat in my room didn't work I froze all night.I should have received a credit for another evening or got a very good discount. Also, I was told the valet parking was free and I was misinformed.

My two friends and I stayed her for four days. The staff was very friendly and the site was extremely clean. The location was great as well. However, we did encounter a few problems during our stay. We had to call and complain about our room be freezing three times before someone finally figured out the problem. We also ordered from the restaurant downstairs and the food was horrible!!But again, the staff was very friendly and the location is great!
It was very relaxing, the people were extremely nice. The room was very clean and had a comfortable sleep. Would definitely go again.

Absolutely wonderful stay. The hotel was very clean & inviting, The restaurant had wonderful food and it was nice to be able to order in and have it delivered to the room. The balcony view was great. Our room very clean, comfortable, accommodating and stylish. Every staff member we came into contact with whether at the front desk, the cleaning women or anyone, they were always polite and welcoming. If we needed anything and called to the front desk our requests were handled professionally and very quickly. It was nice to be able to go to the lounge to unwind after a day of walking and sight seeing. The beer was cold and the bartender (Paris) was a great conversationalist. Can't say enough good things about our stay here.

In China town which is great if you like really good Chinese Food. The hotel is the best I have stayed at in NY for the budget. Nothing to complain about provided you arrive with expectations of a mid range functional hotel. Everyone friendly. What's not to like.

After city chaos From the new year me and my fiance flew to New York City for our anniversary. Overall Hotel was great. The staff was wonderful. I was on the 9th floor with a view of the Empire State Building. Unfortunately the top floor restaurant and roof access was closed due to maintenance so I didn't get to enjoy the brisk cold weather of New York City (lol). the bar downstairs was crowded so we decided to go out to Canal Street for dinner. THANKS FOR EVERYTHING

Our stay at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown Hotel on January 9th was very Enjoyable. Janice at the front desk was so helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. Thanks again and we will definitely return.!!!
Was part of a wedding party, got a great deal, and the view from the 10th floor is fantastic! Staff was also very friendly and location was close to everything

We were perfectly nice welcomed and loved our small but functional room. The views you have from the 16th floor are breathtaking! If you like being downtown in the SoHo and Co. area this should be your choice for it is more than worth what they charge.

My husband and I stayed on the 12th floor of the Wyndham Garden Inn last weekend for a 4-day NYC getaway. The location was perfect for us: very close to the Subway and walking distance to lots of great restaurants in Chinatown and the Lower East Side, as well as shopping in Soho. I booked the handicapped accessible room because the website said "Manhattan view." The room had a view of the financial district, which was quite pretty at night. We stopped in the 18th floor bar (seemed to only be open on the weekend) and saw the midtown view which was even better. The sound-proofing was excellent; despite the busy street below, we heard very little of it. My only complaint was that the handicapped accessible room was not very convenient for non-wheelchair-bound people. The shower head was really low- my husband couldn't stand up under it - and water sprayed everywhere in the bathroom because there was no shower curtain and the glass of the shower stall was not wide enough. TipL The floor to ceiling windows are amazing, but they're not tinted from the outside! When we walked on the street below we were treated to a sight of a man just out of the shower. Be sure to close the curtains if you plan on being in your birthday suit in front of those windows.
user_name:
N2911XCelihl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The moment we arrived, we were given a heartwarming welcome. Janice and Rushika took right to our sons. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay, again, if ever in the city.

Recently stayed at Wyndham Garden from December 27th - January 4th.We stayed on the 8th floor, the room was perfect and modern. Great size bed and very clean. Also a good size TV and free wifi! The location was perfect for us. A way from the hustle and bustle, but a stones throw away from Brooklyn Bridge, Little Italy and Soho. Some amazing streets such as Mulberry and Grand Street. It's the heart of New York and you get to feel how the true New Yorkers live. Its only around 10 minutes on the subway to Times Square too. Also we noticed that on the 19th floor there is a breathtaking view of the whole city! It's a rooftop terrace so simply go up in the elevator and check it out :)Would highly recommend Wyndham Garden Hotel and if we ever come back to New York this is where we'll be staying! Friendly and helpful staff too! Thanks guys!!

I had been planning a stay at the hotel for around 9 months and have been in contact with the General Manager (Danielle) for a few months. I wanted to propose to my girlfriend of 9 years and Danielle helped me make the occasion so special.Our room was clean and tidy, also our view was amazing over looking the Empire State building. The location is brilliant as its only a few stops on the train to any place we wanted to go. There is also a lot to do surrounding the hotel as its in Chinatown but also little Italy and Soho are both in walking distance. We can't stress enough how helpful Danielle was and how welcome she made us feel, also to her colleagues especially Rushika Perez who was an absolute delight on arrival and departing the hotel. All staff were great and I could not recommend this hotel enough. Team Wyndham!!

Stayed here for 1 night on way home Very clean hotel pleasant helpful staff and beds were comfortable Everything you needed in room and free wi fi Would definately stay again if in New York Ideally situated for lots of restaurants

I found the hotel on Travelzoo/, and my husband and I decided to to to the city and stay overnight for a change. The deal was so good that my sister in law reserved a room too. Staff was very courteous and prompt. Rooms were clean and cozy. Hopped a cab to Times Square for less than $20. Took a late night walk through Little Italy. Definitely coming back here again.

Once again, We had an excellent experience staying at the Wyndham Garden Chinatown! Janice and Katie are so kind and accommodating - I have stayed here several times and have always had great service from the front desk to the house cleaning. The rooms are very clean and the location couldn't be better. I highly recommend this Hotel!

We stayed one night to celebrate our Anniversary. We would have stayed longer but our special day just so happens to fall right between Christmas and New Years so the prices are ridiculous. The hotel is beautiful! Very clean and modern. Awesome location. The rooms are small but they are immaculate and gorgeously decorated. Besides, who goes to NYC and stays in their room??The only bad thing I have to say is that upon check-in I was told that we had the option of going with the room I booked which had a balcony or we could get a room a few floors higher with no balcony and a king bed instead of a queen. We wanted the better view so we chose the higher up room (the view was incredible, btw!). I asked if they were the same price since I had already dropped close to $300 for the original room at which point I was informed that this was an upgrade so we were actually getting a better deal. I don't know how getting a slightly bigger bed and losing the balcony is an upgrade but whatever.. Also I gave them my credit card for "incidentals" and they charged $50 to it upon check in. It's still pending so hopefully it will disappear in the next day or so. I would have appreciated being told that this was going to happen. Staff was very pleasant and both check in and check out was fast and efficient. We didn't get to go to the rooftop lounge since it was closed but we did have a few drinks at the bar in the lobby. Drinks were good and reasonably priced. Bartender was great.

all i can say is that i came in the hotel and waited 2hrs to get to my room because there was a problem i guess with the toilet, but Massy the frontdesk guy helped us and checked on us the whole time to make sure we were doing fine, which made our wait a lil better, if u do come to this place look for Massy very confident and straight up hmmmm maybe a lil funny too, but all your questions will be answered with confidence, hell make you feel comfortable as soon as u talk to him so look for him when you do choose this place ask him all the questions you need to know about new york..uhhmmm maybe not all of them XD..enjoy your visit ;)
user_name:
Charlie B
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: The hotel is exactly between Chinatown and Little Italy. Just cross the street and have a coffee in Little Italy.We were little bit concerned about the location but were pleasantly surprised to see a lot of young people on streets,in the restaurants around.The hotel is new, clean and comes with a beautiful top roof bar and terrace.We enjoyed a drink on top and the view of the city.Great hotel.Can recommend to anyone.

Almost starkly modern, well-appointed rooms even seem a bit larger than average for New York—although a few hooks and racks for coats and towels might help; sometimes designers sacrifice practicality to the too clean line. We were there the week before Christmas, but another time of year we might have enjoyed the outdoor lounge with views. The free wi-fi worked well, but asked you to login in seemingly on each use. Two elevators were more than adequate; never any waiting. But for me, the surprising pleasure was location. We visit New York a few times a year and always use subways. At this location, you have your pick: a block away from the D (with transfer to the F or a quick trip to West 4th ) and a few blocks from the 6, you have your pick: midtown, west-side, east-side, all the different places I wanted to go were easy. And locally, within a 10-minute walking radius this somewhat gritty but rapidly changing neighborhood offers great coffee and food choices (it’s not just Chinese anymore): far more varied than midtown or the Empire State Bldg. area, for example.
